loans.name: Asucena Mavila

texts.en:
Asucena Mavila C. U. owns a general store and a business raising pigs and preparing ham. She lives in the town of Salpo, high in the Andes of the La Libertad Region. She has ten years of experience preparing her ham. She is very busy from May to September preparing for the Fiesta Patronal where she does a lot of business.

Asucena is 43 years old, married and has three children. She works hard so her children can study and have the opportunity to become professionals. She enjoys building relationships and working with her family.

A member of the community bank Virgen de Las Mercedes, Asucena is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with rice, beer, oil, candy, and more.

loans.use: She will use the loan to restock her store with rice, beer, oil, candy, and more.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en:
K. Mamlakat is 46 years old. She is married with 5 children.

Fifteen years ago, Mamlakat decided to start her own business with the purpose of improving the economical position of her family. She is a hard-working woman. Before having this business she had a job where she washed clothing, but it didn't generate sufficient income to cover her basic needs, and that was the main impetus to start her own business. Mamlakat is a market vendor. She has been selling shoes for kids and women in the local market. Her daughter helps her with the business. The husband of Mamlakat was unemployed for a long time, and not too recently he left for Russia to earn money. Therefore, Mamlakat’s business is currently the main source of income for supporting her family.

Now it is summer and Mamlakat is planning to purchase the new summer shoes for kids and women in order to increase the range of goods of her business. With this purpose she requests $ 700 US Dollars for a term of 9 months. Mamlakat thanks all for support and promises to repay the loan in time. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.use: Purchasing of the summer shoes to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married, and has four children. All of her children currently attend school. Rose sells raw rice and charcoal in her village, and has been doing so for 10 years. Rose would like to use the loan to purchase more bags of rice and charcoal, to increase her inventory and income to enable her children’s continued education. She believes that this loan would help her save for her children’s future.

Rose is a member of the group called Queens. Members support one another in repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and charcoal

loans.name: Wile

texts.en:
Wile is married with two children, aged eight and three years old. She has been selling clothing since 2007. Every day she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Wile now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Hap

texts.en:
Mrs. Hap S., 56 years old, raises pigs as well as distilling and selling khmer wine. Her husband, Mr. Vann Di, 56 years old, is a fisherman. He fishes around Tunle Sap Lake. Hap has eight children, five of whom are married. Their two single sons are construction workers, living in Dan Ronn Commune in the Siem Reap Province.

Hap requests a loan of US$300 to purchase pig food and spend on farmland plowing and to purchase a fishing boat for her husband's fishing business. The loan will help increase their businesses' income, which support the family's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase pig food and spend on farmland plowing

loans.name: Rashidat

texts.en: Rashidat M. sells smoked and frozen fish. She has been in this business for the past six years. Rashidat buys cartons of fish from the market. She has sales girls that assist her in smoking the fish on a fire. She pays the girls weekly. Rashidat is the lady standing in the photo, and the others are her sales girls. Rashidat has a shop where she sells fish; she also has a deep freezer for selling some frozen fish to those who prefer it. Rashidat needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more cartons of fish to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of more cartons of fish to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Mey Khorn's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of seventeen members, is located in Boeng Tranh Village in Takeo Province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Mey K. is the village bank president and she is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets. She will use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food to feed her pigs. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions after she sells the new pigs. Mrs. Mey K. is a 62-year-old widow with a child who is a taxi driver, who can make a small income to support the famiL..

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainL. end-of-term loans. Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and purchase pig food to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is married and has four dependents. She has received no formal education. Comfort sells coal pots which are used as a stove for cooking. She also sells aluminum pots and cake baking containers at Abura market, which she has done since 1990. Her husband is a security man. Comfort uses her income to pay for her childrens' school fees, utility bills and other expenses. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more coal pots and other aluminum containers for resale to meet its high demand in the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to reinvest to further expand the business.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase more coal pots and other aluminum containers for resale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet A. sells Ogogoro, a local gin. She started her business in 2007 and hopes to expand. She is 49 years old and a widow with 3 children. Juliet needs a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more Ogogoro to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more Ogogoro (local gin) to sell

loans.name: Phuong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Phượng    năm nay 27  tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con nhỏ tại thị trấn Quán Hành huyện Nghi Lộc tỉnh Nghệ An. Năm 2007 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư thêm vào của hàng ăn của gia đình. Hiện tại cả hai vợ chồng chị đều tham gia kinh doanh hàng ăn với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư thực phẩm và một đồ dùng phục vụ cho công việc kinh daonh hàng ăn cảu gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong Thi N. is a 27 years old woman. She is living with her husband and three children in Quan Hanh town, Nghi Loc, Nghe An. In 2007, she joined the TYM fund and borrowed money to expand her family's street restaurant. At the moment, the couple only focus on this business, which generates income of 3,000,000 VND per month. Mrs. N. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 VND to buy more food and some kitchen equipments.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food service

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” del centro poblado de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con 02 hijos a su cuidado, posee estudios de superior completa (enfermería técnica) 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02  años, ella refiere que su negocio es la compra y venta de mallas para pesca; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mas mallas para comercializarlos en las ferias de Pilcuyo 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1700.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a paga en 05 cuotas mensuales; dicho préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir hilo nylon y sogas para la confección de mallas de pesca de manera artesanal. Con las ganancias ella pretende construir su casa en el distrito de Ilave, asimismo apoyar la educación de sus hijos. 
Ella se muestra agradecida a Manuela Ramos y a su personal por todo lo que vienen haciendo en favor de las mujeres.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” community bank of Chipana, in the district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, in the Department of Puno. She is 29 years old, married and has two children in her care. She completed her Nursing degree. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her business is buying and selling fishing nets. Her first loan was for S/ 300 soles which she used to buy more nets to sell in the markets of Pilcuyo. She will use this S/ 1,700 soles loan she will buy nylon string and rope to hand-make fishing nets. With the profits she intends to build a home in the district of Ilave as well as support her children's education. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos and its employees for all they have done to help women.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nylon string and rope to make fishing nets by hand.

loans.name: Maria Monica

texts.es:
La microempresaria María Mónica C. M. ha trabajado en la costurera por más de 30 años, y hace 8 años empezó con su propio taller de costura.  Ella ya ha recibido varios préstamos y tiene una historia como clienta buena.  Sobre los años, ha usado los préstamos para aumentar su negocio.  Actualmente, tiene siete máquinas de coser de varios estilos y capacidades, como una que forra botones, algunas eléctricas y una mecánica, esta última le permite trabajar cuando no hay energía eléctrica.  Además, ella tiene una empleada y su hija trabajando por ella y tiene una base de clientes establecida que la conocen y vienen a pedir ropa y cosas como mosquiteros.  

María tiene 58 años y es madre soltera de 8 hijos ya grandes.  En general, la mayoría de su trabajo viene de los uniformes escolares.  Pero porque la época de uniformes ya pasó, ella pide este préstamo para seguir aumentando su negocio, y esta vez va a invertir en tela blonda para hacer mosquiteros de varios tamaños y colores.  Hay mucha demanda por los mosquiteros y ella quiere comprar 100 yardas de tela blanda a US$ 4.00 la yarda para ser preparada para la demanda alta del verano.
texts.en:
Small-businesswoman María Mónica C. M. has worked in sewing for more than 30 years, and 8 years ago she opened her own sewing shop. She has received several loans and has a good record as a client. Over the years, she has used the loans to grow her business. Currently, she has seven sewing machines of various styles and capabilities; such as one for covering buttons, some electrical, and one mechanical. The mechanical one allows her to work when there is no electricity. She also has an employee and her daughter working for her and she has an established client base of people who know her and come to her to request clothing and items such as mosquito nets. María is 58 years old and is a single mother to 8 children, all of whom are grown. In general, the majority of her work is for school uniforms. Even though the time of year for uniforms has passed, she is requesting this loan so that she can continue growing her business. This time she is going to invest in cotton fabric of various sizes and colors. There is a lot of demand for mosquito nets and she wants to buy 100 yards of fabric at $4.00 per yard so that she can be prepared for the high demand in summer.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

video.title: Maria Monica - Kiva entrepreneur from  Nicaragua

loans.use: To buy 100 yards of fabric for mosquito nets.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Amivi K.  est une dame mariée avec 03 enfants, son mari est un soudeur, elle-même fait le commerce de charbons de bois, le charbon de bois est très utilisé par ceux qui n’ont pas de moyens pour s’acheter du gaz pour la cuisson, elle vend en détail et en gros à ses clients. La demande actuelle de sa clientèle est grande,pour pouvoir y satisfaire convenablement elle sollicite un crédit auprès de WAGES pour l’achat de sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Amivi K. is a married women with three children. Her husband is a welder. She herself does commerce in charcoal, which is much used by those who lack the means to buy propane for cooking. She sells at both the retail and wholesale levels. The current demand from her customers is high. To satisfy them approrpriately, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Greetings from Angelique M. in Rwamagana, Rwanda!  Angelique has recently completed repayment of her first loan from Vision Finance Company.  She is now requesting a second loan worth 500,000 Rwandan Francs to be repaid on a monthly basis over eight months.  

Angelique owns a general store in Rwamagana, in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.  She employs two people to help her with her shop.  She intends to use the loan to buy more sacks of sugar and rice to sell in smaller quantities to her customers.  As basic cooking ingredients, those two items are her fastest sellers and she is sometimes unable to carry enough in stock to meet her customers' demands.  

Angelique is 39 years old and married.  She has seven children between the ages of 18 and 5.  She plans to use the profits from her business to buy more food for her family.

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат-39 лет.Замужем,мать 5-х детей.Занимается откормом и купля-продажей скота.Муж Каромат имеет достоточно большой опыт в этой сфере и помогает ей.Каромат хочет купить на новый займ дойную корову и за счёт продажи молока и сметаны расширить свой товорооборот.Она кредитуется у нас больше 1 года и благодарна нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов. Всем своим соседям и знакомым,которые занимаются бизнесом и нуждаются в дополнительных денежных средствах она рекомендует кредитоваться в  нашей организации.
texts.en:
Karomat is a 39-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of five children. She raises, buys and sells cattle. Karomat's husband has considerable experience in this area and he assists her. With the new loan, Karomat wants to buy a milk cow and increase the variety of products she offers with the sale of milk and cream. She has been a client of MicroInvest for more than a year, and with the loan assistance has been able to realize her plans. She refers all her neighbors and acquaintances, who are in business and in need of funding, to MicroInvest for loan assistance.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou D. est une commerçante qui sollicite son premier crédit pour renforcer sa cantine.  Chaque matin et chaque soir, Madame D. prépare de la sauce et des haricots pour faire les sandwiches qu’elle vend au bord de la route dans son quartier.  Son entreprise est située à coté d’une école primaire. Les élèves mangent chez elle pour le petit déjeuner, le déjeuner, et les goutées.  Elle a fait cette activité depuis trois ans et elle n’a jamais sollicité un prêt.  Cependant, elle est tombée malade et elle a arrêté le travail pendant un peu de temps.  Alors, pour redémarrer son activité, elle voudrait un prêt avec lequel elle va acheter tout les ingrédients dont elle a besoin.  Elle est mariée, et elle a commencé cette entreprise pour aider dans les dépenses familiales.   Elle habite à Mbour, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.
texts.en:
Ms. Aissatou D. is a merchant who is requesting her first loan to bolster her cantine. Each morning and evening, she makes some sauce and beans to make the sandwiches that she sells on the roadside in her area. Her enterprise is located next to the primary school. The children have breakfast, lunch, and after-school snacks at her stall. She has been in this business for three years has never sought a loan. However, she fell ill and halted work for awhile. So, to start up again, she would like a loan, with which she will buy all the ingredients she needs. She is married, and she started this enterprise to help cover family expenses. She lives in Mbour, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods for her cantine

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 51 years old, married with 9 children who are at their adult-age already. The family has been in the fishing business for 20 years now. They had availed the 3rd loan cycle amounting to 3,500 pesos for the building of a fishing boat. The estimated monthly income is 5,500.

They were so thankful for Paglaum because of the opportunity they had made through their financing scheme. The couple is praying to have a good catch so they can save for the future, make a living and pay their obligation without delay.

loans.use: To purchase materials for building a fishing boat

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 23-year-old single man. In 2006, he decided to open a new business; that is when he came up with the idea of a barbershop, which he then called "Ali's Salon". Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new chairs for his salon to be able to attract a wider range of clientele and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy new chairs

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Genevieve A. sells cosmetics, clothing and jewelry in Hohoe's central market. Genevieve has received a junior high education.  She is married and has four dependents. Genevieve has been selling cosmetics and jewels since 2000. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics, clothing and jewelry at wholesale and at retail. She hopes to invest back the new profit from her business.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics, clothing and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Rustica

texts.en: Rustica C. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 63 years old, is widowed, and has four adult children. Rustica owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Rustica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Rustica is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Sy Tum Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en: Fourteen people who all live in Chheu Teal village in Takeo province comprise the village bank loan. Mrs. CH. Sy T. is the village bank president selected by the members. She is a silk weaver in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silks to weave. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with the loan. Her husband, Mr. Chum ChH., owns a small piece of land (0.2 hectare) to cultivate rice. Mrs. CH. Sy T. is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom attends the local school and one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more silks to weave.

loans.name: Juana Rosmery

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana tiene 33 años, esta casada con el Sr. hernan Villarroel por 11 años, por el momento no tienen hijos, pero desean en un tiempo tener unos dos, una niña y un niño.

La Sra. Juana se dedica a la lecheria desde hace 11 años, aprendio de su madre, quien le enseño todo sobre el cuidado del ganado lechero, ella empezó poco a poco a comprar su ganado y ahora cuenta con 3 vacas lecheras. Ella produce queso, su producto es de muy buena calidad. Vende el el mercado de la zona.

Requiere del dinero para comprar una vaca lechera mas, lo que incrementara su produccion de leche para poder producir mayor cantidad de queso para la venta y asi mejorar sustantivamente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is 33 years old and has been married to Sr. Hernan Villaroel for 11 years. At the moment, they do not have children but would like to have two of them, a girl and a boy.

Sra. Juana has been working on a dairy since she was 11 years old. She learned everything from her mother, who taught her how to care for the dairy cows. She began buying her own cows over time and she now has three of them. She produces high-quality cheese, which she sells in the area market.

Sra. Juana is requesting a loan to buy another dairy cow. This will increase her milk production so that she can produce more cheese for sale and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase another dairy cow

loans.name: Cate's Group

texts.en: Cate B. is a group leader.  She is a 60-year-old lady and a widow with four children between 28 and 35 years old. She is a strong and hard-working lady who has managed to provide an education for her children – even the least educated is a Diploma holder.  She also takes care of three grandchildren. She has been a businesswoman involved in the sale of matooke (green bananas) from Mukono for 10 years now and she is able to make 35,000 UGX in weekly profits. She hopes to open up other branches that could earn more income to help pay for her grandchildren’s school fees and furnish her home. Cate needs a loan to help purchase matooke in order to expand her business and increase profitability.

loans.use: Buying more green bananas for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Sdeung Sron Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sdeung S. is the leader of this village bank group loan which consists of fifteen people located in Peam Prachum village in Kandal province.  All of the members will use the loan in different ways.  Mrs. Sdeung S. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is a 51-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another is a laborer, and the last is a fisherman.  She is applying for a loan so she can buy rice seed to grow in the field, and buy nets for her child’s fishing business. She hopes to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family. 

Most group members will have monthly payment loans. Four members will have end-of-term (EoT) loans which means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are able. Most clients start making payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fishnet.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata D. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et a 5 enfants en charge qui fréquentent tous l'école. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans. Elle a tojours été fidèle aux remboursements de ses prêts. Elle développe une activité de vente d'huile de palme et de balais. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent de prendre en charge certains besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Aminata D. is a 40 year old woman, married, and cares for five children who all attend school. She has been a member of the village bank named TENGHORY DIAMALAYE for the past seven years. She has always reimbursed her loans on time. She has developed a retail activity to sell palm oil and brooms. Profits from these sales will allow her to take charge of certain needs of her family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her retail activity

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en:
A. Akmal is 31 years old. He is married with three children. From the time he was young, Akmal learned to work in a small business with his parents. With a lot of sacrifice, he became a main producer in agriculture in the area where he lived. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice and seeing his family progressing more and more. With the income Akmal was able to open a dispensary in his house and also raise the cattle successfully. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children and see them as professional, ethical and hardworking. For this reason he is asking a loan of $750 USD. He wants this loan to buy livestock, as raising and selling the animals generates an excellent profit margin. Be an important part of the growth of Akmal’s business.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo.
Su cultivo preferido es el café, ya que este producto le brinda granos de primera y en grandes cantidades. De enero a marzo trabaja de forma constante quitando los arbustos que se apoderan rápidamente de sus chacras de cafetales. En mayo se prepara para la recolección de los granos de café con una canasta amarrada a la cintura, con la ayuda de su esposa y demás familiares, ya que la cosecha se debe realizar lo más rápido posible, porque de no ser así, se caen los granos al piso y eso complica el trabajo. Terminada la recolección, el lavado y el secado del café, acude a las acopiadoras de su localidad, a quienes vende su producto y muy contento regresa a su casa, donde comparte las ganancias con su familia.  

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y la más plantitas de café.
texts.en:
Miguel is 31 years old and he lives with his partner, the mother of his little boy.

His favorite harvest is coffee, this being the harvest that provides the best yields and in great quantities. From January to March he works constantly to remove any weeds that might quickly take over his coffee plantation. In May he gets ready to do the harvest of coffee beans, usually with a basket tied to his waist. With the help of his wife and other family members he must complete a harvest as quickly as possible because the beans will fall to the ground otherwise, complicating matters. Once the harvest is done he must wash and dry the coffee he goes to the sellers in the neighborhood to sell hsi product. He is free to go back home at this point with the revenues for his family.

This is his second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he has dedicated himself to paying it back on time. The funds that he requests will be investedin the purchase of chemical fertilizers, as well as coffee plant seedlings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and coffee plant seedlings.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane C. is from the village of Ibung, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Mary Jane owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years. In 2007, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fifth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Leoncio De Maria

texts.es: Don Leoncio  M. es un hombre muy trabajor desde su juventud, atrabajado como vendedor ambulante de pulseras, gel para cabellos, chapas, pulseras cadenas, golosinas entre otros productos, tiene 47 años de edad, junto con su esposa procrearon cuatro  hijos de los cuales aun están estudiando para un porvenir mejor, ya que para ellos fue difícil terminar sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos de sus padres. Su casa es muy humilde y ha ido poco a poco mejorando con el préstamo anterior compro zinc y reglones para cambiar el techo ya que estaba en  malas condiciones. Y con este financiamiento lograra comprar materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento para hacer las divisiones y poder tener una privacidad junto sus hijos. La vida de el como la de su esposa no ha sido fácil, ella emigro al país de Panamá a trabajar como conserje ya que aquí se le había hecho difícil encontrar trabajo en su país. A un para el ha sido mas difícil por que tiene que cuidar a sus hijos y poder apoyarlo  así como trabajar para que no le falte nada, aunque ella envía remesa es una gran responsabilidad para el,  lo que  mas desea  es poder estar otra vez junto con su esposa que espera que regrese para quedarse. Agradecido con Afodenic ya que ha sido el apoyo para poder hacer las mejoras en su pequeña vivienda, y poder lograr un techo mejor cada día.
texts.en:
Leoncio M., 47, has been a very hard-working man since his youth. He has worked selling bracelets, hair gel, door locks, chain bracelets, sweets, among others. He and his wife had 4 children who are still in school preparing for a better future since the parents were unable to finish school for lack of economic resources. Their home is very humble and little by little he has been making improvements to it. With a previous loan he bought zinc metal sheeting and edging to replace the roof, which was in bad contidition. This financing will be used to buy building materials like rock, sand, and cement to put up some room divisions so that he and his wife can have some privacy from their children. His and his wife's life has not been easy. She emigrated to Panama to work as a caretaker because she hadn't been able to find work in her own country. His life hasn't been any easier either since he has to care for the children and work to support them; even though his wife sends some money home it's a big responsibility for him. What he most wishes for is to be reunited with his wife whom he hopes will return to stay. He is grateful to Afodenic because it has been the source of help to improve his small dwelling and have a better place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, cement and sand for home improvements.

loans.name: Madres Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Madres Laboriosas se encuentra ubicada en el departamento D. Lima, está conformado por 9 socios, trabajan  con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad desD. hace 16 meses.
Mirtha Elena tiene 55 años, madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos asume el cargo D. presidenta, DesD. hace 3 años Mirtha se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo, y también realiza trabajo manual D. tejidos, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria asume los gastos D. la educación D. sus hijos, su gran anhelo es que sean profesionales.
El reciente préstamo Reyna lo utilizara en el techado D. su casa.
Todos los socios agradecemos el apoyo brindado y a la vez nos comprometemos a cumplir con el pago D. cuotas establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Madres Laboriosas” (Working Mothers) is located in the Department of Lima. The group consists of nine members and has been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for the past 16 months. Mirtha Elena is 55 years old and a single mother with three dependent children. She currently serves as president of the group. Mirtha has been selling beauty products through a catalog for three years. In addition, she produces hand woven articles. Through the effort of her daily work, Mirtha is able to cover the educational costs for her children. Her greatest dream is to see them become professionals. Mirtha used her recent loan to put a roof on her house. All of the members are thankful for the support and promises to make their payments on the established due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein has worked as a plumber, repairing toilets, faucets, etc., since 2006. He’s 18 years old, single and lives with his mother and three brothers. They cooperate together in the household. 

Hussein is very happy because he started a new business and so, a new career. Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow $600 to buy additional tools for his occupation because his work is growing and he needs to be able to meet the needs of the clients.

loans.use: Buy additional tools specified for his occupation

loans.name: Sokleang

texts.en:
Mr. Sokleang S. (pictured here), 47, and his wife, Mrs. Saing Korn, 40, have been married since 1991 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of their children is a garment factory worker and three are in school. The family lives in a small village located 17 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.
Sokleang has been driving a motor remoque (a motorcycle with a trailer attached at the back) for more than two years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for more than five years. When she has free time, she grows vegetable as well. Sokleang assists his wife in farming. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 USD to make the roof of his house and dig a well for his family to use.

loans.use: To make the roof of his house and dig a well for his family

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes tiene 42 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio, ella tiene que levantarse muy temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar, pues además tiene que brindarle la atención necesaria a sus hijos. Por lo que además labora como docente y este salario no le es suficiente para mantener a su familia. A pesar de ser una actividad muy minoritaria trata de mejorar los ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de uniformes escolares ya que tiene ciertos encargos, ropa interior y ropa en general. Ella sueña con que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 42 years old and she sells clothing. She has been in this humble business for more than 8 years. She has to get up very early to complete the household chores, in addition to having to provide her children with the necessary attention. She also works in teaching, but this salary is not sufficient for her to support her family. Despite being a minority business, she tries to improve her income to improve her quality of life. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of school uniforms, as she already has a few orders for underwear and clothing in general. María Mercedes dreams of her children finishing their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en:
Brigitte T. is 30 years old, is married and is the mother of three children. She lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal, and has been a member of the "Banc Villageois", NGASCOP, for six years. Her main activity consists of raising cattle which she sells at the grand agricultural market in nearby Bambey.

With this loan, Brigitte T. will purchase more cattle to raise. The revenues generated by her activity allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Together Women Group

texts.en:
Regina B. is the leader of a five-person borrowing group called Together Women. She is 35 years old, single and has five children aged 6 to 15 years old. Regina also cares for her mother and father.
 
Due to the war and having children, Regina was only able to attend school through 8th grade. For 15 years, she has been selling fried doughnuts at the Omega Community in Paynesville, Liberia. She says she keeps customers returning to her by making sure to prepare the doughnuts excellently.

Regina plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more flour, sugar and oil. Her goal is to have her children finish school and build a house for them.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Regina is the one holding the sign. Rebecca K. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar and oil to make doughnuts

loans.name: Siempre Alegres Originales Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento SIEMPRE ALEGRES ORIGINALES estan en su primera secuencia todas las socias son nuevas, y el nombre que pusieron al banco es porque estan muy contentas con el prestamo otorgado.

La Sra. Sonia, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la Zona Villa Nuevo Potosi de la ciudad de La Paz, ella vive en la casa de sus familiares, actualmente no tiene hijos y es soltera, la Sra. Sonia se dedica a la venta de artículos de plástico, por no tener un puesto fijo ambula por las calles aledañas a la Av. Tumusla donde trabaja durante todo el dia. Ella es la presidenta del banco de Emprendimiento fue elegida por su responsabilidad y carisma en el momento de formar el Banco de Emprendimiento. Con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor y asi ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes. 

La Sra. Katerin, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la Zona Villa Nuevo Potosi de la ciuidad de La Paz, ella vive en la casa de sus familiares, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos, la Sra. Katerin se dedica a la venta de comida en su mismo domicilio donde realiza exquisitos platillos donde tiene mucha clientela, tiene muchas ganas de superacion y desea continuar con sus estudios posteriormente una vez que tenga estabilidad economica. La Sra.  Katerin  es Secretaria de Actas del Banco de Emprendimiento Siempre Alegres Originales, El destino del crédito es para la compra de abarrotes como aceite, fideo, arroz, etc. y asi poder elaborar sus platillos y de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo y asi poder sobresalir económicamente.

La Sra. Doris, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la Zona Villa Nuevo Potosi de la ciuidad de La Paz, ella vive en la casa de sus familiares, tiene 1  hijo, convive con el Sr. Walter quien trabaja como pintor es Secretaria de Actas de la Mesa Directiva. El destino del crédito es para incrementar su capital de trabajo y asi poder sobresalir económicamente.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos tienen que mantener solas su hogar, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Siempre Alegres Originales (The Original Always Happy) Communal Bank is in its first lending sequence. All the members are new. The bank was given its name because they are all very happy with the lending specification. Mrs. Sonia is 34 years old and lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosi zone in the city of La Paz. She lives in her family’s home. She is currently single and has no children. As she doesn’t have a fixed booth, Mrs. Sonia sells plastic goods from a moving cart in the area around Tumusla Avenue. She is the president of the communal bank. She was elected at the formation of the communal bank because of her responsible and charismatic nature. With the money from the loan, she will buy merchandise from the wholesaler and in this way, offer a greater variety of products to her customers. Mrs. Katerin is 22 years old and lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosi zone in the city of La Paz. She lives in her family’s home. She is currently single and has no children. Mrs. Katerin sells food from her own home. She makes exquisite dishes and has many customers. She has a strong drive to improve and would like to continue her studies once she is more economically established. Mrs. Katerin is the secretary of the Siempre Alegres Originales communal bank. The loan will be used to buy groceries such as oil, noodles, rice etc. In this way she will be able to make her dishes and increase her working capital in order to improve her economic situation. Mrs. Doris is 35 years old and lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosi zone in the city of La Paz. She lives in her family’s home. She has one son with her partner Mr. Walter, who works as a painter. She is the recording secretary for the board of directors. The loan will be used to increase her working capital and in this way she will improve her economic situation. All the members are responsible and hardworking people and are, in many cases, the sole provider in their home. They are very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust they show in the awarding of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two adult children. She owns a small business selling clothing at the central market in Berdyansk town. She has been in this business for five years and has always offered high quality products and good customer service. Today Ludmila has many repeat customers and a stable business. Her active life and position encourages her business neighbors and friends. 

Ludmila would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase sales and boost her income.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Esperanza de 58 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Alejandro Garcia, tiene 3 hijos, todos son mayores y ya estan casados, trabajan y le ayudan a sus padres en lo que pueden.  Ella tiene a su cargo a su nietecita Melisa de 8 añitos que esta en 3er grado de primaria. Esperanza trabaja para el Hospital Asuncion desde hace 20 años como conserje. 

Esta solicitando su 7mo credito con el proposito de  levantando 2 paredes para cerrar la cocina y que le quede adentro el baño y el lavandero, ademas ponerle el techo a ese pequeño anexo que hara y poner las puertas para que esta sea mas segura, pues los rateros ya le robaron algunas de sus cosas que tenia en la cocina.  

Expresa que gracias a los creditos que ha obtenido en AFODENIC ha logrado darle mejores condiciones a su casita y sueña con mejorarla mas para que su nietecita pueda crecer en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Esperanza, age 58, is married to Alejandro Garcia. She has three children who are grown and married. They work and help their parents in what they can. Her eight year old granddaughter, Melisa, is under her care. Melisa is in the third grade. Esperanza has worked in the Asuncion Hospital for 20 years as a janitor. She is requesting her seventh loan in order to raise two walls to enclose the kitchen and have the bathroom and laundry room inside. She will also put a roof on this small annex that she will make. She will place doors in order to be more secure. Thieves have already stolen some of her things that she had in the kitchen. She expresses thanks for the loans that she has received from Afodenic. She has been able to improve the conditions of her little house. She dreams of improving it more so that her little granddaughter will be able to grow up in a pleasant atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise two walls

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
El señor Margarito U. y la señora Leonor Villegas son padres de familia y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad y a quienes les quieren dar  los estudios necesarios para que tengan un mejor futuro. 
Solicitan el préstamo ya que tiene gastos de la escuela de sus hijos y no cuentan con el dinero necesario para que puedan terminar el año escolar.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de un camión de carga.
texts.en:
Mr. Margarito U. and Mrs. Leonor Villegas are parents and have three children under their care. They hope to provide for the necessary studies so their children can have a better future. They are soliciting a loan for school expenses for their children as they don’t have the money needed for them to finish off the school year. They plan to pay off the loan with a portion of the earnings that he earns from his work as a cargo truck driver.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: school expenses

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina O., 47, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She makes sure that she earns well so that she and her child can have a good and comfortable future together.  She has been doing direct selling of clothes and cosmetics for the past few years.

Marina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her direct sales business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 30,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying advance orders on her direct sales line.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she and her child can be well-off in the future.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying advance orders on her direct sales line

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji W.  is currently in the business of selling fried fish at the street in the evening and is requesting a loan to stock more fish and some bread to sell.  Keji is 35 years old and married to a policeman. She has three children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more fish and some bread to sell

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: la Sra. Celia llego a nuestra oficina con la intencion de solicitar un  prestamo en grupo, pero al final se desanimaron y sacaron con otra persona y se garantizaron ambas este es ya su segundo credito en nuestra institucion, Doña Celia vive en el Barrio Cafetal de la zona el Dorado en donde tiene su casita propia en la que vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, su actividad es venta de desayuno y almuerzo, y como segunda actividad tambien tiene una rockola mientras los clientes disfrutan de su rico almuerzo pueden escuchar una buena musica, el dinero solicitado sera para aumentar su capital en la venta de comidas, ya que tiene mucha demanda, su objetivo es llegar a colocar en su mismo domicilio una pension para lo cual le falta la infraestructura y tambien quiere comprar mas mesas y sillas , una parte del dinero tambien sera para la misma "agradezco a la institucion por la confianza brinda a mi persona. "argumento".
texts.en:
Celia came to our office with the intention of requesting a loan in her group, but in the end she got discouraged and took up with another person, and they are going to guarantee each other's loans. This is her second loan from our institution. Celia lives in the Cafetal neighborhood in the Dorado area, where she has her own home where she lives with her husband and their 4 children. She sells breakfasts and lunches, and as a second activity she also has a jukebox, so that while her customers enjoy their delicious lunch they can also listen to good music. The money she requests will be used to increase her capital for her business selling food, for which she has a lot of demand. She has a goal of eventually renting out rooms in her house, but she currently lacks the infrastructure for this. In addition, she wants to buy more tables and chairs; part of the money will be used to do this. "I am grateful to the institution for the confidence it is placing in me," she says.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
Duch R. is 24 years old and is married to Horm Ty, 34, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of his community.

Duch R. has been selling fresh fish in the busy local market for more than five years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or buys them from her wholesale supplier or from other fishermen.

Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because their fishing equipment is broken. Because of this, Duch R. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment, including nets and traps.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment for her husband, including nets and traps

loans.name: Areta

texts.en:
Areta M. is 54 years old and lives in Vanadzor. She has two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is married and lives in Europe. One of her sons is married and lives in another part of Vanadzor. The other son is not married and lives with Areta and her husband. 

Areta and her husband opened their shop across from their house two years ago, but they have been in this business for 12 years. They sell groceries and household goods such oil, paper goods, towels, toys, jam and soap, etc...The profits from the sales allow them to take care of the needs of their family. 

They are seeking a loan of 450,000 Armenian Drams to add more items and a wider selection to their store. She will use the loan money to purchase school supplies in anticipation of the beginning of the school year in September.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies and household goods

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma R., a 49-year-old resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. Married to Renato R., a salesman, she is the mother of three children, one of whom is already working; another is in high school, while the youngest is enrolled in elementary school. By the grace of God, Norma has managed to support her oldest child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining children all the way through college, a dream of most Filipino parents like Norma, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best legacy parents can leave to their children.

Norma operates a buy-and-sell business, purchasing general merchandise from wholesalers and then selling it piecemeal for a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing, and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Norma is requesting a Php14,000 loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Norma dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business, and she also hopes to have her own house someday. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dozens of lappas ( a traditional dress for women), flour, sugar, baking powder, yeast etc

loans.name: Vilma Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Vilma, es una señora trabajadora con deseos D. progresar cada día, tiene 64 años y resiD. en Corinto departamento D. Morazán, vive junto a su esposo don Félix Vásquez y tienen dos hijas Yanira D. 30 años y Flor D. María D. 21 años D. edad.
Doña Vilma se dedica a la venta D. ropa y floristería desD. hace 2 años atendiendo su negocio todos los días ocho horas diarias, la floristería la aprendió en unas clases impartidas cerca D. su casa, ella necesita un préstamo pues quiere invertir en la compra D. prendas D. vestir y  en materiales para la elaboración D. flores pero esta inversión solo la pueD. hacer por la obtención del préstamo ya que su intención es proporcionar a sus clientes una diversidad D. artículos y D. esta manera que sus ingresos aumenten.
Diversificar el negocio es el principal objetivo D. esta señora pues así atraerá a los clientes y aumentaran las ventas significando un progreso para este hogar.
texts.en:
Dona Vilma is a woman who works hard every day to get ahead.  She is 64 years old and lives in the Salvadoran "departamento" of Morazan with her husband, Don Felix V..  They have two daughters: Yanira, 30, and Flor D. Maria, 21.  
Dona Vilma has maD. a living selling clothing and flowers for 2 years.  She tends the business eight hours a day, every day.  She took classes to become a florist.  She needs a loan now because she wants to buy articles of clothing for her clothing business and supplies for her florist business.  This investment is only a begining, though, because her intention is to proviD. a range of products to her customers so that she can maximize her earnings.  
Dona Vilma's first goal is to diversify her business so that she can attract more customers and increase her sales, a process that will lead to helping her family get ahead.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for clothing business.

loans.name: José Walter

texts.es: El Sr. José Walter L. T. es trabajador Activo para el Hospital Carlos Roberto Huembé de la policía nacional   desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad tiene cuatro  años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: José Walter L. T. is an active worker for the Carlos Roberto Huembé Hospital for the national police working as a security guard.  He has worked for this institution for four years.  He is currently married with a school-age son.  He has had two CEPRODEL loans and used both to buy construction materials to expand and improve his home.  These CEPRODEL loans have benefited him greatly and in this way he has improved his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials: sand, cement, blocks, etc.

loans.name: Eshrat's Group

texts.en:
Eshrat is a very supportive lady. She is always willing to help her family in difficult times. She is married to S. who has a business of selling eggs. He purchases eggs from egg selling agencies, poultry farms etc., and sells them to different bakeries and grocery shops in the market. Eshrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy eggs in dozens quantities to fulfill orders of his clients and to increase the family income. 

Eshrat is confident that her husband, who has been doing this business for 5 years, will utilize the loan money in a positive manner and improve his business condition. She lives in Khanewal with her husband and 3 daughters in the area named Jameeabad, a housing colony of city Khanewal. She moved here 10 years ago. She is a housewife, stays at home and does her household works. Her daughters are of very young age and Eshrat plays full responsibility in raising them. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She is a responsible client who has never missed a single meeting and always paid her installment on time.

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah passbook) is Eshrat.

loans.use: To buy eggs for egg selling business.

loans.name: Sop Dabakh Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP DABAKH est composé de 12 femmes qui habitent la même concession, elles sont de la même famille et mènent diverses activités telles que la couture, la coiffure  et le petit commerce.

La responsable Daba F. est célibataire sans enfant en charge, elle est couturière mais vend des tissus et des produits cosmétiques. Elle est à droite sur la photo.

Le prêt reçu de 170 000 F lui permet de renforcer son activité ; 

avec ses bénéfices elle se prend en charge et participe aux dépenses familiales pour soutenir sa mère.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP DABAKH is made up of 12 women who live in the same area. They are all from the same family and carry out different activities, such as sewing, hairstyling, and small-scale retail.

Daba F., the group's leader, is single with no dependent children. She is a seamstress and also sells fabric and beauty products. She is on the right in the photo.

The 170,000 franc loan will allow her to increase her business: with her earnings, she can meet her own needs and contribute to the family's expenses to support her mother.

loans.use: To increase business activity

loans.name: Vilke Josue

texts.en:
Josue is twenty-seven years old.  He lives in the village of CP-5 in the district of Las Lomas in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers.  Many residents own small fruit plantations and raise cattle or other smaller animals.  Josue is single and shares his home with his parents, with whom he divides economic responsibilities and work.

The family owns two hectares of land that they inherited from their parents.  Josue has the land planted with maracuya.  He has a good number of mature vines that produce fruit throughout the year.  The maracuya is a local fruit that grows numerous seeds in its interior, somewhat similar to the pomegranate.  It is quite sour but popular as a breakfast dish and with other items.  In addition to the fruit plantation, Josue raises sheep and pigs in corrals behind his home.  He raises them until they reach the appropriate size and weight and then he sells them for their meat.

This will be Josue’s first loan with Kiva's partner, Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the funds to purchase additional fertilizer and other crop maintenance supplies.  He hopes this will help to improve production and his family’s living status.  Josue is a very hard working man and well respected in the village.

loans.use: Purchase additional fertilizer and other crop maintenance supplies

loans.name: Martha Yanet

texts.es:
Martha Yanet  S. Z. tiene 42 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el conviviente y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Martha se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, arroz. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener terrenos propios.

Le gusta salir a visitar a la familia y festejar las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Martha Yanet S. Z., 42, lives in a common law relationship with her partner and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  She has 3 children.

The members of the LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE (HOPE IS NEVER LOST) communal bank are from the community of Placer which is 120 minutes from the Chillanes office; they are for the most part farmers.

Martha is a corn, cocoa bean and rice farmer.  She makes both her purchases and her sales in Chillanes canton’s market on Sundays.

She is asking for a loan to buy seed, manure and fertilizers.  Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and climactic variations.  Her dream is to own her own land.

She likes to visit her family and take part in community festivals.

loans.use: For seed, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Future Ladies Group

texts.en: Hawa K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Hawa is 52 years old, widowed, and has seven children, five of whom attend school and two of whom are adults.  She was born in Kailahum town in eastern Sierra Leone.  For 21 years, Hawa has been selling clothes, jeans, slippers, baby powder, etc. This is the first loan that Hawa and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Hawa will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business; she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, jeans, slippers, baby powder, etc.

loans.name: Lady Jane

texts.en:
Lady Jane C. is from the town of San Francisco.  She is 31 years old.  Lady Jane is married and has 4 children ages 11, 7, 5 and 2 years old.  To make a living, Lady Jane owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.  Lady Jane has been engaged in her business for over 4 years.

Lady Jane joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lady Jane is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lady Jane from CEVI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living condition. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto D. is from the village of Olango, Mallig, Isabela. He is 52 years old. Ernesto is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ernesto owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ernesto has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Ernesto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 27,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Ernesto is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Ernesto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand a small food-selling business

loans.name: Almarie

texts.en:
Almarie D. is from the village of Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City. She is 37 years old.  Almarie is married and has 3 school-aged children.  Almarie owns & operates a fishing business, catching & selling wild-caught fish.  Almarie has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Almarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Almarie is requesting a loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Almarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en: Harutyun lives with his wife (a teacher), his retired parents, and two school-aged children.  Since 2002 he has owned a clothing shop in Hrazdan, Armenia,  which he manages on the weekends.  Harutyun imports clothing and shoes from China. He has applied for a loan to ensure that he has enough inventory for the upcoming busy months. He hopes that his business will do well and will attract more customers.

loans.use: stock up on shoes and clothing to sell in his shop

loans.name: Delvith

texts.en: Delvith E. is married and has six children.  She  works hard to support her family.  She buys and sells bananas in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from a general store.  Delvith is requesting a loan for 29,000 PHP from NWTF, which she will use to purchase more stock of bananas for her banana business.  Delvith has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bananas

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Jaranwala which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for almost seven years. Her husband is an animal seller and for this purpose he has some goats and sheep at home. He raises them and sells to butchers at a profit. He started this business a few years ago and it is earning him good profits regularly. 

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. Using the loan, he will buy some goats and sheep for resale.
. 
Perveen is a mother of three sons. Two of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. She is hopeful that an investment will help her husband to expand his business and earn better profits.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for resale.

loans.name: Maksatbek

texts.en:
Maksatbek B. is 40, married and has three children. He earns his living through agriculture and, in the summer seasons, he works as a stockkeeper for the local area.  His wife helps Maksatbek in their cattle-breeding  business.  

Starting with the initial capital of 30.000 KGS, they managed to develop a farm with cows, sheep, goats and horses. With the revenues from this activity, they were able to buy a house in Min-Bulak village. 

Maksatbek has applied for a loan of 60.000 KGS to purchase more cattle. With the revenue, he plans to buy equipment for further developing his business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante is from Oro Vista Village, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 34 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Renante owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling yellow bananas, papaya, mangoes and Chinese melon in the local community. Renante has been engaged in his business for over 14 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Renante joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Renante is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of fruits like watermelons and bananas. This will be the fourth loan that Renante has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits like watermelons and bananas

location.town: Oro Vista Village, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene  54 años de edad, es madre soltera, ella vive con sus 02 hijos mayores hijos de edad. Ella cuenta con casa  propia la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de Piura. Adela  vive en la parte rural de este distrito y solo  cuenta con el servicio de luz.

Adela se dedica a desarrollar labores de agricultura, actividad para la cual cuenta con 1.0 hectárea  de terreno agrícola que ha heredado en vida de sus padres, en dicho terreno tiene mango en producción.
También se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Adela cuenta  con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio.

Adela está  solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que ella pueda dar  mantenimiento del cultivo de mango, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha

Adela es una persona bastante hogareña y estimada por las personas de su comunidad, pues la consideran una mujer trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Adela is 54 years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her two eldest children.   Adela owns her own home which is located in Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  She lives in the rural part of this district and the only service her home receives is electricity.

Adela works in farming.  She owns one hectare of agricultural land which she inherited from her parents.  She grows mangos on this land. 

Adela also raises animals which she sells in the local market when they reach an ideal size and weight.  She has ten years experience in this business.

Adela is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can take care of her mango crop.  In this way, she hopes to obtain a good harvest.

Adela is a home-loving person and well liked by the people in her community who consider her to be a hard-working and responsible person.

loans.use: to care for her crops

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en:
Shadia is 30 years old and married with three children between the ages 6 and 13 years old. She also has three dependents.  She sells milk, bread, etc. She runs her business from 6 am until 9 pm every day and she has three years of experience in this business. 

Shadia has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more milk, bread, cooking oil, etc in her supermarket to sell. She plans to reinvest the additional profit in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To buy more milk, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 40-year-old married man with five children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a dream of educating his children up to university. Wilson deals in the sale of fresh foods and has operated this business for seven years now.
