His main challenge is the ever increasing transport costs and his desire is to own more food stalls in different markets. Wilson intends to use this loan to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de colchones, frazadas y colchas, ella es propietaria de una tienda donde vende la mercadería, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de colchas, frazadas y colchones. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su tienda.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC communal bank. This bank is located in the Urubamba district and province and in the Cusco department.

This partner is 62 years old. The member is married and has three children.  This member alternates the daily activities with the sale of mattresses, blankets and bedspreads. The partner is the owner of a store where this merchandise is sold. The member works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. The member wants to increase and improve the sales of the mattresses, blankets and bedspreads. The partner is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for the store. 

This partner is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments on the loan.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 46 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has five children.  Three of her children are currently in school.  Betty has a business of rental houses, which she has had for 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase materials like cement to complete some rental houses.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Betty hopes to expand her rental houses.  Betty is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase materials like cement to complete some rental houses.

loans.name: Ibrahim M.

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Ibrahim.  He is married and has one child aged three. In 2004, Ibrahim began his assorted goods business selling sardines, soap, batteries, razors, tooth paste, etc. He took over his business from his eldest sister who has relocated to the United States of America.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 750,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  

Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy different items -batteries (3 cartons @ Le140, 000), Grafton Drinking Water (40 bundles @ Le3000), soft drinks (150 crates @ Le15,000), candles (10 cartons @ Le50,000), torch lights (1 carton @ Le200,000), toilet soap (1 carton @ Le150,000) and foam surf (cartons @ Le60,000). 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Ibrahim plans to buy both a taxi and a motorcycle and build a house for his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for various goods to stock his store.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: María Lourdes se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa tiene más de ocho años de experiencia en esta actividad. Es un pequeño negocio de comercialización de ropa en donde la mayoría de su clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de productos como camisetas, pantalones, faldea, vestidos, camisolas, trajes y ropa interior. Es por eso el objetivo del crédito para aumentar su inventario. María sueña con instalar una tienda en su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria Lourdes buys and sells clothing and she has been in business for more than eight years. Her business is a small clothing retail business where the majority of her clients request a variety of products such as t-shirts, pants, skirts, dresses, camisoles, suits, and undergarments. The objective of her loan investment is to increase her inventory. Maria dreams of installing a store in her house.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, pants, skirts, dresses, camisoles, suits, and undergarments.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a business woman aged 38. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last 3 years, she has been managing a general shop to earn a living. She has another source of income in horticulture farming. In the next 5 years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy rice, sugar and salt for her store. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save part of her income.

loans.use: To buy  rice, sugar and salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Adzo

texts.en: Adzo sells plantain and has a palm oil extractor in Abura. She is divorced and has 4 children. Adzo has received junior high education. Her loan will be used to buy more fruits to make oil and plantain for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to make oil and plantain for resale.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 49 years old, and is a married woman with three children. Her husband works in a flower nursery. Hue has been running a general store and selling mobile phone cards for over four years. She started this business to cover her family's every day expenses. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hue is requesting a loan to purchase a stock of mobile phone SIM cards and a greater variety of general goods (such as foods and beverages) to sell from her store. Hue hopes that by offering a greater variety of products that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand this business, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of mobile phone SIM cards and general goods to sell from her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 13 integrantes en la ciudad de Encarnación, son parte de la fundación a partir del mes de junio, con excelente conducta de pago en todos los créditos que han solicitado. El comité tiene experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que hace un tiempo que trabajan juntas.
Una de las integrantes es Rita, ella tiene 54 años, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos. Es una señora que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante, es la única en su familia que trabaja y genera ingreso en su hogar, por lo que se integro al comité de su barrio para que con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya pueda comprar más Frutas y verduras para su mejor venta e ingreso.
Todas están conformes con el sistema de trabajo con la fundación y quieren seguir adelante con el mismo.
texts.en:
This committee has 13 members from the city of Encarnación.  They’ve been part of the Fundación since June.  They have excellent repayment behavior with all the loans they’ve requested.  The committee has experience in group work since they’ve been working together for some time now.

One of the members is Rita, 54.  She’s a single mother of five children.  She’s a woman who is a street vendor of fruit and vegetables.  She’s the only one in her family who works and generates income for the home which is why she joined her neighborhood’s group so that with help from Fundación Paraguaya she can buy more fruit and vegetables to improve sales and income.

All the members agree with the Fundación’s method of work and want to continue forward with it.

loans.use: to buy fruit like bananas, apples, pears and others for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is 35 years old and lives in Catulayan, San Juan, Siquijor. She is married with four children. Cheryl engages in selling fresh fish to earn a living. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase fish to sell. Cheryl has been a member of the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month. Cheryl would like to have savings deposits for her children's future education.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en:
Chenda, 41, is married and has six children, one of whom is married while the other five are still in school. To earn a living and feed her family, she started raising ducks eight years ago in a rural area of Thmor Koul district selling duck eggs and ducks. 

Chenda leads a group of three female members. She and one of her group members have been with VisionFund for four cycles while the other is just with VisionFund for this cycle. The loans from VisionFund helps Chenda earn regular income to better feed her family. She is now requesting a fifth loan to buy feed for her ducks. With this loan, she hopes to feed her ducks to be healthy and fat and also earn more income to support, keep her five children in school, and build up some savings to build a better house.

loans.use: To buy feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 26-year-old, married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. She has had a butcher shop for 6 years. She started the business with money earned from farming. The hardship she is facing is insufficient capital to meet demand. However, she has a goal of setting up another butcher shop in town. She intends to buy meat for sale with the loan requested.

loans.use: to buy meat for sale

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe fait le commerce de pâte d’arachide, de bois de chauffe, de condiments alimentaires etc.
Madame AFOU  se tenant en première position à partir de la gauche fait le commerce de pâte d’arachide.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 10 sacs d’arachide qu’elle transforme en pâte et la revend en détail au marché de Médine à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the DANAYA group are married women who are on average 33 years old and have three children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative district of Mali). This is their first loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution; their goal is to meet their customers' needs. This group buys and sells groundnut paste, firewood, condiments for cooking etc...  Afou, first from the left in the photo, sells groundnut paste.  With her loan, she is planning to buy ten bags of groundnuts which she will turn into groundnut paste and sell for retail at the Médine market in Sikasso and also from her home, for cash, to mostly female customers. 
She expects average monthly profits to reach 15,500 CFA francs, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and interests, while the rest will go into savings.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Joyce Mwangangi

texts.en:
Joyce is 60 years old. She is married and has five children ranging from 20 to 35 years. She describes herself as a submissive woman. 

She runs a store where she has sold kale, cassava and charcoal for the last 11 years. Her business faces a challenge of inadequate funds to restock. 

She will use the KES 10,000 to buy more potatoes and cassava. Joyce hopes to expand her store in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and cassava.

loans.name: Aleyda Maryinee

texts.es:
Doña Aleyda comercializa la venta de ropa de segunda mano, cosmeticos y juguetes, el cincuenta por ciento encargado por sus clientes y las otras venta las hace ambulante y parte en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien tiene su propio taxi y lo trabaja, sus hijos terminaron el curso escolar.
Hoy con esta nueva inversion sera para la compra de paca y sandalias, y seguir teniendo la variedad en sus ventas. siendo de gran sastifacion poder apoyar  y aportar con los gastos personales de sus tres hijos, asi como poder cubrir gastos basicos de luz y agua. Todo esto gracias al crecimiento de sus ventas, y gracias a la institucion por dar la oportunidad atravez de su finnaciamientos.
texts.en:
Aleyda sells second-hand clothing, as well as cosmetics and toys. Fifty percent of her sales are in response to customer orders, and she makes the other sales as a mobile vendor or from her home. She has the support of her husband, who is a taxi driver with his own vehicle. Her children have finished school. 

Now, with the loan she will invest in buying clothing by the pack and sandals, so she can continue to offer variety in her sales. It will be a great satisfaction to her to be able to contribute to supporting the personal expenses of her three children, as well as covering basic expenses such as water and electricity. All of this is thanks to the growth in her sales, and thanks to the institution for giving her this opportunity through the loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing by the pack and sandals so she can expand her sales.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi sells fanti kenkey (boiled maize dough) in Mbeam near Abura. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer.  Asi has been selling fanti kenkey for 2 years. She supports her husband in paying their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bulk maize for preparing kenkey to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of kenkey.

loans.name: Hasna'a

texts.en:
Hasna'a is 46 years old.  She is divorced and from Marka in Jordan.  She has three children.

Hasna’a has requested a loan of 900 JOD to pay for cosmetic products and accessories to resell.  In the future, Hasna'a is planning to buy a car and open her own shop.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetic products and accessories to resell

loans.name: Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTASIÑANI”  iniciará el ciclo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Irene es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de material de construcción, costura, venta de verduras, venta de ropa , tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Irene es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hija que es socia de nuestra institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana hace años, desde esa fecha ella trabaja en este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención.
texts.en:
The “Sartasiñani” communal bank will start the 7th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided by Irene.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of economic activities among which there is building supplies sales, sewing, vegetable sales, clothing sales and neighborhood store.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen one of which is Irene.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for three years having joined thanks to an invitation from her daughter who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a sewing business.  She relates that she learned this business years ago from her sister.  She’s worked in it since then.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase capital; she will buy fabric in wholesale stores to use to make things to then sell in her sales stand.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her home the best way possible since she’s in a common law relationship and has four children.   When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the service.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Luís de 29 anos de idade, nasceu no distrito de Magude e é residente no mesmo e na casa propria, casado, sem filhos ainda, mas a sua esposa está gravida, além dos seus filhos tem na sua responsabilidade os seus pais e 8 sobrinhos.
Com o presente financiamento de 45.000 irá comprar farinha, arroz, óleo, sabão e  açucar para reforçar o seu negócio.
Tem como sonhos construir uma casa grande e mobilar.
Tem como dificuldades a insuficiência de fundos, mas tem recorrido ao negócio e ao crédito para a solução dos seus pendentes.
texts.en:
Luís is 29 years old. He comes from the district of Magude and lives there in a house that he owns. He's married and doesn't have children yet, but his wife is expecting. Aside from his children, he's responsible for his parents and eight nieces and nephews.
With the current loan for 45,000mts he'll purchase flour, rice, cooking oil, soap and sugar to stock his business.
His dream is to build a big house and furnish it.
He struggles with the lack of funds, but he has been turning to his business and credit as a way to settle his affairs.

loans.use: to purchase flour, rice, cooking oil, soap and sugar to stock his business.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотиме 46 лет. Она простая и скромная женщина. Фотима живет со своей семьей в Кабадиянском районе. Она занимается животноводством. Хотя этим делом она занимается всего 3 года, Фотима смогла добиться не малых успехов. Особую поддержку она получает от своих детей, которые всегда помогают ей. Но из-за финансовых проблем семьи, Фотима вынуждена была продать весь свой скот. В данный момент Фотиме очень нужно в ближайшие дни купить несколько голов телят, так как основным источником дохода является её деятельность. Она очень верит и ждет, что ей помогут в трудную минуту и её семья не останется без средств существования.
texts.en: Фотиме 46 лет. Она простая и скромная женщина. Фотима живет со своей семьей в Кабадиянском районе. Она занимается животноводством. Хотя этим делом она занимается всего 3 года, Фотима смогла добиться не малых успехов. Особую поддержку она получает от своих детей, которые всегда помогают ей. Но из-за финансовых проблем семьи, Фотима вынуждена была продать весь свой скот. В данный момент Фотиме очень нужно в ближайшие дни купить несколько голов телят, так как основным источником дохода является её деятельность. Она очень верит и ждет, что ей помогут в трудную минуту и её семья не останется без средств существования.

loans.use: To purchase a few heads of calves

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
After purchasing a 40 m3 biodigester and a pump for her organic fertilizer, Cecilia decided to further take advantage of the biogas she is producing by transforming her cows' manure: she wants to transform into electricity through a biogas adapted electrical generator. She will use the electricity in her house and include it in her farms' production processes, allowing her to further reduce her energy bills. Now that she is close to zero LP gas consumption, she aims at doing the same for her gasoline use. Her farm is becoming a model of sustainable farming and organic agriculture in her whole town, which makes Cecilia very proud and able to provide better care to her family.

This loan represents 32% of the full cost of the generator, the remaining part is being covered by an international support and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to purchase a generator transforming waste into electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy nail paintings, files, face creams, body lotions, and body perfumes.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Abi is 25 years old and married with 1 child. She runs a small food joint which is well patronised, mostly in the evenings. She began this about a year ago and has to procure her stock on credit from her suppliers. Having taken part in the TEACH learning sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION, she heard of the KIVA loan. She has therefore applied for the amount to use as seed capital to pay upfront for her inventory.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa is married and has six children. Her husband used to work as a company employee, but the salary he received was very low, and so because of this they decided to start their own business. As a result of her husband’s expertise, they opened a welding workshop 36 years ago. They began with very few tools, but the business has been growing and a result of the good service offered it has attracted a lot of customers.

Some of the equipment is now damaged or broken and so in order to be able continue working, Maria is asking for a loan of $150 dollars which she will use to buy gas-welding equipment. She is committed to paying back the loan within 5 to 10 months. You can play a fundamental part in the growth of this business and this family’s life and they thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Luisa es casada y tiene seis hijos, su esposo trabajaba de empleado en una empresa, pero el salario que recibía era muy bajo, de esta manera entre los dos decidieron iniciar su propio negocio, gracias a la experiencia que tiene su esposo en esta labor, abrieron un taller de soldadura hace 36 años, lo empezaron con muy poca herramienta, pero su negocio ha estado creciendo y por su buen servicio has ganando muchos clientes.

Algunas de la herramienta que utilizan se han descompuesto y para poder continuar trabajando, Maria solicita un préstamo de sólo $ 150 dólares que empleará en la compra de equipo de soldadura autógena, ella se compromete a devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase equipment

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi A., 47 years old, is married and mother of 10 children. Her principle business venture is the production and sale of manioc flour. Thanks to the income from this business, she is able to pay her children's school fees as well as providing other financial support for her family. A dynamic woman, Afi never rests on her laurels and is always concerned about growing her business.

Afi is presently low on capital and so is asking for a loan of $ 400. With this money she intends to buy lots of manioc roots that she can make into products such as flour and tapioca. The sale of these products will enable her to get more profit from her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 47 ans, Madame A. Afi est mariée et mère de dix (10) enfants. Son activité principale est la production et la vente de farine de manioc. C'est grâce à cette activité qu'elle arrive à payer la scolarité de ses enfants et à participer aux charges de son ménage. Pleine de dynamisme, elle ne dort jamais sous ses lauriers et est toujours soucieuse de l'évolution de son activité.

Ajourd'hui, elle est en déficit financier et sollicite un crédit de $400 afin de pouvoir acheter beaucoup de maniocs qu'elle aura à transformer en divers produits comme garie et tapioca. La vente de ces produits lui permettra d'améliorer son revenu.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of manioc roots to process into flour

loans.name: Sulduz

texts.en: Mr. Sulduz is a low income vulnerable person. He is 43, married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region. Sulduz has taken on a lease for a  butcher shop, which is in the local bazaar. Each day he goes to  the villages surrounding Saatli  to buy animals. Then he sells meat in his shop. He works until 2 o'clock. " I wish I had more money to buy more animals to sell. It would allow me to provide  the necessities of life for my children." Now Sulduz has applied for a $500 loan to the Normicro Saatli branch and is waiting.

loans.use: To expand volume of business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali N. is a 39-year-old married man who owns a car repair shop in Sabirabad. He has eleven years of experience in this field. This business is in high demand and people use car repair services very often. Sometimes Ali works till late at night to finish all the orders and next morning wakes up very early to start his work. Ali is married and has three children. He is planning to repair his shop. He believes this will attract more clients. He has applied for 800 USD to purchase material to start repairing his shop.

loans.use: Need funds to repair his auto repair shop

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Mrs. Queen E. is 45 yrs old, married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells local gin to people living in her community. She has been a LAPO member for 8 years. She is in need of a loan of $525 to enable her buy more local gin for sales, and she promised to repay it in 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more local gin (dry gin)

loans.name: Shodiev

texts.en: Shodiev A. lives in the Nausky region of Tajikistan, and is married with four children. He has been a Microinvest client since 2006, and has proved himself to be a serious and highly-motivated businessman. He works in the local food bazaar, where he sells animal feed. He is very experienced in this area, because he has worked in it for the last 10 years.  Like fathers everywhere, he wants to ensure a good future for his children by giving them an education. That is why he is ready to work day and night to increase his family's income and achieve his goals. Shodiev A. has applied for a loan of $625 to improve and expand his business, and, along with it, his ability to support his family.

loans.use: To improve our business and increase our family's income

loans.name: Leo Group

texts.es:
Leo. The word can conjure up different meanings: lions--or, in this case, lionesses--and the strongest of all the signs of the Zodiac and other things besides but, according to its members, it's the first two concepts that encapsulate each of their personalities.

For more than 6 years, these 16 women have worked together, making their association one of the best known and steadfast of its kind. Most of them earn a living making and selling food products of various kinds: some, quick and easy meals; some, sophisticated versions of their national cuisine; and others, lunches for area "pensiones" (a kind of boarding house) and restaurants.

Their major preoccupation now is how to meet the demand that will arise during the upcoming Carnival festivals because the event attracts people with money to spend, people who will buy plenty during this period. Consequently, they need funds to buy the supplies they need to prepare their stands so that they can compete with the many other food businesses that will pop up for the event.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Leo; esta palabra puede ser interpretada bajo muchos conceptos, como leones, o en este caso leonas, también es conocido como un signo zodiacal, el mas fuerte del zodiaco, y muchos otros significados mas, pero según las socias, estos dos conceptos encajan en la personalidad de cada una de ellas.

16 mujeres integran esta sociedad, desde hace mas de 6 años, siendo una de las asociaciones destacadas y constantes. En su mayoría sus integrantes están dedicadas a la preparación y venta de comida en distintas modalidades, algunas se dedican a la preparación de comida rápida, otras a la preparación de platos mas sofisticados de la gastronomía nacional, y otros se dedican a la atención de almuerzos en pensiones y restaurantes de la zona.

Su principal preocupación es la demanda que existirá en aquellas entradas folklóricas a realizarse en las fiestas de carnaval, puesto que la afluencia de gente a estos eventos es masivo y generalmente son consumidores potenciales por la duración misma de los eventos. Por tal motivo ellas precisan de capital para poder realizar la compra de sus insumos necesarios para la preparación de sus puestos, de esta manera poder competir con variedad y calidad ante los muchos otros negocios de comida que existirán para esas fechas.

loans.use: Buy supplies for making food and preparing space at upcoming Carnival event.

loans.name: Wakimese D(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Teddy N.. She is currently in the business of running a market stall and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Teddy is 45 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children ranging from age 20 to 27. Each week, Teddy makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her market stall business.

Teddy is joined in her small group by Fatuma A., Justine N., Cissy N., and Lillian N.. Fatuma A. has a business running a market stall and wants to add capital. Justine N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Cissy N. operates a retail shop business and wants to buy a second fridge. Lillian N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more furniture.

loans.use: To boost market stall business

loans.name: Mouna Market 2010-1-2 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Mary A.. She is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan for buying a car.

Mary is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant . She has four children, ranging in age from 8 to 16, and her children go to school. Each week, Mary makes approximately 375 Sudanese pounds in profit, and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to pay for her children to go to school.

Mary is joined in her small group by Diana B., Lilian Maricello, Joice N. and Cecilia Y.. Diana B. has a business in brewing alcohol and wants to expand the business. Lilian Maricello is currently operating a hotel business and wants a loan to expand the hotel. Joice N. operates a business selling breads and wants to expand her business. Cecilia Y. is currently in the business of brewing alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: for buying a car

loans.name: Karolina De Las Merc

texts.es:
Ms. Z. has been working with our institution for the last two years. She has obtained two loans which she has used as working capital and to purchase fixed assets. When she began her business she kept her merchandise in bags and sacks. She now has two display cases where she displays her product. She is single and lives with one of her sisters in her mother’s home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Z. trabaja con nuestra institución desdehace dos años donde ha obtenido dos creditos los que ha utilizado para capital de trabajo y la compra de activo fijo, cuando inicio ella tenia el negocio pero su mercaderia la mantenia en bolsas y sacos, actualmente tiene dos vitrinas donde exibe el producto, ella es soltera vive con una hermana en la casa de su madre.

loans.use: Working capital and fixed assets. Clothing, cosmetics, shoes and a display case.

loans.name: Thin Su Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thin S. is the leader of a group of four in Andong Chek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She and her husband, Mr. Hoeurn Mao, are basket makers in the village. They have three children:  one is employed in a garment factory, another is a cake maker, and the third works in a CD shop in the local village. Although all the members of the family have different business activities, the overall profit is still not sufficient to support the family; therefore Mrs. Thin S. wants to start a pig breeding business. In order to accomplish this task, Mrs. Thin S. asks for a loan to buy pigs and pig food to feed them. In September last year, Mrs. Thin S. got typhoid and she spent a lot of money to get cured.

loans.use: To buy pigs to start a business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy E. is 28 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells groceries and drinks. Joy learned this business in 3 years and started her own business in 1998. She has been a LAPO client for the past 6 years.

Joy needs a loan of $1,050 USD to buy more groceries and drinks to sell.She expresses her gratitude to all who have made the loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Gai Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Gai (DOB: 20/09/1961, ID: 23010087) would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to invest in breeding ducks. Currently, about 300 ducks are being bred for eggs in her home. Another daily source of income is from her small business in the market. Mrs. Gai’s husband is a construction worker. She has three children, all of whom are still in school. Her family’s monthly income is about 3.000.000 VND. Other members in her group include:

-Mrs. D. Thi Ha (born in 1980, ID: 23010085) would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to invest in her business in the market.

-Mrs. L. Thi Thuan (born in 1974, ID: 23010075) would like to borrow a loan of 4.452.000 VND to invest in poultries.

-Mrs. H. Thi Chung (born in 1974, ID: 23010071) would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to improve the infrastructure.

-Mrs. V. Thi Hai (born in 1960, ID: 23010140) would like to borrow a loan of 4.028.000 VND to invest in poultries.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva Volunteer.

Nguyễn Thị Gái, sinh ngày 20/09/1961 (Ms 23010087), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi vịt. Gia đình cô đang nuôi khoảng 300 con vịt đẻ. Ngoài việc nuôi vịt đẻ, cô còn đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ có thu nhập theo ngày . Hàng ngày, chồng cô cùng những người trong làng đi phu hồ tại các công trình, 3 con cô đang độ tuổi đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng: 3.000.000 vnđ / tháng. Trong nhóm cô còn có: Đào Thị Hà, sinh năm 1980 (Ms 23010085 ), mức vay:4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ. Lê Thị Thuận, sinh năm 1974 (Ms 23010075 ), mức vay: 4.452.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Hoàng Thị Chung, sinh năm 1974 (Ms 23010071 ), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư cơ sở hạ tầng. Vũ Thị Hải, sinh năm 1960 (Ms 23010140), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi.

loans.use: chăn nuôi

loans.name: Mohiya

texts.en:
Mohiya S. is 46 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She is a very active woman. Fifteen years ago, she started her business of raising cattle. Her family has 2 sheep and a cow. She usually sells them to local restaurants. With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are playing the main role in her life.

Despite recent success, since her business is still quite small, it doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Mohiya would like to request a loan to expand her business and increase family income. She will use the profit generated by the business to repay the loan on time. With this purpose in mind, Mohiya is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) for a term of 12 months in order to buy more young cattle to sell when they are fully grown. The well-being of her family and her business are in your hands. Mohiya and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge tiene 27 años, esta casado con la señora Johanna Duran de 24 años y no tienen hijos todavía por que desean estabilizarse bien económicamente para poder brindarle a su futuro hijo un hogar con todas las comodidades que una familia requiere.

Viven en casa de los padres por el momento, jorge trabajaba anteriormente en una empresa privada como empleado, su hermano que también se dedica a la venta de electrónica lo llevo a trabajar con él. Un día con el ahorro que poseía decidió invertir en su propio local que actualmente es uno de los más prestigiosos de la zona en su rubro.

Necesitan mas mercaderías por la gran cantidad de clientes que posee, desean ampliar su stock de mercadería comprando mas radios, discos, dvd, anteojos para sol, relojes, billeteras, carteras para damas, en lo cual desea invertir el préstamo.
texts.en:
Jorge is 27 years old, married to 24 year old Mrs. Johanna Duran. They don’t have children yet because they want to stabilize themselves economically in order to be able to provide their future child a home with all the comforts that a family requires. They live in his parent’s home at the moment, Jorge used to work in a private business as an employee; his brother worked in electronic sales and took Jorge to work with him. One day with the savings that he had, Jorge decided to invest in his own locale that today is one of the most prestigious in the area. They need more merchandise for the great quantity of customers they serve, they wish to expand their merchandise stock by using the loan to buy more radios, records, dvds, sunglasses, watches, billfolds, wallets.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: radios, records, dvds, sunglasses, watches, billfolds, wallets, etc.

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en: Mrs. Rorn U.  is 47 years old and raises ducks for eggs in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. She can earn around $2 per day. Normally, Rorn buys baby ducks from other breeders to fatten for three or four months. She married to Mr. Top Nit, 35, a rice farmer. She has three children, two of whom help farming while the other three are in school. For another source income, Rorn requests a loan of $500 to purchase a dynamo machine to run a rechargeable battery service and to buy more baby ducks to fatten for making eggs.

loans.use: To purchase a dynamo machine to run a rechargeable battery service and to buy more baby ducks to fatten for making eggs

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba E. is a single parent with four dependents. She has received no formal education. Araba sells a local meal popularly known as banku that is made out of corn. She serves it with fried fish and hot sauce. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country. Her business, which she has had since 2005, is located in Bantama near Elmina. Araba uses her income to pay for her children's school fees, utility bills, and other family expenses. Araba will use the loan to increase her purchase of maize, which she uses to prepare the banku, to enable her increase her production of the food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to save towards getting a piece of land to build a family house for the family.

She was not preparing the food as at the time this picture was taken, so she was asked to demonstrate how the banku is prepare.

loans.use: To increase her purchase of maize.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: El productor Angel solicita a la intitución de AFODENIC, su primer crédito para compra de ternero desarrollo, requiere aumentar su inventario del hato ganadero,de esta forma poder aportar al desarrollo de la económia del pais y mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia, este señor trabaja en las actividades agricola y ganadera en compañia  de sus 4 hijas,  es un hombre con lideazgo en la comunidad de Villa Alvares de Nueva Guinea, tiene buenas relaciones humanas con las personas que necesitan,  fue recomendado por lideres de la comarca, por su comportamiento, este cliente necesita de apoyo de la institución para continuar mejorando sus condicones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Farmer Angel is asking the AFODENIC institution for his first credit in order to purchase a calf to rear: he needs to increase the inventory of his livestock herd, as in this way he can contribute to the economic development of his country and improve his family's living conditions. This gentleman works in agricultural activities and livestock rearing in the company of his four daughters. He is a man with leadership qualities in the community of Villa Alvares in New Guinea. He has good working relations with all the people necessary, and has been recommended by regional leaders for his good character, this client needs the help of the institution to continue improving the conditions of his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calf to rear

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Mr. Son O. was born in 1955 and he now lives in Samroang Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. His wife, Mrs. Nu Soem, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Because her field is infertile, Mr. Son O. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and a pump to water the field. Mr. Son O. has six children, one of whom is a motorbike repairer while another is a cleaner and the remaining four attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and an irrigation pump.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, centro poblado D. Chipana, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D. 52 años D. edad, tienen 06 hijos, y es viuda; asimismo posee estudios D. primaria completa.
Trabaja hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorD. y venta D. ganado, su primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra D. alimento balanceado para engordar su ganado.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 meses D. manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la compra D. ganado vacuno (02 toros), los que engordará y venderá en mayor precio en la feria D. Pilcuyo o Ilave; ello le servirá para poder ayudar en los estudios superiores D. sus hijos, puesto que ese es el anhelo D. ella.
texts.en:
Señora Luisa is a member of the community bank “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, in Chipana, district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, Department of Puno. She is 52 years of age, has 6 children, is a widow, and has completed elementary school.

She has worked for two years with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She buys, fattens, and sells livestock. She invested her first loan of S/.300.00 nuevos soles in the purchase of feed to fatten her livestock. With this loan of S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles ($925), that she commits to repaying punctually in 5 months, she will buy cattle (2 bulls) that she will fatten and will sell at a better price in the Pilcuyo or Ilave fair. This will enable her to help in the higher education of her chidlren which is her greatest wish.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle (2 bulls) to fatten and sell at a better price in the fair in Pilcuyo or Ilave; this will allow her to be able to help in the higher education of her children, her greatest wish.

loans.name: Aun's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of four members, all residents in Odom Bang Commune, Battambang Province. Mr. Y. has been selected to be group leader by the group member. He usually leaves his house with his wife, working as construction workers for a small firm, and they both can earn around US$ 8 per day. The couple currently has five children who all are single: three are students and the other two are employed.

Y. and his wife are working hard every day and they are planning to work independently, so they have decided to request a loan as capital to buy construction materials and will use them to provide a service building houses.

The other three borrowers are:

S. R., a building worker, who needs a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorcycle; T., a local construction worker who is asking for a loan to purchase vegetables to sell at the market; and . C., a beer dealer for a company, who is applying for a loan to decorate her house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Laidou de l’association Sabaly est constitué de deux veuves et deux célibataires qui ont en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants,    vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Koumantou Préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes sont au  début de leur partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso,  elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Le présent prêt servira à acheter, 200 kg de céréales, 25 kg de feuille de rônier, et de l’encre pour faire des paniers destinés à la vente en gros. 
Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des agriculteurs des villages environnants. La vente est faite quotidiennement au marché de Koumantou et en gros aux forains venant des grandes villes. La clientèle est surtout composée de femmes.
De ces activités les membres du groupe Laïdou  envisagent gagner chacune en moyenne 12.500 FCFA par mois. Ce montant leur permettra de rembourser l’échéance mensuelle du prêt et satisfaire quelques dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The Laïdou group, part of the Sabaly association, is made up of two widows and two unmarried women, who have an average age of 36, 4 children, and live in traditional extended families in the village of Koumantou, Bougouni Prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women are at the beginning of their partnership with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso; they are on their first solidarity loan (group loan). This loan will be used to buy 200 kg of cereals, 25 kg of palm fronds, and ink to make baskets destined for wholesale.

They do their buying from farmers in the surrounding villages. They sell retail daily in the market of Koumantou and wholesale to itinerant merchants coming from the big towns. Their clientele is mainly composed of women. From their businesses, each of the members of the Laïdou group expects to make an average of 12,500 F CFA per month. This amount will permit them to make the monthly payment on the loan and cover some family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for sale and for crafts

loans.name: Danny

texts.es:
El señor Danny vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Villcanota de la zona de Munaypata de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como empleado de marketing en una institución, con esta actividad el cubre sus necesidades de alimentación y estudio, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de una computadora para su uso personal.

No es cliente de Impro pero por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito
texts.en:
Señor Danny lives in his parents' house on Villcanota Street in the Munaypata neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He works in marketing for an institution and this activity pays for his food and school expenses. The loan he is requesting is to buy a computer for his personal use. He is not a client of IMPRO but because of his social standing he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 30 years old, married, and has three children aged 12, 7 and 4. Asha has been a fish seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Tuwe wa kwel group loan (Group code 2048). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. She works hard at her business everyday. 

She requests her third loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more fish for resale. She hopes that through the loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale to expand her business

loans.name: Hamidi

texts.en:
Hamidi is a 56 year old woman who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Hamidi owns a bakery shop. She makes bread, “saj” and “mankoucheh”.  “Saj” is also the name of the metal oven where the traditional Lebanese saj bread is cooked. The oven is also used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or Mankoucheh. A Mankoucheh--looks like a folded pizza--most commonly has toppings like zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese), and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it throughout the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. 

Hamidi needs 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for her bakery. She has paid back her first loan on time and this is her second loan request. Her previous loan helped Hamidi improve her business. Hamidi's clients can be anybody. When she first started her work, she didn’t face difficulties. Hamidi decided to start her business because she wanted to have independence. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her bakery.

loans.name: Eddison

texts.en:
Every harvest season, Eddison is able to generate around PHP 30,000 net income from his one-hectare rice field. Eddison is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 that he will use to improve his farm.  With the help of the loan, he hopes to harvest a higher yield so he can save and pay for the education of his children. 
                              
Eddison is 38 years old and is married to Chona, who is a domestic helper abroad. Eddison is a good father of two children: Devorah is an 18-year-old college student and Michael Vincent is 16 years old and a senior in high school. His family resides in Barangay St. T. Alicia, Isabela, a rural area where farming is the main source of income of most of the people.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin is 39 years old, married and has three children. She sells phone rechargeable cards. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more rechargeable cards to sell. Oluwatoyin has been in business for over four years and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cards in bulk

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent N. is a tailor in Rwamagana, Rwanda. At 27 years old, he is married and is the father of two children.

Vincent has requested a loan of 500,000 Rwandan francs (FRW). He and another client, Chantal Uwingabire, share a shop together and are looking to expand their business by purchasing an electric sewing machine. The beautiful foot-powered sewing machines they currently use at the shop will withstand the frequent electricity shortages, but are unable to create the classic "zig-zag" stitch of quality, modern clothing. With the new machine, he expects to be able to increase business, working faster and creating better quality garments.

With the profits from the loan, Vincent hopes to pay school fees for his children and start some personal savings. This is Vincent's first loan with Vision Finance Company.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Xiomara Concepción

texts.es: Xiomara Concepción M. A.  reside en el departamento de Cabañas.  Xiomara tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo Brandon de 4 años. Xiomara posee su propio negocio el cual se encuentra ubicado en la cochera de su casa, vende variedad de ropa para niños y adultos. El deseo de Xioamara es comprar mercadería para jóvenes ya que son los que más visitan de su local y no encuentran estilos modernos y juveniles, esto solo será posible gracias a su crédito ya que Xiomara lo destinara para surtir su negocio y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Xiomara Concepción M. A. lives in the department of Cabañas. Xiomara is 21 and lives with her husband and her 4-year-old son, Brandon. Xiomara owns her own business, which is located in her garage. She sells a variety of clothing for children and adults. Her dream is to buy merchandise for young people since those that visit her location the most aren't finding young and modern styles. This will only be possible thanks to the credit that Xiomara will put towards supplying her business and generating more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia B. is from the village of Maluro, Tangub City, in Misamis Occidental province. She is 37 years old. Lilia is married. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juan Jose Dolores

texts.es: Juan Jose Dolores C. M. de 45 años de edad reside en Apopa municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Juan vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Juan se dedica a su negocio el que consiste en dar servicios de transporte de colonia a colonia,  ya que en esos lugares no hay transporte de buses que se dirija a colonias lejanas,  Juan es consciente que la seguridad de sus pasajeros es importante y es por eso que solicita este crédito; ya que su carro necesita de revisión y ajustes, lo cual le brinda a Juan la seguridad de sus clientes.

loans.use: Ajueste y revisión de su vehiculo

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
V., age 30, is a village man living in Pursat Province. He is a local crop farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on his own farmland.

To help meet his family's daily expense needs, his wife sells cooking supplies to neighbors from home for a profit. V. now has one son who is still not enrolled in school. Because selling grocery items is the main source of family income, V. is applying for a loan which will enable his wife to purchase additional inventory for sale. He proposes to use the leftover part of the loan to buy a pig to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for his wife's business

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun L. is a single woman, 51 years old, lives in Siem Reap Province. Hun L. now lives with her sister, who works raising poultry and works with her in the farming business. Hun L. currently owns a cultivating machine that she uses for her farming. In addition, she uses her machine to plow a nearby farmer’s farmland for profit. Hun L. is taking out her loan to buy gasoline for her machine and she purposes to use the rest of the loan to accrue amount of fertilizers and seeds for growing.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for her machine

loans.name: Josefa Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Josefa del Socorro M. Jiménez tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de un año de edad. Josefa se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, los cuales vende en su casa y también distribuye de manera ambulante a personas cercanas. Es importante mencionar que, ya la señora tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual dio inicio vendiendo poca cantidad de mercancías, debido a que lógicamente no tenía la clientela necesaria, esto fue debido a que sus hermanos la apoyaron para que ella tuviera de donde obtener ingresos, ya que los trabajos están escasos. El crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de ropa usada, ya que con este dinero le da solamente para comprar una paca de ropa seleccionada. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, de tal forma que pueda dejar de laborar, dedicarse a él enteramente y brindar estabilidad económica a su hijo pequeño. Desea por sobre todas las cosas brindar una educación superior a su hijo y que pueda ir a la universidad.
texts.en:
Josefa del Socorro M. Jiménez, 29, is a single mother with a one year old child. Josefa sells used clothes in her home. She also sells as a traveling saleswoman to people nearby. It is important to mention that she has been in this business for five years. She started the business selling a small quantity of merchandise because she did not have enough customers. Her siblings helped her so that she could have a way to get some income. Work is scarce. The loan is primarily to buy used clothes. The money is only to buy a pack of select clothing. Her dream is to improve her business in such a way that she can stop working and spend her time completely on her business. She would also like to bring economic stability to her small child. Above all else she would like to give her child a college education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba O. is 38 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of 5 children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now Nasiba dedicates herself to raising and selling the cattle and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy. Nasiba asks for a loan of $800 USD to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Maximo Antonio

texts.es: Máximo Antonio de 68 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de leña hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que su negocio ha crecido poco a poco ya que tiene su propio camión en donde ofrece sus productos en diferentes lugares y además el se queda en su vivienda porque aquí también ofrece este producto por lo que las familias nicaragüenses ocupan mucho este medio de cocinar, porque no tienen los suficientes recursos para comprar cocinas. El sueño de Máximo es ampliar su negocio en  zonas mucho mas rurales y así abastecería muchas comarcas más. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Máximo Antonio, 68, sells firewood. He has been in this business for over 20 years. His business has grown little by little. He now has his own truck he uses to offer his products in different places. He also stays at home because he offers his products there as well. Nicaraguan families use this method of cooking a lot because they do not have sufficient resources to buy stoves. Máximo’s dream is to expand his business into more rural areas. That way he could supply many more regions. The loan is for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adejoke

texts.en: Adejoke is not a tailor but has been selling tailoring materials including zip, landings, and thread for the past six years. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction  she has with her customers. Adejoke is 35 years old, the mother of two children, and married to a civil servant. Now requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials to sell, she says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza C. is from the village of Rosevelt, Iligan City. She is 35 years old. Eliza is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eliza owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of rice in the local community. Eliza has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business, buying more rice to sell

loans.name: Taraji

texts.en:
Taraji is a young Palestinian woman, 30 years old. She is married with four children who are still at school.

Taraji started her business two years ago with the help of her husband to increase their income. Her husband works as a police officer and his salary is not enough for a family of six members, especially when everything in Gaza is getting more expensive due to the constraints. In addition, the family went through a tough time when the government salaries were stopped for more than a year in 2006/2007 when the USA and the EU stopped their support of the Palestinian National Authority after the 2006 election.

Taraji and her husband buy lambs, raise them, and then sell them to butcher shops. Taraji has requested 1,000 USD from FATEN to buy more lambs. In addition to that they plan to start their own butcher shop as the profit will be even greater.

Taraji appears in the photo with her husband at the barn carrying one of the lambs.

loans.use: To purchase more lambs and to open a butcher shop

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariana C. de 52 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil su casa es de cemento, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio no tiene hijos.

Mariana comenzó vendiendo pescados con su esposo, después de poco tiempo se compro un triciclo y implemento mas mariscos. Ahora ella y su esposo trabajan desde las 05h00 de la mañana hasta las 16h00 todos los días. Tienen un promedio de 20 clientes al día, venden cangrejos pescados de todo tipo, camarones. Una de los inconvenientes que tienen es cuando es veda de cangrejos y baja las ventas.

Con el préstamo quieren comprar cemento y piedras para poder construir mejor su vivienda. En el futuro quiere comprar un motor de lancha para solo dedicarse a la pesca de mariscos.
texts.en:
52-year old Mariana C. lives in a suburban area located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement. Her husband helps her with the business; she doesn’t have any children. Mariana and her husband began by selling fish only, and then a little while later she bought a food cart and sold shellfish too. Currently she and her husband work from 5am to 4pm every day. They have an average of 20 customers a day; they sell crab, all kinds of fish, and shrimps. One of their problems is when it is the closed season for crab, they make fewer sales. With the loan they want to buy cement and stones to improve the construction of their house. In the future Mariana wants to buy a motorboat so she can devote herself to catching shellfish.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement, stone

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera is 28 years old and married to a teacher. Her husband also supports the home. She has 4 children and her eldest child is 9 years old. She lives with her family in Lagos State, Nigeria. Sera  sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a super market in the future. She promises to pay back her loan promptly and she says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo Modelo B. tiene 52 años y vive en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge  y sus cuatro hijos en las edades de 25 y 34 años;  Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de fritos, bebidas aromáticos, café, canela y toronjil entre otras; es muy usual  ver a Guillermo, por la tarde de 2 a 9 p.m., circulando por Metrocentro, un centro comercial muy bien conocido en el sur de Barranquilla; Inició este negocio como vendedor de café en el año 2003, y gradualmente fue agregando  bebidas aromáticas variadas y fritos. Antes de  tener este negocio, vendía mercancías puerta a puerta, este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y desde que lo adquirió el ha sentido que ha  progresado, en términos de sus ingresos que han podido aumentar. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $ 1.300.000 para  mejorar la presentación  de su negocio y cooperar en la conservación ambiental; él va a invertirlo en la compra de equipos de trabajo que están deteriorándose: por ejemplo una cava, unos termos, una licuadora, un exprimidor de naranjas y una vitrina térmica.
Su mayor desafío es progresar en su negocio y ayudar a que su familia salga adelante; sueña con tener ubicado su negocio en un sitio estable donde pueda vender sus productos y con tener una casa propia lo cual generaría mucha estabilidad.
texts.en:
Guillermo Modelo B. is 52 years old and lives in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla, with his spouse and his four children, who are between the ages of 25 and 34. He works preparing and selling fried foods and aromatic beverages, including coffee, cinnamon tea, melissa tea, and others. Between 2 and 9 p.m., it is very common to see Guillermo circulating in Metrocentro, a very well-known shopping center in the south of Barranquilla. He started this business as a coffee vendor in 2003, and he gradually added a variety of beverages and fried foods. Before starting this business, he sold merchandise door to door. This is his second loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and since receiving credit, he feels that he has made progress in terms of his income, which he has been able to increase. He is currently applying for a loan in the value of 1,300,000 Colombian pesos (COP) to improve the presentation of his business and to help protect the environment. He will invest the funds in purchasing equipment for his business that is currently in poor condition, such as a cooler, some thermos bottles, a blender, an orange juicer and a thermal display case. His greatest challenge is to make progress with his business and help his family get ahead. He dreams of operating his business on a permanent site where he can sell his products, and having a house of his own, which would give him great stability.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing equipment for his business, such as a cooler, thermos bottles, a blender, an orange juicer and a thermal display case

loans.name: Joana Francisco

texts.pt:
Joana Francisco S. nasceu no Distrito de Magude, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 48 anos de idade casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 29, 20, 15 e 8 anos de idade, apenas 2 vão a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.

Saiu de Magude para o bairro de Mafuiane Distrito de Namaacha com os seus pais, onde vive ate hoje. Trabalha com empregada domestica há mais de 4 anos, faz um horário único das 6:00h as 15:30h todos os dias. Teve que recorrer a este emprego devido as dificuldades que encarava na sua vida financeira. Tem um salário mensal de 4.500.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa para eventuais despesas de casa.

Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu irmaõ que também é cliente da mesma instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 3.500.00mt, 4.000.00mt, 4.400.00mt e 7.400.00mt todos para a mesma actividade. 

No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e investir no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Joana Francisco S. was born in the Magude district, in the Maputo province, in the south of Mozambique. She is 48 years old, and is married with 4 children who are 29, 20, 15, and 8 years old, two of whom attend school. Joana only completed 4th grade and did not continue due to financial restrictions. She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone besides her children.

She left Magude for the Mafuiane neighborhood in the Namaacha district with her parents, where she still lives today. She has worked as a housekeeper for the past 4 years, and she keeps a daily schedule of 6:00 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. She had to resort to this job because of economic hardship. She earns a monthly salary of 4,500 MT, which she uses to pay for her household expenses while still saving some for future expenses as well.

She has never had a loan with other banks. She came to know Hluvuku through her brother who is also a client. This is her 5th loan for the amount of 15,000 MT, which she plans to use to purchase construction materials (sand, cement, iron, and others) to continue the construction of her home. The previous loans were for 3,500MT, 4,000MT, 4,400MT, and 7,400MT and all were used for the same purpose.

In the future, she would like to seek additional loans to finish her home and invest in her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials (sand, cement, iron, and others)

loans.name: Dioma

texts.fr: Madame Dioma D. gère  une boutique de  ou elle vend des denrées  alimentaires chez son père. Elle évolué  dans le commerce depuis plus de 3 ans. Mais elle a une activité  secondaire de tricotage. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 3 enfants. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs pour renforcer le stock de produits dans sa boutique. Ses bénéfices  lui permettent d’augmenter son fond de commerce et de supporte les charges de  certains de ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Ms. Dioma D. manages a store in which she sells food items at her father's place. She has been advancing in commerce for over three years. But she has a secondary business involving hand-knitting. She is married and the mother of three children. She is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs for bolstering her stock of goods in her store. Her profits enable her to increase her capital and to cover some of her personal needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Rafael Arcangel

texts.es: Rafael Arcángel tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. La actividad económica de Don Rafael es ofrecer los servicios de carpintería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio sus inicios se dieron porque tenía que mantener a 2 hijos y a su familia él es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de realizar su trabajo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene algunos pedidos pendientes, así podrá comprar madera. El sueña con mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Rafael Arcángel has been working with the Foundation for a long time. His business is carpentry. He has dedicated himself to this activity for more than 5 years, having started in order to support his 2 children and family. He is a very responsible man, who enjoys carrying out his work. The loan he is requesting is for working capital, as he has several pending orders, so he can buy lumber. He dreams of improving the quality of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Prima Esther

texts.es:
La señora Prima D. tiene 42 años de edad, es separada y tiene hijos ya independientes económicamente, es comerciante y vive en su propia casa que esta situada en el Barrio San Isidro Etapa I de la ciudad de Encarnación.

La señora Prima es propietaria de una Despensa bien surtida que esta en la Feria Municipal La Placita, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años y le ha ido muy bien ya que posee muchos clientes que le conocen y que diariamente se acercan a comprar sus productos. 
Mediante este trabajo ella siempre ha podido solventar los gastos del hogar, mantener a sus hijos, y cubrir cualquier imprevisto que se le pudiera presentar.

Ella ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de mas mercaderías para la su despensa, tales como: harina de maíz, almidón, queso, leche, huevos y otros.
texts.en:
Señora Prima D. is 42 years old, she is separated from her husband and her children are already economically independent. She is store owner and lives in her own house which is situated in the neighborhood, San Isidro Etapa in the city of Encarnación. Prima is the owner of a store that is well located, it is in the municipal fair La Placita. She has worked in this job for many years and has done very well, she has many clients that come daily to buy her products. Through this work she has always been able to cover the expenses of the house, to raise her children and to cover whatever has unexpectedly presented itself. She is seeking this loan to buy more merchandise for her store, things like: corn flour, starch, cheese, milk, eggs and others.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her store, things like: corn flour, starch, cheese, milk, eggs and others.

loans.name: Harvest Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Adwoa is forty-five years old. She is a divorcee and has five children under her care. They are between the ages of seventeen and twenty-seven years old. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the community.

Adwoa is a hard-working and trustworthy woman. She is a petty trader. She trades in provisions and perishable goods. She has been trading for five years now.   Adwoa wants the loan to purchase provisions and other goods – vegetables, food items, etc., in bulk. She buys from nearby towns. She hopes to see some of her children attain higher education. 

Adwoa is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Harvest’. The group is made up of six members who are mainly petty traders and food vendors. They are requesting the loan to procure goods and raw materials in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase bags of sugar, milk and rice

loans.name: Rosa Carmina

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Rosa Carmina I. le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su casa.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora, porque le preocupa la seguridad de su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como encargada de un centro comercial.
texts.en:
Rosa Carmina house is lacking a fence around its border. She is asking for the loan to buy materials and to pay the person who will make the improvement. She doesn't have the money for the improvement, and she is worried about her family's safety. She plans on paying off the loan with the income she receives from her job at a shopping mall.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make a fence around her house.

loans.name: Hoeurn's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of nine people, located in Ta Kol village in Kandal province. Mr. Tim S. is 63 years and is a village bank president, having been selected by its members.
