The members of this village loan will use it to support their different purposes and this loan also they hope to increase their income to improve the family's costs of living. 

Mr. Tim S. and his wife, Mrs. Chhoun Touch, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They are able to earn a small income to support their family's costs of living. In order to support this dry season of farming, Mr. Tim S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for laborers to plow his farm. Aside from farming, Mr. Tim S. is a farm laborer where he can receive a small salary to support his family's costs of living. This couple has two children, all seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay for laborers to plow his farm.

loans.name: Santos Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Santos Juan C.
texts.en: Santos Juan C.

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Tierra Fertil 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Laura is the coordinator of her group Tierra Fertil 1, 2 & 3 (Fertile Ground). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long term partner and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to improve her business.

Laura is excited to take her first loan. She plans to invest it in her business by buying hot dog sausages to sell nearby her house. She started this business 6 months ago, when her church planned an outdoor activity and she decided to sell baked sausages. Now, for a second business activity, she wants to sell shoes and accessories from a catalog. She will invest the profits in her business. Her dreams after having a successful business are to attend college and have her own home.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in L. Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free traD. zones are common. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy sausages, shoes, and accessories to resell.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is 30 years old and married with one child.  For four years, he has been operating a retail shop.  He is also a taxi driver.  He has been an active member of 'Brotherhood' group under Faulu Kenya.  In this group, he saves his money.  He has previously serviced one loan from Faulu Kenya which he used to increase his stock.  He is requesting 30,000 KES to buy sugar, rice and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has been operating his mixed farm in Litein town, Rift Valley Kenya for ten years. His main products are tea and milk, which he sells to the local market. He depends on the income from his farming activities to provide for the needs of the family.

Paul is 32 years old. He is married and has 2 children, ages 5 and 6. Both children attend school.

Paul has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 35,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes to acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production. He says that the extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children.

In future, he would like to have a dairy cow, which can produce at least 20 litres of milk daily. He would like to request Juhudi to help him acquire good quality dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nghiêm

texts.en:
H. Nghiêm Thị (20201020055) is a 50 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has three adult children. To making a living, H. owns a specialized retail store selling metal and metal-related products. H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month.

In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase additional products to sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the second taken out by H. from SEDA.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nghiêm Thị (20201020055) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm kim loại & có liên quan đến kim loại trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Louie

texts.en:
Louie M. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz. He is 30 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Louie owns & operates a transportation business. He has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Louie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle in order to offer better service. This will be his second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three  offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle in order to provide better service

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza G. is a 21-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: gardening and a business buying and selling vegetables. She lives in Prk. Masayawan, Brgy. Dumarao, Roxas, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her gardening and vegetables businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,800. Liza is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she  can purchase fertilizers and use the rest of the loan as additional capital.  This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. 

Liza aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and additional capital

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is 29 years old, married, and blessed with a three-year-old child. For twelve years, he has been in the business of selling gas cylinders. Prior to that he was selling second-hand clothes.  Besides selling gas-cylinders, he operates a food kiosk. He has been able to run his business well, and thanks Faulu Kenya for training him in good customer care and business management.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to increase his stock of gas cylinders.

loans.use: to increase his stock of gas cylinders

loans.name: Dinara Musaeva's Group

texts.en:
The microfinance industry in Kyrgyzstan was developed in order to overcome poverty, raise the level of employment and promote the development of small businesses in Kyrgyzstan. It started functioning 15 years ago and is still successful today. The loans have helped thousands of families all over Kyrgyzstan.
Dinara M., 44, is the leader of this group from the village of Kochkor. Dinara is an experienced businesswoman since she has been involved in the cattle business for almost 16 years. A proud mother of four children, she hopes to provide a bright future for them. Her children are already college students and able to direct their lives by themselves. Dinara has applied for a loan to invest money in cattle raising. She plans to organize beautiful wedding ceremonies for her children, own good land and purchase a new car.
Nurbubu C., 41, is married. She works as a seamstress and will use her loan to purchase cattle. In future, she plans to purchase a car and open her own clothing workshop.
Altynbek A., 25, is married. He is a farmer and has applied for a loan in order to purchase additional cattle. He hopes to have a new house in the future.
Cholpon A., 49, is married and owns a small grocery shop. The purpose of her loan is to increase her number of cattle. She would like to broaden her business in the future.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es:
El señor es soltero, vive en el barrio Villa Paso de la ciudad de Pilar.
Vive en casa propia, donde se refleja que poseen con todas las comodidades para un trabajador.
El mismo es comerciante, cuenta con una  empresa de servicios e ventas de comidas por deliveri, por pedido y servicios de restorant en su local propio, sobre la ruta.
Solicita el crédito para compras de insumos para la elaboración de hamburguesas para su negocio.
Cuenta con una antigüedad en el ramo más de 5 años, brindando sus buenos servicios a sus clientelas.
Cliente manifiesta que con la ayuda del crédito se ha fortalecido  más su microempresa y  agradece por los buenos servicios que les brinda la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
He is single and lives in the city of Pilar’s Villa Paso neighborhood.

He lives in his own house which has all the comforts a worker has.

He is a merchant.  He has a firm that provides home-delivered food on order and a restaurant in his own locale along the route.

He is asking for funds to buy ingredients to make hamburgers for his business.

He has been in this line of work for 5 years providing good customer service.

He states that help from the loan has strengthened his mini business and he expressed his gratitude for the good services that Fundación Paraguaya provides.

loans.use: To buy baked goods, vegetables and other ingredients to make hamburgers to sell.

loans.name: Trigidia

texts.en:
Trigidia is forty-seven years old.  She lives in the village of Santa Elena in the district of TambogranD. in northern Peru.  TambogranD. is a primarily rural region with a large number of small fruit farmers and families that raise animals.  Trigidia lives there with her husband and her father.  They share a happy and stable home.

Trigidia raises goats in the land near her home.  She raises the animals in corrals and feeds them local plants or feed which she purchases.  She sells them in local markets for their meat.  She also has a small stall in which she sells juices, a soy based drink and various foods, candies and other items.  Trigidia’s husband works during the week near the city of Piura running heavy machinery and earning stable wages.  He comes home each Saturday to spend time with the family.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional feed for the animals and improve the selection of merchandise that Trigidia sells.  She hopes to be able to get a good bulk discount on the feed and improve the profit margin of her businesses.  She is proud to manage these portions of the family business and improve her family’s well being.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for the animals and improve the selection of merchandise that Trigidia sells.

loans.name: Celis

texts.es:
Celis es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector San Martín del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona urbano – marginal que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte) el brinda este servicio en las principales calles de su distrito y en las zonas aledañas. Trabaja durante todo el día y los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le ayudan a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

El continuo uso ha hecho que su vehículo empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo destinado para reparar y darle mantenimiento a su unidad motorizada, así como compra de accesorios adicionales. Con este préstamo el podrá tener una mejor unidad de transporte, evitando posibles problemas futuros de averías.
texts.en:
Celis is a 32 year old father who lives with his family in the San Martín sector of the Lambayeque district, a marginally urban area located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
He offers a tranportation service for goods and people in a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle that pulls a cabin where the people or goods sit.) He offers this service in the main streets of his district and in the surrounding area. He works every day and the income that he gets helps him with his personal expenses and enables him to support his family. 
Continuous use has caused wear and tear to his vehicle, and it requires urgent repair to guarantee that it will work properly. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa to repair and maintain his mototaxi, and also to buy some additional accessories. This loan will enable him to have a better vehicle and avoid future problems.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Jorge David

texts.es:
Jorge David O. M. tiene 38 años,  Es Soltero, vive con su hermano  en  el Cantón Ventanas en la  Provincia de los Ríos.  No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE se encuentra ubicada En el recinto Cachel y Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul., esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Jorge David se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Agro Karlyta y vende su producto en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder comprar una casa y un  terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Jorge David O. M. is 38 years old, single, with no children, and lives with his brother in Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province. The Nuevo Horizonte [New Horizon] communal bank is located in the Cachel y Grande district, in Ventanas Canton, and its members work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas. They have been doing this for a long time.

Jorge David grows corn, rice and pigeon peas. He buys his products in Agro Karlyta and sells them at the market in Ventanas. He requests the loan in order to buy agricultural products and fertilizers for growing corn, rice and pigeon peas. This loan will help him financially to meet his needs. He faces challenges such as pests, diseases and changes in the weather. His dream is to buy a house and land. He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Fena

texts.es:
Fena tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Godoy, de 28 años, y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

Aunque Fena nunca pudo realizar estudios superiores, siempre trató de sobresalir y demostrar que podía llevar una vida normal. Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de plátano y café, actividad que aprendió desde muy pequeña y que ahora le brinda los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace siempre con una sonrisa; lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus cultivos, ya que los químicos que usa son muy peligrosos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar la cantidad de sus cultivos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Fena con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, pues sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyarán y la guiarán, ya que es una socia muy querida.
Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Fena is 39 years old; she is a very humble and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband, Godoy, who is 28 years old, and their two beloved children. She wishes to provide them with a better quality of life. 

Although Fena was never able to go to high school, she has always tried to improve herself and to demonstrate that she can have a normal life. Currently she has a banana and coffee plantation, a business she learned since she was very young. This business today provides her with the income she needs to support her family. 

What she most enjoys about her work is to harvest the fields and she always does it with a smile on her face. She has 10 years in the business and the most difficult part of her work is to fumigate the plantations, especially because the chemicals she uses are very dangerous. With time she hopes to purchase more land to expand the quantity of her cultivations.

This is Fena's second loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she plans on making her payments on time. She wants to be able to access other loans in the future to improve her business. She knows that her communal bank will support her and guide her, especially because she is appreciated as a member. 

With the eight hundred nuevos soles requested, she will purchase more fertilizer to make her land more fertile.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is 26 years old. She is the mother of three children; the eldest is 8 years old, while the youngest is 3 years old. 

She owns a store in which she sells various foods, such as rice. She has run this business for eight years and, together with her husband, it has helped her build her own house. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more food stock. She is planning to save all her profits for when she will have enough to build a house.

loans.use: Buying more food stock.

loans.name: Estrellieta

texts.en:
Estrellieta G. is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old. Estrellieta is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Estrellieta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks & toothpaste in the local community. Estrellieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Estrellieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrellieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Estrellieta is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Estrellieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned & snack foods

loans.name: Mariana Lucia

texts.es:
Mariana es una mujer activa, madre de dos hijas, hoy en día sigue laborando en proyectos e organizaciones extranjeras, en programas sociales de familia, abarcando las familias de pocos recursos económicos. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien labora como ingeniero civil. Es atreves de los financiamientos que comienza hacer mejora  a su casa, en donde ha repellado paredes, embaldosar, compra de lavandero, y ahora con este nuevo préstamo hará la construcción de un muro para reguardar su vivienda, a si como mejor seguridad para su familia.
Materiales a utilizar: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, piedrín entre otros.
Contenta porque, ha logrado el objetivo de mejorar su casa, pagando  a plazos, lo que se ayuda en su economía.
texts.en:
Mariana is an active woman and the mother of two daughters. Currently she has taken on some projects with international organizations in social programs geared towards the family, especially families of limited financial resources. She has her husband’s support. He works as civil engineer. It is through the loans that she has been able to improve their house, having plastered the walls, add tiling, and to purchase a sink. With this new loan she will build a wall to protect her house and to add greater security to her family. 

Materials that will be used: rocks, sand, cement, steel, gravel and others.

She comments that she has reached her objective of improving their house by making loan payments and this has helped their finances.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.ar: محمد يبلغ 46 سنة متزوج  ويعمل في زراعة وتنسيق الحدائق له  17 سنة في عمله، وهو يحب عمله كثيراً ويتميز به في الابتكار والتطور. يسعى محمد الى تطوير عمله من خلال شراء أدوات زراعية متطورة، بالإضافة إلى البذور الجديدة وذلك لإستقطاب أكبر عدد من الزبائن بما يرضي أذواقهم، لهذا تقدم بطلب  قرض من المجموعة.زبائنه هم جيرانه، أصدقاء وأقارب. خبرته كبيرة وهو يتميز بذوقه الرفيع بحبسب ما يقوله عنه زبائنه.
texts.en: Mouhamad is 46 years old and married. He works as a gardener cultivating and growing flowers and has 17 years of experience. He loves his work and is innovative and progressive in it. He wants to expand his business. With this loan he hopes to have enough capital to purchase more tools and materials. His customers include his neighbours and those that live around him. His business is unique.

loans.use: To purchase new improved tools and seeds to expand his business

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima G. lives with her husband and three children in Noravan village in the Syunik region. The family has land but is currently unable to cultivate it due to very limited financial resources. Both Rima and her husband are unemployed, and there is no work in the neighborhood. For Rima it is vital to get the spring farming work started to insure some income to cover the most basic costs in her household.

loans.use: buy farming equipment to cultivate her land

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two children, aged 18 and 25, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house, in the outlying 'ger' districts of the city. Her son attends public school while her husband works at a rural company. 

Tungalag supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with help from her daughter. 

When she first began her business in 2000, she sold her handmade coats of various types at the stall of another person. Now her business has grown so that today her working capital is 3,000,000 MNT and she sells clothes imported from Ereen, a border city of China, as well as her handmade clothes in her stall. During these years, she has been successfully improving her living standards and her business with her earnings. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase clothing materials and she’ll sew coats for spring.

Her 2011 goal is to expand her business with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase materials to sew coats for spring.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny C. is a 30-year-old, married man from the village of Songco, Lantapan, Bukidnon. Johnny and his wife have one school-age child. To earn a living, Johnny owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, he runs a sari-sari (variety) shop, and his primary source of income is derived from buying and selling items like bread, junk food, canned goods, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in his local community. He also makes and sells barbecue meats (pork and chicken). Johnny has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2011, Johnny joined HSPFI to gain much-needed access to financial services. In turn, he hopes to be better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve his family's standard of living. Johnny is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and junk food. This loan would be the first loan taken out by Johnny from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods and junk food

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela S. is 47 years old and married with four children.

Romela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Romela has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 11 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Romela aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary, a 31-year-old mother of four children aged 6-12 years, is married to a teacher and they reside in their own three-roomed house in Karuguuza, Uganda. A hard-working mother whose goal is to educate her children, Rosemary started a small retail shop a year-and-a-half ago. She diligently saved her business proceeds and bought a plot of land. With the dream of upgrading her shop, Rosemary is requesting a loan to purchase soda, sugar and soap for her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase soda, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto de 23 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores es el comercio al por mayor y menor, turismo y en las zonas aledañas la agricultura y ganadería.

Luis Alberto se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (transporte utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas) desde hace 3 años, la cual la trabaja mañana y tarde en la zona donde vive, a pesar de la competencia que existe el aprovecha en transportar una buena cantidad de personas, con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi y realizar algunos cambios de repuesto, al poderles ofrecer un buen servicio aumentará su clientela y por ende sus ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Luis Alberto es muy conocido por ser una persona de  confianza, respetuoso y responsable con sus clientes que utilizan su transporte, con el objetivo de seguir mejorando en la vida para que más adelante pueda adquirir otra unidad móvil.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in their own home in the province of Chiclayo, which has water and electricity service.  In this area, people work in wholesale and retail, tourism, and in the surrounding areas, agriculture and livestock.

Luis Alberto has worked for three years driving a mototaxi (a form of transport used on short routes).  He works in the morning and afternoon in the area where he lives.  Despite a lot of competition, he transports a number of people.  With his income, he can meet his needs.

He has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to perform maintenance on his mototaxi and change a few spares in order to offer a good service and expand his customer base and improve his income to have a better quality of life.  Luis Alberto is very well known as a trust-worthy, respectful, and responsible person by the customers who use his transport.  His goal is to continue improving in life so that in the future he can buy another vehicle.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his mototaxi and to change some spares.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a farmer and grows vegetables such as squash, eggplant and other green and leafy vegetables to earn a living. Juanita is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Juanita has been in her business for one year. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for her plantation.

Juanita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Juanita hopes to have good living conditions and a bigger savings deposit for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Tlaltepango Group

texts.es: El nombre de este grupo es "Las Estrellas de Tlaltepango", este nombre fue adoptado porque asi se llama el el barrio donde se reunen, ellas se consideran unas estrellas. El grupo se ubica en Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo. La señora JAZMIN es la Tesorera del grupo, ella tiene 19 años de edad y estudio unicamente la primaria. Vende Pollo de engorda. La señora es reconocida por sus compañeras por una persona responsable y que ha salido adelante, siendo originaria de esta comunidad ha ido progresando desde hace 3 años, el prestamo lo requiere para invertir mas en su negocio de venta de pollos. Con el prestamo va a comprar alimentos y productos de limpieza para la crianza y engorda de sus aves. Con las ganancias continuará invirtiendo en su negocio ya que sus aves necesitan dedicarle mucho tiempo para posteriormente venderlos, tambien quiere seguir apoyando a su familia en los gastos economicos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group’s name is “Las Estrellas de Tlaltepango” (Stars of Tlaltepango).  The name was chosen because that’s the name of the neighborhood they meet in and they consider themselves stars.  The group is located in Puebla, México and it has 10 members.  This is their first loan request.
Jazmín is group Treasurer.  She is 19 years old and only went to elementary school.  She sells chickens she raised.  She is known by her fellow members for being a responsible person who has managed to get ahead.  She’s from this community and has been making progress for the last three years.  She wants the loan to invest in her chicken raising business.

She will use the loan to buy feed and cleaning supplies to use in the care and feeding of her fowl.  With profits she will continue investing in her business because the fowl require time for subsequent sale.  She also wants to continue helping her family with expenses and offering them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, married to Kareauki. They are blessed with six children ages sixteen, fourteen, twelve, ten, eight and six years. He has been keeping livestock for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD. He  will use the loan to buy goats, cows, sheep and chicken to grow his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy a piece of land for grazing the livestock. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children amd buy a piece of land for developing.

loans.use: To buy goats, cows, sheep and chicken to grow his business

loans.name: Truc

texts.en:
Truc, 43 years old, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her husband and daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. Truc's husband is a worker in a local factory. She supports her family by selling rice from her house. 

Truc requires a loan to buy more kinds of rice to expand her business and increase her sales. 

Truc hopes that her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of rice to sell.

loans.name: Qory Orcco-Pucyura Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORY ORCCO-PUCYURA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Pucyura, perteneciente a la provincia D. Anta y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Albertina; ella es casada y tiene 56 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio D. venta D. granos secos como quinua, trigo y cebada y también se dedica al negocio D. crianza D. cuyes, ella venD. los cuyes y los granos secos en forma ambulatoria en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito D. Anta, la socia por medio D. este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. granos secos y negocio D. venta D. cuyes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar granos secos como trigo, cebada y quinua y también para comprar cuyes al por mayor.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio D. venta D. verduras, negocio D. venta D. comida, negocio D. venta D. hortalizas, negocio D. venta D. tienda D. abarrotes, negocio D. agricultura.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal no estaba presente el dia D. la reuinion porque ella pidio permiso, ella vino al dia siguiente y le tomamos la foto.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “QORY ORCCO-PUCYURA” Communal Bank. This bank is located in the Pucyura district, belonging to the Anta province, Cusco department.

Sra. Albertina is 56, married, and has 4 children. She sells dried grains such as quinoa, wheat and barley, and she also has a business raising guinea pigs. She sells the guinea pigs and dried grains in a stall in the different markets in the Anta district. Through this business, she is getting her children ahead. She wants to expand her dried grains business and her guinea pig business. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of dried grains such as wheat, barley and quinoa, and for the wholesale purchase of guinea pigs.

The other members sell vegetables, food, garden produce, have a grocery store, or are farmers.

Albertina thanks those who will be part of this dream through this loan, and promises to repay her quotas as established.

The member who is shown in the smaller picture was not present on the day of the meeting because she asked permission to be absetn; she came the following day and the picture was taken then.

loans.use: to purchase dry grains such as wheat, barley and quinoa, and to purchase guinea pigs wholesale.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La Srita Celia se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de artesanías y quiere comprar mas mercancía para que sus ingresos aumenten,  ella esta contenta de habernos encontrado porque así  podrá  llevar a cabo su proyecto ya que   ve  en el crédito  la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio  ofreciéndoles a  su  clientes  mayor   variedad  de  productos  y  el excelente  servicio  que  la  caracteriza.
texts.en: Celia has worked for two years selling arts and crafts and would like to buy more stock in order to increase her income. She is happy to have found us because she now will be able to carry out her project. The loan will give her the opportunity to grow her business by offering her customers a greater variety of products, along with the excellent service she is known for.

loans.use: buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mаhpora

texts.ru: Махпора женщина предприниматель. Она занимается куплей и продажей обуви, одежды, разных материалов. Также она покупает и продает парфюмерию и другие промышленные товары. Махпора ведет бизнес совместно с супругом, который помогает ей во всем.  Она два раза в месяц едет в базар за покупкой нового товара. Она старается  обновлять  ассортимент товаров, чтобы привлечь  как можно больше покупателей-клиентов.
texts.en: Mahpora is female entrepreneur. She resells shoes, clothes and fabrics at her store. She also sells perfume and other goods. Mahpora runs her business together with her husband who helps her in the store. Twice a months she travels to a wholesale market to purchase more goods for her store. She tries her best to keep her inventory new and current so that she can attract more customers.

loans.use: to expand inventory and purchase winter clothes

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba moves around the vicinity of Elmina to sell cloth, plastic bowls and pans (as shown in the picture above). She is married to a farmer and has two children. As part of her responsibilities, she supports her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy cloth to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy cloth to sell.

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat is married and has 2 daughters and 2 sons, all of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his passengers.  He is the only breadwinner in the family.  Nowadays, his rickshaw is having problems and its body needs to be replaced.  For this purpose, Riffat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. The loan will help her husband repair his rickshaw and also buy a new body for it.  This will allow him to provide better quality transport services to his passengers and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for past 10 years and Riffat is confident about the positive financial growth for her husband's business after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Riffat.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Juana; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio D. venta D. comida,ella prepara pollo al horno,estofado D. pollo,saltado entre otras comidas,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,azucar,pollo y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en: Juana is a retail merchant.  She’s still selling food.  She makes roasted chicken, chicken stew and stir-fried chicken, among other dishes.  She wants to expand and improve the food sales business and is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to cook like rice, sugar, chicken and vegetables.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her meal preparation like rice, sugar, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 48 years old and married and with four children. She has been operating a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and has employed one person. She also sells charcoal for extra income.  

Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained on business management. This has helped her to improve the business.

She has requested a loan for for 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: San Pedro Y Pablo Group

texts.es:
“San Pedro y San Pablo” fue denominado el comité  formado por amigas y vecinas de una de las ciudades de Carapeguá, actualmente se encuentran en el 7° ciclo con 17 integrantes. Es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican diversas actividades, pero también realizan trabajos en conjunto para fomentar su trabajo en equipo.
Mercedes comenta que en su negocio de venta de joyas le va muy bien, puesto que ya tiene una variedad clientela, tanto de hombres como mujeres, siempre levanta muchos pedidos. Lo que la ayuda a progresar es la simpatía y la buena onda con la que atiende a sus cientes, y sumado a ello la cómoda manera de pago que ella les ofrece.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva, para la compra de anillos, pulseras, cadenas y demás tipos de joyas, lo cual la ayudara a abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank named “San Pedro y San Pablo” was formed by friends and neighbors from one of the cities of Carapeguá.  Now this group is in its 7th loan cycle with 17 members.  This is a group of very responsible and hardworking women.  They have a variety of businesses, but they also carry out joint activities to develop their teamwork.  

Mercedes comments than her business selling jewelry is going very well since she now has a varied clientele, as many men as women, and she always has a lot of orders.  What helps her to progress is the kindness and warmth with which she attends to her customers, and in addition to this, the easy payment terms that she offers.

She requests the assistance of the Fundacion and of Kiva, so that she can buy rings, bracelets, chains, and other types of jewelry.  This will help her to stock her business and have products available to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets, chains and other types of jewelry

loans.name: Alioune

texts.fr: Monsieur Alioune est âgé de 38 ans. Il vit au Sénégal depuis plusieurs années. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre un et sept ans. Il exerce l’activité de pêcheur  depuis 1988. Il est issu d’une famille de pêcheur  raison pour laquelle il a choisi cette activité dans le but de se procurer des revenus qui  peuvent l’aider dans la gestion des charges de sa famille. Il est membre d’un des  guichets de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il vit depuis mars 2010.Il a sollicité un prêt de 50 000frs qui était prévu pour l’achat d’un mouton , destiné a célébrer la fête de Tabaski pour sa famille. Ce financement  pourra l’aider a maintenir l’équilibre social de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Alioune is 38 years old. He has been living in Senegal for several years. He is married and the father of three children between the ages of one and seven.
He has been a fisherman since 1988. He is from a family of fishermen, which is why he elected this activity to generate revenues and help him support his family. He is a member of one of the local branches of U-IMCEC in the town where he has been living since 2010.
He requested a loan for 50,000 XOF, which was earmarked for the purchase of one lamb intended to celebrate the Tabaski festival with his family. This financing will help him maintain the social standing of his family.

loans.use: to buy lamb to celebrate a national holiday with his family.

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en:
Jemal is from the village of Disveli, East Georgia. He is 44 years old, married, and lives with his family: his wife Pati, 16-year-old daughter, 14-year-old son, and retired mother. Both of the children go to school. Jemal and Pati support the family, earning their living through agriculture. The family has five milk cows. Pati produces cheese and sells it to local dairy retailers. The family also owns 0.75 hectares of land, where they raise maize and haricot beans (green beans) to sell locally. The family's total average monthly income is 500 laris, including Jemal’s mother's monthly pension. 

Jemal has requested a loan so he can hire a tractor to cultivate his land and purchase fertilizer. With proper cultivation and fertilization, he will get a good harvest next year to sell for a good price. Any additional income will be used to cover the family's daily expenses throughout the year.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire a tractor for land cultivation.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for four years.

Ana is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal for resale. she will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Vafa

texts.en:
Vafa is a 37-year-old woman, married with one adorable daughter. She is a market vendor and sells cosmetics and deodorants, perfume, soap, shampoo and souvenirs. She has four years of experience in this field, which qualifies her as a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The products she sells are very popular among women. Vafa is always friendly and polite with her customers which make her business successful. Her monthly profit is 230 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). As this business is their only financial source, Vafa's husband helps her with the business. 

Vafa would like to expand her business and purchase more merchandise to diversify the range of products she sells. For this purpose, she applied for a 1000 AZN loan. She promises to pay back on time.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise and diversify her range of products.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "QORIMANKACHA"; Este banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y en el departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Beatriz; la socia tiene 47 años de edad, la socia apoya aún a sus hijos y ella es casada y la socia es docente de profesion en el area inicial y se dedica a la compra y venta de autopartes, la socia alterna de este modo sus actividades y mejora su ingreso economico,. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de autopartes. 



La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank "QORIMANKACHA".  This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco, and in the department of Cusco.

The partner is Beatriz. She is 47 years old.  She supports her children, and she is married.  She is a professional teacher in the first place, and she buys and sells auto parts.  The partner alternates her activities in this way and improves her income.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of auto parts.

The partner promises to follow through with the payment of her dues in the established time.

loans.use: to invest in auto parts.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Meet Nelson who lives in Kisii. This is a very fertile area where bananas and sugarcane do very well. He is married and has 6 children. Farming has been part of his life for close to 40 years. Nelson has the following: cows, poultry, mosquito net, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, and DVD,' but does not have pigs, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile, or electricity.

His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops. He says that marketing his farm output poses a major challenge to him, while selling the milk produced poses greater joy. Some farmers usually name their animals and Nelson is one of them, and has given his cow the name of 'Nyansanoko'.

When asked how Juhudi Kilimo has benefited him, he said that it helped him expand his dairy farm by giving him a loan to purchase a dairy cow. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'How to develop a saving culture.'

His highest monthly expenses are farming costs. When asked how will this loan benefit his family, Nelson replied: 'it will provide for their basic needs through the increased income'.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Basher's Group

texts.en:
Basher is a member of this group from Iraq. Basher is 33 years old, married and has three children. Basher opened a electric devices shop four years ago and managed to provide the essentials needed to his family. 
Basher has a smart boy in primary school; always get high grades in school.
Knowing the importance of education for his children future, he is requesting a loan to pay for his son's tuition fees and other school expenses.  Basher aim to see his children get best education, 
The story of Basher and his son is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients that are able to get better education.

loans.use: Each member of Basher's Group's $ 3,000 loan intends to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria del Carmen began her seamstress business since when she was 15 years old, she studied this profession but she could not conclude for limited economic resources, however it has allowed her to has a job and earns some money. Her husband is an employee but his salary is not enough to cover all home necessities, for that reason Maria del Carmen decided to started her own business and contribute with the family expenses. She has 2 children who are her inspiration to work day by day.

She requires a loan of $375 USD to purchase raw material like cloth, thread and more. She and her family need your support to continue financing the studies of her children. Maria del Carmen plans to return the loan in a term of 5 months, she thanks your affection.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Maria del Carmen inicio su negocio de costurera desde que tenía 15 años de edad, estudio esta profesión pero no pudo concluir por falta de recursos económicos, sin embargo le ha permitido trabajar y ganar dinero ejerciéndola. Su esposo es obrero pero su sueldo no le permite cubrir todas las necesidades del hogar, por lo que Maria del Carmen decidió poner su propio negocio y contribuir con los gastos familiares. Tiene 2 hijos quien son su inspiración para trabajar día con día.

Maria del Carmen requiere de un préstamo de $375 USD para comprar insumos como telas, hilo y más. Ella y su familia necesitan de tu apoyo para seguir costeando los estudios de sus hijos. Maria del Carmen planea regresar el préstamo en un término de 5 meses, ella agradece tu cariño.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children. Her small business selling dishware, kitchenware and pottery is the main source of income for her family. Irina received her first loan from “Nadiya Ukraine” in June, 2002. Currently, she maintains around $7,000 in working capital and her monthly net profit amounts to $500. Irina has a perfect credit history with “Nadiya Ukraine”. She has promptly repaid all loans with no delinquencies. Her neat kiosk with a beautiful array of inventory, her customer-friendly service and exceptional prices has ensured the long-term success of Irina’s business. Irina would like to get a loan for $1,000 to re-stock her inventory. She is planning to increase her supplies of ceramic dish ware, porcelain dinner sets, cutlery, coffee mugs and fancy glasses to attract more potential clients to her vending kiosk. Irina believes her efforts and determination in combination with financial support will eventually help her to achieve her full potential, greater income, and success.

Ірина – одружена, в неї двоє дітей. Вона торгує посудом, кухонним приладдям та керамічними виробами. Цей бізнес є єдиним джерелом прибутку для її родини. Ірина отримала свою першу позику від „Надії України” в червні 2002 року. Зараз в неї приблизно 7000 доларів робочого капіталу, її щомісячний прибуток складає 500 доларів. В Ірини чудова кредитна історія в „Надії України”. Вона вчасно сплатила усі позики без жодних прострочень. Її акуратний кіоск, широкий вибір товарів, ввічливе обслуговування та помірна цінова політика забезпечили стабільний успіх бізнесу Ірини. Ірина хотіла б отримати позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб поповнити асортимент товарів. Вона планує закупити керамічний посуд, порцелянові столові набори та прилади, чашки та скляні вироби для того, щоб придбати більше потенційних клієнтів до свого кіоску. Ірина вважає, що її зусилля та наполегливість у поєднанні з фінансовою підтримкою допоможуть їй реалізувати власний потенціал, отримати більший прибуток та досягти успіху.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Abdul Qauom

texts.en: A. Qauom lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with all members of his family. He is a young and educated boy. He is single and he works to support himself. He is a shopkeeper. He has a cosmetics shop he wants to expand his business. He wants to take a individual loan to buy new designs of clothes and shoes and some other kits for cosmetics to attract more clients and do a good business to make a better future for himself.

loans.use: To expand his business into clothes and shoes

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Aged 38, Mrs. Kossiwa L. is married and has five (5) children. She currently lives in Mawussi in the sub-prefecture of Afagnan, where she runs her agricultural and handicraft (rope-making) businesses. The sale of agricultural products and ropes constitutes her sole source of income. Given that the growing season has begun and the region's soils are poor, she needs fertilizer to re-energize the production capacity of her soil in order to increase yield. In addition, she buys more often the raw materials for the fabrication of ropes. Limited by her means, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to invest in her business, whose yield will provide her with improved living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 38 ans, Madame L. Kossiwa est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Elle réside actuellement à Mawussi dans la sous préfecture d'Afagnan où elle exerce ses activités champêtres et artisanales (fabrication de cordes). La vente des produits agricoles et des cordes constitue sa seule source de revenu. La saison champêtre ayant débuté et les sols de sa localité étant pauvres, elle a besoin de fertilisants pour redynamiser la capacité de production de ses sols afin d'augmenter le rendement. En plus, elle achète plus souvent les matière premières servant à la fabrication des cordes. Limitée par ses moyens, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour pouvoir investir dans ses activités dont le rendement lui apportera une amélioration des conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: San

texts.en:
In the provinces of Cambodia, people rent sound systems (speakers and microphones) when they hold celebrations. Mrs. C. San's husband earns $5 a day renting sound systems to people in their community.

Mrs. C. San would like to use this loan to purchase another sound system - speakers and a microphone - to increase her husband's business.

Mrs. C. San is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children. She currently earns $3.70 a day working as a tailor.

loans.use: Purchase speakers and a microphone

loans.name: Mebel

texts.en: Mrs. Mebel A. is 33 years old, is married, and has three children. She lives in Benin City, where she sells drinks. She studied her business for 5 years, and and she has 15 years of experience in the business. She is seeking the sum of $800 to enable her to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en: Bahar is  a widow and lives in Khachmaz town. She does not have children. This 46-year-old woman has her own shop, where she sells clothes. She has two years of experience in this business. Now she needs a loan of  $850 to buy clothes for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Molemo A Group

texts.en:
Salome, age 48, is married with 2 children (ages 21 and 28). She owns a clothing business and also is a food vendor. She started the clothing business in 2005 and has been selling food since 1998. She works each day from 9am to 6pm at these businesses and currently makes a monthly profit of about $330.

In the past, Salome took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy inventory for her businesses. Having paid this back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Stella, who owns a tailoring business.

loans.use: To expand their two businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Victor makes different types of furniture from wood, and his business is located in the area of the May 1st highway.

His family is made up of his wife and children. Victor takes care of all the family expenses and his wife helps out with income she receives from the sale of raw milk. The family is very hard-working and continually looks for ways to get ahead.

Currently Victor is in the process of putting up his own carpentry workshop and is building a structure onto his home for this purpose. He would like to take advantage of the broad experience he has and above all, the steady clients who appreciate his work.

The competition in this sector is high, but Victor´s success is based on the quality of the finished work of his furniture. With the current loan request, Victor will buy different types of wood as well as iron and zinc with which to make a small shed where he can store his materials. Prices are stable and vary depending on the type of furniture, quality of wood, manual work, etc.

Victor currently has debts with small institutions which he pays off punctually, the same as he does with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Victor es un señor que se dedica a la fabricación de diferentes muebles de madera su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el sector de camino a 1ro de Mayo.

Su familia esta compuesta por su esposa y por los hijos, Victor se encarga de todos los gastos de la familia y la esposa le colabora con los ingresos que percibe por la venta de leche cruda. Esta familia es muy trabajadora y constantemente buscan el superarse.

Victor actualmente esta independizandose para poder tener su propia carpintería y está construyendo en su domicilio una estructura para poder armarla, él quiere aprovechar la gran experiencia que tiene y sobre todo la clientela fija que aprecia su trabajo.

La competencia en este sector es elevada, pero el éxito de Victor se basa en la calidad de acabado de sus muebles. Con la presente solicitud Victor comprará madera de diferentes tipos, también comprará fierro y calamina para poder hacer un pequeño galpon donde armará y depositará su materia prima. Los precios son estables y varian dependiendo del tipo de mueble, la calidad de la madera, trabajo manual, etc. Actualmente Victor tiene deudas en pequeñas instituciones las cuales cancela de manera puntual al igual que con nuestra Institución.

loans.use: Working capital and construction.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
"As you can see, the walls in my house are very deteriorated due to their age, and I would like to repair them before they collapse and cost more money to repair.”  I am requesting $600 to repair the walls of my home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

 “Como pueden darse cuenta las paredes de mi casa están muy deterioradas debido a los años, me gustaría repararlas antes de que se caigan ya que después tendría que invertir  más.” Solicito $ 600.00 dlls para reparar las paredes de mi vivienda.

loans.use: Repair walls

loans.name: Trois Cocotiers 2 Group

texts.fr:
Ndiaye Ndiaye lacks a population capable of consuming all of its seafood production, which includes shrimp, oysters, and smoked fish. This is why these women have formed a group to finance their purchase of storage material to keep the seafood products fresh, and especially to transport the products to the larger cities to sell.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Ndiaye ndiaye est dépourvu de populations capable de consommer toute la production en produits de mer, comme les crevettes, les huitres se, les poissons fumés. C'est pourquoi les femmes se sont constitués en Groupement pour disposer de financements qui leur permettent d'acheter du matériel de stockage pour mettre bien au frais les produits halieutiques mais surtout à pouvoir acheminer les produits dans les grandes villes et les vendre.

loans.use: To buy material for the storage and re-sale of seafood products

loans.name: Joke

texts.en: Joke A. lives at Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells weave-ons and hair-lengthening attachments, and she is also a hair stylist. It took her two and a half years to acquires these skills and she has been in this business since 2001. Joke is 29 years old and is married with three children. She needs a loan of $425 to buy more weave-ons and hair attachments to sell. This, she said, will help her serve her customer better. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more weave-ons and hair attachments

loans.name: Padagnassi

texts.fr:
Mme. Padagnassi A. has been a corn retailer since 1994. She was born on December 31, 1969, in Badou, in the Wawa prefecture in the Plateaux region of Togo. She is married to Mr. Akation A., who is retired. With three children dependent on her, she is an energetic woman who never gives up. Since starting her occupation, she has never diversified. She buys corn when it is plentiful and resells it when it is scarce, thereby turning a large profit. Currently, she has exhausted her stock, and requests her first loan to buy eleven sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Revendeuse de maïs depuis 1994, madame A. Padagnassi est née le 31 décembre 1969 à Badou dans la préfecture de WAWA dans la région des plateaux. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur A. Akation qui est un retraité. Avec trois enfants à charge elle est une femme dynamique qui ne baisse jamais les bras. Depuis qu’elle a commencé son activité, elle ne l’a jamais diversifié. Elle achète le maïs en période d’abondance le stock et le revend en temps de pénurie. Ainsi elle réalise beaucoup de bénéfice. Actuellement ayant épuisé son stock, elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 11 sacs de maïs.

loans.use: Purchase of eleven sacks of corn

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha baji is a widow of M. A. and has been living in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the last 29 years. Ayesha baji owns a three-room house. She is the mother of one son, Nadeem Akhtar. He is 21 years old and he has been in the business of selling cosmetics for the last 4 years. Ayesha baji successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is requesting a loan to buy more cosmetics to sell retail.

She is joined in her loan group by a three other members. Rani baji, Rashida baji, Zainab baji, and Zainab baji. Rani, Rashida, and Zainab request loans to buy fruits wholesale to sell retail. Zareena baji requests a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheel vehicle).

The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve current businesses

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma, 35 years old and married with five children between the ages of 12 and 1, has been selling coconuts, juice and khanga since 2005. Working daily from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Mwajuma is now requesting a loan to buy more coconuts and khanga to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and khanga for expansion of her business.

loans.name: Chicas De Monique Group

texts.es:
El Comitè “Las Chicas de Monique” se formó a partir de la unión de varias vecinas del barrio Barsequillo de San Lorenzo, este comité desde un principio se ha mostrado sólido en cuanto a su organización y muy activo y participativo a la vez.

Todas las integrantes del comité tienen en común la venta de productos cosméticos de la Hines Monique de ahí el nombre de dicho comité. En la fotografía tomada, se encuentran todas las integrantes del comité. Todas las integrantes tienen sus actividades propias, desarrollan sus emprendimientos en un tiempo extra para acrecentar sus ingresos. Sus integrantes han demostrado su unidad estableciendo normas y reglamentos internos a ser cumplidos, a más de organizar ferias de comidas y rifas para obtener fondos para el Comité.
texts.en:
The Committee “Las Chicas de Monique” formed beginning with the meeting of various neighbors in Barsequillo de San Lorenzo. Since its beginning this committee has demonstrated itself to be solid with regard to its organization and is very active and has good participation. All the members of the committee have selling Hines Monique cosmetics in common and that is where the name of the committee came from. In the photograph you will find all the members of the committee. All the members have their own businesses, they are developing their businesses as part time businesses to increase their income. The members have demonstrated their unity establishing internal norms and rules to follow, they organize food markets and raffles to obtain funds for the committee.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is a businessman who successfully combines running his business and taking care of his family of six. He has four kids: two boys and two girls. Gennadyi is originally from Kherson, a city in the south of Ukraine. He started his business 6 years ago after a desperate period of unemployment when his family didn’t get enough for their most basic needs. Today, he offers English language training and translation services to all willing to master this language or needing the help of an interpreter.

Gennadyi has a perfect credit history. He has already repaid 5 Nadiya Ukraine loans without any delinquencies. This time, he is requesting a loan of 6500 Grivnas to purchase a new computer and hi-tech software which would help him offer better quality language training and more sophisticated training materials for all of his students. All Gennadyi’s students give positive feedback on his services and admit that the knowledge and skills they get at his courses help them in their careers and lives. We believe this loan will also be repaid promptly.

loans.use: To purchase a new computer, software and books

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Sonia Juarez se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de diesel el cual los almacena en barriles y luego los comercializa en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo de Chinandega.

Con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos y siendo este negocio el único sustento del hogar ella ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo proporcionado por Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado préstamos que los ha sabido invertir en la compra del diesel. Una vez más espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con el negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia Juarez sells diesel which she stores in barrels and later sells out of her home in the Somotillo area of Chinandega. With the responsibility of taking care of her two children and with this business being the household's only source of income, she has been able to advance thanks to the support of Ceprodel, which has granted her loans that she has used to purchase diesel. Once more she hopes that her loan will be granted to continue the business in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of diesel

loans.name: Ufuoma

texts.en: Ufuoma O. owns a store where she sells bags of rice and beans, wholesale and retail. She travels to Lagos State to purchase her bags of rice and beans to sell in Benin City. She has been in this business since 2005. She needs the loan amount of N60, 000 to purchase more bags of rice and beans to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Kiwedde- Nandutu Aidat Group

texts.en:
N. Aidat (far right) represents her  small group of restaurant operators. She is 32 years old, married and a mother of 4. This hardworking lady owns continental services restaurant in Pallisa. She has 5 years experience in preparing both local and international dishes. Aidat has 2 lady employees who help her put with serving the customers. 

A plate of a local dish ranges between Ush100- Ush3000 whereas that of international  dishes costs betweenUsh5000-Ush10,000. Basing on her price list, her profit margin lies at approximately 30% of sales. Aidat is using the loan to purchase rice, maize and wheat flour, cereals. Aidat has great ambitions! She dreams of opening up a catering institution and a chain of restaurants in various towns. From her income, she takes care of her family needs.

loans.use: Purchase rice, maize and wheat flour, cereals.

loans.name: Mari

texts.en: Mari S. is 52 years old. She is married and had seven children. Unfortunately two of her children have passed away.  Two others are in school, and the rest are married. She sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the popular local foods; it is enjoyed as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, which is boiled and eaten with sugar, milk and bread or eaten with what we call Kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil, so in just 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge. With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to earn a good income to support her children in school. Mari belongs to a village bank called ‘Yeda Nyame ase’ which means We Thank God.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her porridge business.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Зебо Хайдаркулова  1968 года рождения, замужем, имеет 4 детей. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2008 года. Кредит получает для откорма скота. В настоящий момент сезон покупки скота, на рынке скот дешевый, она купит и продаст через 3 месяца дороже. В продаже и покупки скота  помогает муж и дети. Зебо благодарна КИВА и Микроинвест, за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Zebo H. was born in 1968, is married and has 4 children. She has partnered with MicroInvest since 2008. She gets loans for raising livestock. At this moment is the season for purchasing livestock, at the market livestock is cheap, she will purchase it and resell it in 3 months at a more expensive price. Her husband and children help her in the sale and purchase of livestock. Zebo is grateful to KIVA and MicroInvest for their help and support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad A. Z. is a 39-year-old married man with two children who lives in Shakra, in Nabatieh.  He used to work in a telephone and mobile shop since 1990, but in 2000 he opened his own shop.  Today, Mohammad wants to borrow $1,200 in order to buy postpaid recharge cards.

loans.use: Buy postpaid recharge cards.

loans.name: Anoumou

texts.en: Anoumou M. is a teacher who has three children.  Because his teacher's salary was not sufficient to support him and his children, he began selling the much-loved local beverage, Sodadi, in 2006.  He buys Sodadi in bulk in Tsévié in the country’s interior and transports it to be sold in Lomé, the capital of Togo. M.’s enterprise has been successful thus far because he carefully analyzed his business before beginning. He obtained a loan from Wages in 2006 to begin his business, and he is now seeking a second loan to buy 20 large containers of Sodadi and to transport them to Lomé.

loans.use: Purchase a local beverage

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine J. is renting a small parcel of land to farm rice. She is 55-years old and already a widow. She would like to grow her business and buy her own rice field someday. Now, she is worrying about how she will be able to stretch her limited income. She has decided to grow vegetables in her backyard for additional income.

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will help her family a lot to increase the harvest.

CEVI is a non-profit organization set up to respond to the needs of small entrepreneurs. It helps provide not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm necessities

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the town of Bambang. She is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a clothing business, primarily providing new clothing to local community members.

Josephine joined ASKI (Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc.) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

Through patience and sacrifices, Josephine believes that she can develop her business, paving her way to becoming a successful entrepreneur. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia B. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 31 years old. Lydia is married and has two school-aged children.
