texts.en: Hanaa is a married woman with one child. She is 42-year-old. She has been working in home-based food production since 2000. She produces food when her client's request it. Hanaa is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more merchandise, because the demand for her products is good.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina started her day care business 6 years ago after working at an electronics factory in Fremont for eighteen years. When she suddenly lost her job, she decided to take early-education classes to prepare her for opening a daycare.
 
Cristina started her daycare business in her living room with a few toys and two children. She now takes care of fourteen children and works hard to stay up-to-date on child care information by regularly attending training. She is thankful that despite the economy, parents are still able to keep their children in her daycare.
 
Cristina needs $10,000 to replace uneven cement in her outdoor play area to make it safer for the children in her care. She also wants to replace the fence in her backyard. A loan from Opportunity Fund will allow her to do this without placing a burden on her family’s personal finances.

Cristina has been unable to get a loan from a bank in the past and finds it a stressful process. This will be her second loan from Opportunity Fund, and she finds the support of micro-lending services almost too good to be true.

loans.use: To replace the flooring and fence in the outdoor play area

loans.name: Marithza Isabel

texts.es: La joven Maritza González  trabaja de cajera  en un negocio de llantas  lleva nueve años trabajando, cuando inicio entro como conserje, luego comenzó a estudiar ya que sus deseos es superarse como toda mujer. Pero abecés por recurso económicos se nos hace difícil, lo bueno es que logro que la ascendieron de puesto. Tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el barrio tres ochenta junto con su esposo y un hijo de un año, su casa ya la hizo pero falta repellarla, hacer las divisiones de los cuartos para mejor privacidad, el piso ya que es de tierra y quiere embaldosar para mejor higiene de su hijo. Su meta es poder seguir estudiando para llegar a optar por un mejor puesto como mejores ingresos. Con este préstamo  lo quiere es hacer un porche para empezar como un corredor y poco a poco terminarlo el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento. Esta contenta por lograr hacer cada vez más bonita su casa todo esto gracias al apoyo del financiamiento.
texts.en:
Young Marithza González works as a cashier in a tire business. She has worked there for nine years. She started there as a janitor, then began to go to school. However, studying was difficult due to her economic situation and the best she could achieve was a promotion at her job.

Marithza is 26 years old and lives in neighborhood 380 with her husband and one-year-old son. Their house is livable, but lacks plaster, and interior walls for privacy. The floor is dirt and they would like to cover it with tiles for the hygiene of the baby.

Her goal is to continue her studies to be able to choose a better job with better pay. With this loan, she will build a porch that will begin as a corridor and be finished little by little. The loan will pay for construction materials like stone, sand and cement. Marithza is happy to be able to make her house prettier each time with the help of this financing.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stone, cement, sand, steel, and roofing for corridor to be finished later

loans.name: Armeda

texts.en:
Armeda N., from the village of Manticao , Misamis Oriental, is 36 years old, single, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Armeda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop that sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Armeda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna T. is from the village of Mangidkid Plaridel Mis. Occ. She is 43 years old. Lorna is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lorna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future and to purchase feed.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 37 years old. Married with five children, Ama works to support her husband economically. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in a mining community. Ama trades in pastries (meat pies). She prepares the pasties and supplies them to retailers in her community. She has been in business for 14 years and wants to give her business a facelift. Ama requests a loan to procure bags of flour, sugar and other ingredients in bulk to be able to supply to more customers.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Believing God Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Believing God group. They are small scale entrepreneurs in Makeni City, who want a loan of SLL 2,500,000 to enable them to improve their businesses. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs will be accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, sales will thus improve, and so will be their sales-to-profit-margin. With a larger profit at their disposal, they will be able to better look after themselves and children.

The leader of this group is Yeabu K., who was born in a place call Robuya about 45 years ago. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending school. Two are in secondary school and two in primary school. Yeabu sells ground-nuts (peanuts) for 15 years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of ground-nuts and sell them retail.

loans.use: Buy bags of ground-nuts

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina, de 55 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 hijas; Mariela (21), Marianela (20) y Mónica (18). Juntas trabajan cada día para salir adelante.

Desde muy joven aprendió a hacer lindos decorados en material de corrospun (material micro poroso, tipo plástico de diferentes colores) para centros educativos y fiestas infantiles. Le gustaba dar vida a los personajes animados con cada trazo y cuando debió sacar adelante a sus tres hijas no dudó en trabajar en lo que mejor sabía hacer, pues debía conseguir que sus  hijas estudien y no les falte nada. A Delfina le entretiene mucho la producción de diferentes personajes animados en este material, ya que se requiere de paciencia y buen pulso y aunque es fácil, ella dice que lo difícil es perseverar en este negocio, pero lo ha logrado, ya que tiene varios pedidos de diferentes centros educativos en toda época del año. Su negocio le genera buenas ganancias económicas, por lo que para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar en su casa donde pueda ofrecer diferentes productos y también sus adornos en corrospun.

Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que su crédito para seguir trabajando. Por otro lado, está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su grupo, puesto que sus compañeras son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quieren quedar mal. Delfina tiene pensado destinar el dinero que solicita en la compra de material (corrospun), ya que tiene varios pedidos por cumplir y quiere tener todo el material disponible.
texts.en:
Delfina is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her three daughters: Mariela (21), Marianela (20) y Mónica (18). They work together every day to succeed. From the time when she was very young she learned to make pretty decorations in corrospun material (micro-porous plastic-like material of different colors) for educational centers and children's parties. She liked bringing animated characters to life with every stroke and when she had to support her three daughters she did not hesitate to work in what she knew how to do best, because she needed to help her daughters study and to provide for them. Delfina enjoys the production of different animated characters in this material, since patience and a steady hand are required. Even though it is easy, she mentions how hard it is to persevere in this business, but she has made it because she has several orders from different educational centers throughout the year. Her business generates enough financial gain for her, and in the future she plans to install a small bazaar in her home where she can offer different products and also her corrospun decorations. This is the 4th loan she has with MFP and she is very grateful with everyone that makes her loan possible so that she can keep working. She is also very satisfied with the work of the group, since her partners are very punctual in their payments, because they don't want to leave a bad impression. Delfina wants to use the requested money to purchase material (corrospun), since she already has several orders to fulfill and she wants to have all the material available.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Material for decorations

loans.name: Wake Up Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Wake Up Group' from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Members of this group are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from Kiva lenders in order to invest in their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

Heading this group is 43-year-old Yeanor Sesay, pictured on the right. A native of Binkolo village in northern Sierra Leone, Yeanor is married to a businessman and they have 3 children. Yeanor is a businesswoman who has been selling cooked rice, meat, and vegetables for more than 10 years now. With her share of the loan (SLL 500,000), Yeanor will expand her business by buying cooking materials like rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), fish, vegetables, etc., in larger quantity.

loans.use: Buy cooking materials like rice, palm oil, fish, vegetables, etc., in larger quantity

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, tiene 42 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos (Ingrid y Gonzalo), él pertenece al banco comunal “Sacsayhuaman” de la Asociación Arariwa, él tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde confecciona nacimientos de navideños de tipo cusqueño, él distribuye sus productos a los centros comerciales y a las tiendas de artesanías. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. El socio cuenta que las ventas han bajado hasta un  60&#xpo;r falta de turismo. Cesar requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo, esmaltes, pinturas. El anhelo del socio Cesar es implementar una tienda de abarrotes. El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
42-year old Cesar is married and has two children (Ingrid and Gonzalo). He is a member of the Arariwa Association’s Sacsayhuaman Community Bank. Cesar has a small workshop in his house where he makes Christmas ornaments typical of the Cusco region. He sells them in shopping centres and craft stores. He’s been doing this for 15 years, and all has gone well thanks to his hard work. Cesar says that sales have dropped some 60% because of a lack of tourists in the area. He would like a loan to buy materials such as glaze and paint for his work. One day he would like to open a grocery store. He is grateful for this opportunity to get a loan and promises to pay it back according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy glaze and paint

loans.name: María Fidelina

texts.es: María Fidelina H. D. M. D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en Zacatecoluca, departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor y junto a su hijo quien se dedica a estudiar. María  posee su propio negocio, el cual consiste en la compra D. ganado con la intención D. comercializar su carne y sus productos lácteos en primer lugar la leche. Así mismo desD. hace 2 años que se dedica a la compra y venta D. maíz, la cual venD. a una empresa muy famosa que venD. harina D. maíz. El negocio ha sido muy estable, sobretodo porque cuenta con la ventaja D. habitar en una zona muy apta para la crianza D. ganado y para la siembra D. maíz, lo cual le ayuda mucho con su negocio. María solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar más ganado, con e fin D. poder comercializar mayor cantidad D. carne D. res y leche. DesD. hace seis años que ella venD. carne, lo cual le ha permitido contar con muchos clientes, ya que es muy conocida por ser una persona responsable y trabajadora quien desea salir adelante y brindarle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María Fidelina H. D. M. is 52 years old and resides in Zacatecoluca, in the district of La Paz. She lives together with her spouse who works as a farmer and with her son who dedicates himself to his studies. María has her own business which consists of the purchase of cattle with the intention of selling their meat and milk products - mostly the milk.She has also dedicated herself to the purchase and sale of corn which she sells to a very famous business which sells corn flour. Her business has been very stable, mostly because it's based on the advantage of living in a zone which is very well suited for raising cattle and for planting corn. This greatly helps María with her business. María solicits a loan from Integral as it will enable her to purchase more livestock and commercialize a greater quantity of beef and milk. For the last six years she has been selling meat, which has permitted her to gain many clients, and she has become very well known as a responsible and hardworking person who wants to get ahead and give her family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Sandra Micaela

texts.es:
Sandra García de 34 años, vive en una zona periurbana  en la Perimetral (lugar muy humilde, las casas del sector están rodeadas de un estero donde pasan los barcos con cargamento pesado) de Guayaquil. Su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es madre soltera con un hijo de 11 años que estudia en una escuela fiscal. 

Sandra inicio el negocio de comidas típicas del Ecuador hace 4 meses con ayuda de su mama, en un local alado de su casa, vende arroz con pollo, tallarines y su especialidad es arroz con menestra y todo tipo de apanados de carnes. Todos los días a las 06h00 am comprar los víveres para la comida en el mercado. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, cajas de aceite, ollas para su negocio de comidas típicas. En el futuro quiere tener otros locales de comida.
texts.en:
Sandra García is 34 years old. She lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil, along the Perimetral (ring road), in a very humble area. The houses in this district are surrounded by a stream where ships with heavy cargo pass by. Her house is made of cement and has all the basic services. She is a single mother with a son of 11, who attends public school. Sandra began her business selling typical foods of Ecuador four months ago, with the help of her mother, in a place next to her house. She sells chicken with rice, noodles, and her specialties -- rice with vegetable stew and all kinds of meat empanadas. Every day at 6 am, she buys the ingredients for the food in the market. With the loan, she wants to buy rice, tins of oil, and pots for her business of typical foods. In the future, she wants to have other locations to sell food.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, tins of oil, pots

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a humble woman, 28 years old, and lives in the best territory of Kompong Tom, one of the provinces of Cambodia. She built a small cage where she feeds pigs to earn a living.

She is married with a young daughter who attends school. S. has another financial earner in her husband, who climbs many palm trees to tap juice to boil for sugar to sell.

S. faces a problem as her house is in need of repairs and her living condition has been affected. Because of this obstacle, S. is pursuing a loan in order to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Teleuli

texts.en:
Teleuli F. is 38 years old and married. She hash 7 children, ages 2 - 21,  She is starting a taxi business. Teleuli needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase fuel. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Teleuli joined SPBD. This is her first loan from SPBD. SPBD's loans are Teleuli's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase fuel

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Madame Ama O. is 59 years old. She sells cereals like corn and millet out of her home, and she also makes a local brew which she sells. Selling cereals is a small but lucrative business in Togo. Items like corn maize and millets are a staple of nearly every Togolese diet. Madame O. is a widow and has four children. She has requested a loan of 150,000 CFA to purchase more corn and millet to sell.

loans.use: To purchase maize and millet

loans.name: G.s. Divino Niño No. 10 Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Divino Niño N. 10 está conformado por Rosa Emelina y Dolores, pues siempre han trabajado juntas y tienen mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Rosa Emelina tiene la venta de bolsas plásticas la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingresos para sufragar los gastos de su familia, pues siempre le ha gustado mejorar su actividad y está pendiente para mejorar su actividad, por lo que siempre ha luchado por mejorar cada día. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima pues también su amiga Dolores que  se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general necesita invertir en nuevos productos.
texts.en:
The Group called Supportive Divine Boy N. 10 is composed of Rosa Emelina and Dolores, since they have always worked together and they have worked with the Foundation for a long time. Rosa Emelina sells plastic sachels. She had the need to seek a source of income to offset the expenses of her family. She has always enjoyed improving her business and is alert for ways to improve it. She has always fought to improve every day. The loan that she requests is for the purchase of supplies. Her friend Dolores sells general merchandise. She needs to invest in new products.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Magumagu

texts.en:
Magumagu F. is 75 and married with 5 children. She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale. Magumagu has 1 year of experience in this business. Magumagu needs a loan of WST$2500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 800 talas or US $333 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Magumagu joined SPBD. This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Magumagu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica vive en casa propia en la zona de san Martín de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada tiene tres hijos de 14,12 y 10 años de edad; el esposo trabaja como albañil, ella vende papa para ayudar a su hogar, no es cliente de impro y es primera vez que es cliente de Kiva.
El crédito es para compra de papa al por mayor de los productores para su venta posterior al consumidor.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs Verónica lives in her own home in the San Martin zone of the city of La Paz. She is married and has three children ages 14, 12 and 10. Her husband works as a bricklayer and she sells potatoes to help out. She is not a customer of Impro and this is her first loan with Kiva. This loan is for the purchase of potatoes at wholesale prices from the producers for her to later sell to customers. Due to her social character she can access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wholesale purchase of potatoes for sale to customers

loans.name: Sangeeta

texts.en:
Sangeeta is a resident of a city called Lahore which is the second largest city of Pakistan. She has lived in the area of Bahar-colony for past six years with her husband and two children. One of her children is receiving an education and attends kindergarten; the second one is not yet of school-going age.

Sangeeta is a nurse but she also does sewing work part-time to supplement her income. Her husband is in the musical profession but on a limited scale. He offers his music to different birthday parties and marriage functions. Currently, he has a CD player and two speakers with whom he plays the music and entertains his clients.

Sangeeta’s husband wants to buy a DJ sound system to improve his business for which Sangeeta has applied for a loan. This would be a first step towards him operating on a large scale and becoming renowned in this field.

Sangeeta is very sure that her husband will be able to increase his income with the help of this new sound system and by giving quality service. She mentioned that her husband has been doing this business for the past ten years and she is very hopeful about his great future.

This is Sangeeta’s second loan. She has been found to be a very good loan user of Asasah.

loans.use: To purchase a DJ sound system for her husband's business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of five school-age children.

He opened a mini-market as his own business so as to earn his own income to raise his big family. He has owned his small grocery store since 2004.

With his loan of $1,000 requested from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will increase his store’s inventory before the coming holidays. In the coming year, he expects that his business will continue to grow. 

It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets, selling perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. The strong network of community relationships is an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in smaller towns and villages.

loans.use: To increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak N., 56, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. N. sells traditional cakes for an income of USD 4 per day.

Prak N.’s husband is a motor-taxi driver, also earning an income of USD 4 per day. N. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

This is Prak N.’s second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband to improve his business

loans.name: Nayruth Noeli

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CLORINDA MATTO DE TURNER”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nayruth;  La socia tiene 19 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera  y tiene 1 hijo, La socia se dedica a l comercio minorista ella tiene un stand de venta de frutas al por menor en el mercado central de Calca. Ella requiere comprar de los proveedores al por mayor frutas para la venta final. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de frutas al por mayor de los proveedores. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nayruth belongs to the Clorinda Matto de Turner Communal Bank.  The bank is situated in the Calca district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Nayruth is 19 years old.  She is a single mother, and she has one child.  She is a small businesswoman.  She sells fruit for retail prices at her stand in the central market in Calca.  She needs the loan to buy fruit wholesale from providers so that she can sell the fruit at her stand.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy fruit wholesale from providers

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras De Yguazú Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Mujeres Luchadoras de Yguazú. Están en el Quinto Ciclo, con 14  integrantes. 
Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable y están muy satisfechas de pertenecer al programa comité de mujeres.
Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para pagar las cuotas.
El crédito para ellas les facilita mejorar sus emprendimientos ya no poseen capital para invertir, así como la señora Prisila quien solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosmético como maquillajes, cremas para la piel, aceites, perfumes y otros.
Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en sus ratos libres, su clientela la conforman amigas y vecinas quienes le piden los productos de acuerdo al mismo ella los retira.
A ella le gustaría en el futuro tener en su casa un salón de venta de cosméticos y ropas para trabajar mejor y obtener mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
The committee is called Mujeres Luchadores de Yguazú [Tenacious Women of Yguazú]. It is in its fifth loan cycle and has 14 members. 

The group stands out in its neighborhood for being close-knit, mutually supportive and responsible and they are highly satisfied at belonging to the Committee of Women program. 

The members are possessed of great enterprising spirit, since they are up-to-date with the payments and engage in business activities in order to raise funds for making the payments. 

The loan helps them improve their enterprises as currently they have no capital to invest. For example, Prisila, who is seeking the loan in order to purchase cosmetics such as makeup, creams for the skin, oils, perfumes and other items. 

She works selling cosmetics in her free time. Her customer base is made up of her friends and neighbors who ask her for products according to which she retrieves them. 

In the future she would like to have a venue for selling cosmetics and clothing out of her home in order to improve her work conditions and achieve better earnings.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, creams, oils, creams for the skin and other items

loans.name: Rubaga Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: Most people strain their nerves for years trying to find a settled means of subsistence. Three years ago is when 30-year-old amiable N. Annet set forth in her old or used clothes selling business in Jinja Town. This business, she says, has in many respects pushed the envelope for her in the shouldering of many of her family’s responsibilities. Annet says the need for self reliance was the motivation in starting this business. She says she knew beforehand that success would only be in her grasp if she worked vigorously at establishing a niche. $9 is what totals up as her weekly profits. Annet is a good natured mother of four, and with this loan she says she is going to purchase more bales of clothes for resale. She makes common cause with Rubaga Development Group-Jinja.

loans.use: The purchase of more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Pedro Humberto

texts.es: Pedro Humberto se dedica a la venta de gas butano. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio. El es un joven muy emprendedor, pues siempre está buscando la forma de proporcionarle a su familia el alimento diario ya que es un esposo y padre responsable al mismo tiempo. El tiene más de 3 años con este negocio, por lo que ha sido de gran  ayuda para salir adelante y fue por cuenta propia que logro aumentar su actividad. Ahora el solicita un crédito con el fin de comprar más tanques de gas, por lo que se acerca la época navideña y tiene varios pedidos.
texts.en: Pedro Humberto sells butane gas.  He has had this business for more than 3 years.  He is a very enterprising man and is always looking for ways to provide his family with their daily bread since he is a responsible husband and father.  He has been in this business for more than 3 years and it has been a great help in getting his family ahead.  He has managed to increase his business activity on his own.  He is now requesting a loan so that he can buy more tanks of gas as the Christmas period is approaching and he has a number of orders.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 30 years old. Josephine is married and has 3 children aged 13, 9 and 7. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Josephine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda A. is from the village of Panghiawan, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Merlinda is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Merlinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling Avon, Natasha & Personal Collection products in the local community. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Pedro Alejandrino

texts.es:
Pedro Alejandrino C. P. tiene 52 años, Es casado, vive con la esposa  y con los hijos,  vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD  se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a lobores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, maracuyá esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Pedro Alejandrino se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Viscarra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Escudero.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz, maracuyá. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Pedro Alejandrino C. P., 52, is married living with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  He has 3 children.

The “SEÑOR DE LA SALUD” (Lord of Health) communal bank is located in Soloma which is part of Echeandia canton.  The bank’s members are mostly short cycle corn, rice and passion fruit farmers.  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Pedro Alejandrino is a corn, rice and passion fruit farmer.  He buys his products at Comercial Viscarra and sells them at Comercial Ecudero.

He is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn, rice and passion fruit crops.  Support from the loan will help him meet his economic needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and climactic variations.  His dream is to buy a lot.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: For farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Leibnitz Marcelo

texts.es:
Leibnitz Marcelo M. A., tiene 35 años, vive en Unión Libre, vive con la conviviente y con los hijos en el  Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Temistocles perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembre de maíz y arroz.

Marcelo  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Leibnitz Marcelo M. A., age 35 años, is in a common-law marriage and lives with his partner and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. He has 2 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Narcisa de Jesus are located in the San Temistocles region, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Marcelo works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He buys and sells his products in stalls in the Peña shopping center and also sells them at home or in the market every day.

He is requesting this loan for sowing corn and buying supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to purchase a plot of land.
He enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Djekadi est un groupe constitué de 4 femmes mariées de Kimparana, préfecture de  SAN région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du MALI), qui vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles se sont connues à travers le voisinage, la  parenté, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, 6 enfants et font le commerce de condiments, de céréales et  de calebasses. Les membres de ce groupe ont intégré le programme de Soro Yiriwaso il y’ a 5 ans, elles sont à leur 9ème cycle. 
AFOU C. la vendeuse de céréales depuis plusieurs années   s’approvisionne auprès des producteurs dans les petits villages pour revendre en demi gros aux revendeurs qui viennent à la foire hebdomadaire de Kimparana. 
Elle achètera avec son prêt,  une tonne de petits mil, 0,5 tonnes de maïs  et 15 sacs de haricot. AFOU C. à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.  Elle vend en espèce et à crédit. 
Elle compte avoir mensuellement à un bénéfice de 31000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser la dette, subvenir aux besoins familiaux et réinvestir dans l’entreprise pour pouvoir l’agrandir.
texts.en:
Djekadi is a group made up of four married women from Kimparana, in the SAN prefecture, Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in large traditional families. They got acquainted through community ties and kinship, and average 39 years of age and six children. They sell food condiments, cereals, and calabashes. The members of this group joined the credit program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, five years ago, and are now seeking their ninth loan. 

AFOU C. has been selling cereals for several years, and gets her supplies from producers in small villages. She sells semi-wholesale to resellers who travel to the weekly fair in Kimparana.

With her loan, she will buy one ton of pearl millet, half a ton of corn, and 15 sacks of bean. AFOU C.'s clientele comprises both men and women. She sells for cash and on credit.

She intends to turn a monthly profit of XOF 31'000 (ca US$ 62), that she will use to repay the loan, provide for her family's needs, and reinvest in her business to expand it.

loans.use: To buy and resell cereals

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single man who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent.

He has operated a pig farming business for the past two years.  He also sells vegetables from his farm, which contributes to his other source of income. John faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand and supply vegetables in large markets. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase food for the pigs on the farm. He decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of loans.

loans.use: To purchase food stuff for pigs on the farm.

loans.name: Salifu

texts.en:
For the past six years, Salifu H. has run a business preparing millet porridge to offer for sale at Akaa Kkrom near Abura. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of millet to store for future use, as prices of goods keep increasing. She hopes eventually to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land. 

She is unmarried and has one child. As the sole breadwinner of the home, she provides for the needs of the family. 

Salifu is shown in the picture with the millet she uses to make her porridge.

loans.use: To buy more bags of millet to store for future use, as prices of goods keep increasing

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 46-year-old lady who runs a food stall business. She is married to Suhaemi, 52, and they have 3 children, namely: 
1. Zulkarnain, 25 years old 
2. Hendra, 19 years old
3. Tria W., 18 years old who is in the second semester of University – midwifery faculty

Salma and family are living in Tuak Daun Merah Village. She has been running the food stall business for 3 years. The food stall is situated near to the main road and about 2 km from her residence. Salma usually starts the business at 8 am and closes at 10 pm. In addition to selling rice and side dishes, Salma is also selling fried bananas, tofu and fermented soybean cake. 

Salma’s business is running well. There are a lot of customers who come to her food stall. Even so, Salma plans to improve her business by adding more items and purchasing more chairs. Customers want a variety of items so they will not get bored. She does not want to lose her customers. On the other hand, she also has to manage her money as well as her daughter – Tria needs money for her education fees especially for the practical exam fee. Salma is aware that both her business and Tria’s education are important.

In order to meet her business needs, Salma is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 IDR. With the loan, she would like to purchase various foodstuffs to cook and sell at her food stall and to purchase several new chairs. Salma really hopes TLM will support her in implementing her plan to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and several new chairs

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro is 44 years old, married and has two children. He lives with his family in a house that they own in the town of Annape. His community is located in the rural part of the Morrope district and is populated with humble and hardworking people dedicated mostly to agricultural activities.

For more than 10 years, Teodoro has earned a living by cultivating cotton. He performs this activity on a small plot of land located near his house. He learned this trade from his father, who provided him with significant experience and knowledge. The income from his business allows him to continue supporting his family financially.

Teodoro would like to purchase seeds and equipment so that he can plant an additional hectare of cotton. For this reason, he has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Teodoro is a hardworking man and a devoted father. He always watches over his family’s well-being and development. The people who know him have a lot of respect and affection for him.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and equipment to plant cotton

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. It is led by Mrs. Sokunthea, who has been selected by the other members. 

Mrs. Sokunthea was born in 1984. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school and one of whom is 2 years old.

She owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to earn some profit to support her family. She is also a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Chamroeun, is a door-to-door ice cream seller. He is also a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice to support his family. 

Since her husband’s business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Sokunthea is asking for a loan to buy another ice box. With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy a piglet for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy another ice box

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita B. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 61 years old, widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. Nita owns and operates a business making and selling homemade sausages (longganisa and chorizzo) and hopia (a bean filled pastry) in the local community. She also runs a retail store selling junk food and canned goods. Nita has been engaged in her businesses for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from them.

In 2008, Nita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional ingredients and to increase working capital. Nita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients such as ground meat, spices and food seasonings. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Nita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as ground meat, spices and food seasonings.

location.town: Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Agent immobilier et marié à une revendeuse, Ayao est père de 03 enfants à 37 ans.il s’est lancée depuis 2010 dans la restauration de poissons braisées et ce prêt lui servira à acheter  des poissons sur place pour sa restauration  et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Il a un talent culinaire caché et cette activité lui a fait découvrir cela.Il espère  que ce premier crédit l’aidera à redoubler sa clientèle et  favoriser ses dépenses journalières et celles de sa famille
texts.en: A real estate agent and married to a petty trader, Ayao is the father of three children and is 37 years old. He opened a little restaurant selling roasted fish in 2010, and this loan will allow him to buy fish locally for his restaurant and satisfy the demand of his clientele. He has quite a culinary talent and this business has made him discover that fact. He hopes that this first loan will help him to double his clientele and be favorable for his daily expenses and those of his family.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Abashizehamwe Group

texts.fr:
Justine est une commerçante âgée de 33ans qui habite la Commune de Rugombo à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle  fait le commerce de la bière locale de bananes depuis 2 ans et elle est en même temps cultivatrice. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants âgés respectivement de 14ans, 13ans, 8ans et 1an. Trois sont à l’école. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. 
 
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en produisant une grande quantite de biere locale de bananes et agrandir son activité pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Elle espère que son business va croitre considérablement pour lui permettre d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, pour vivre plus aisément et acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« Abashizehamwe».
texts.en:
Justine is a 33 years old merchant residing in Rugombo Township in western Burundi. She has been trading in local banana beer for two years, and simultaneously is a farmer. She is married and the mother of four children aged respectively 14, 13, 8 and 1. Three of the children attend school. She went to school up to sixth grade.
 
She is requesting a Kiva loan to increase her capital and produce a large quantity of local banana beer and expand her business to make large profits. She hopes that her activity will grow considerably, so that she can live more easily and purchase a lot on which to build her own house.

She is a member of the "Abashizehamwe" solidarity group.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to produce a large quantity of banana beer to sell

loans.name: Nonvignon-Ste Rita Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON-STE RITA est formé de trois  personnes qui habitent le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe nommée Fifonsi Hortense est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Fifonsi Hortense est née le 27 Novembre 1977 dans une ville du Bénin. Mariée à un coiffeur du nom de Ambroise, Fifonsi Hortense est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leur parents. Fifonsi Hortense a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a près de sept ans que Fifonsi Hortense mène comme activité la vente de charbon de bois, de pétrole et de boisson locale de F.çon secondaire. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins de ses enfants. Fifonsi Hortense achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Fifonsi Hortense désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON-STE RITA.
texts.en:
The NONVIGNON-STE RITA group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s third time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

Fifonsi Hortense, the group’s representative, has her hand raised in the photo. She was born on November 27, 1977 in a city of Benin. Hortense is married to a hairdresser named Ambroise, and she is the mother of two children, both in school. The whole family live together. Hortense herself quit school at the secondary level.   

She started selling charcoal and kerosene nearly seven years ago. As a sideline, she also sells a local beverage. These activities allow her to provide for her children without difficulty. She gets her merchandise in Benin. 

In an effort to replenish her stock and better meet customer demand, Hortense is seeking this new loan together with the other members of the NONVIGNON-STE RITA group.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, kerosene, and a local beverage for resale

loans.name: Si/11364 Group

texts.fr:
Mme R.Julie Pascaline représente le groupe LA GRACE. Elle est mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 6ans.2 de ses enfants vont a l’école et elle a 3 personnes a sa charge.

Elle vend du savon depuis 1an. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de toécé dans un village environnant. Ses clients son les femmes.

Mme veut acheter 2 cartons de savon local et un carton de savon importer.

Ses économies serviront à ouvrir un kiosque. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une alimentation et construire une maison.
texts.en:
Ms. R. Julie Pascaline represents the group LA GRACE. She is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is 6. Two of her children go to school. And she has three persons to support. She has been selling soap for a year. She gets her supplies at the Toécé market in a nearby village. Her customers are women.  She wants to buy two boxes of local soaps and a box of imported soap.

Her savings will serve to open a kiosk. Her ambition is to open a grocery store and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of local soap and a box of imported soap

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Jocelyn has a shop that sells candies, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads. Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos aún estudiando.  Julia solo estudió la primaria.
Junto a su esposo, la señora se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacunos, ovinos, también se dedica a venta de granos de la Región como quinua y cañihua.
Hace poco que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  ella requiere un préstamo de   S/ 300.00 nuevo soles,  dinero que utilizará para comprar tres arrobas de quinua, cañihua para venderlo en Ilo.  En el negocio la ayudan sus hijos y su esposo quien trabaja haciendo transporte en mototaxi en Puno.
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes y abastecerla con todos los insumos necesarios.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the communal bank “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medallion) located in the Pomata district in Chucuito province in the department of Puno.  She is 38-years-old, married, and has four children who are still in school.  Julia only attended primary school.  Alongside her husband, she works raising animals such as cattle and sheep and also works selling grains from the region like quinoa and cañihua (a nutritious grain closely related to quinoa).  

A little while ago she worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement.  She needs a loan for 300 nuevo soles.  This is money that she will use to buy three sackfuls (11.5 kilograms each) of quinoa and cañihua to sell in Ilo.  In the business her children help her and her husband, who works with a mototaxi in Puno, helps her also.

What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of getting loans.

loans.use: to buy three sackfuls (11.5 kilograms each) of quinoa and cañihua (a nutritious grain closely related to quinoa).

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a single parent taking care of one child. She has been through junior high school. Victoria displays toffees, biscuits, Milo (cocoa powder) and other types of provisions on a table for sale. Victoria will use the loan to purchase more provisions for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Victoria plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy, age 47, is a married woman who has been living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. One of her children is married and lives in a separate house, and the other two are attending school. 

To make a living, Mrs. Tuy has run a small business by selling some fresh fish which she gets from her husband fishing and also buy from other domestic fisherman in low price.   
From this business activity, the humble couple can earn around $4 per day to use in the daily expenses. Mrs. Tuy will be using a loan to purchase some plank for construction a new wooden house. With this loan, Mrs. Tuy said that she is very grateful to all lenders that support her family so she can use some loan fund to add with her current saving to build a new house.

For her future plan, She will buy a new boat to assist her husband business, to purchase build a bigger house and the most important thing, Mrs. Tuy hopes to use most of her income to support her children to finish at least high school level.

loans.use: to purchase some plank for construction a new wooden house.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
Judith  es una mujer D. 48 años D. edad, ella pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “Las Hormiguitas “la cual la integran 08 personas   entre hombres y mujeres, responsables y trabajadoras.
Judith se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, ese negocio comenzó gracias a que una  amiga le motivo para iniciar su propio negocio, poco a poco y con su carisma Judith ha podido captar  más clientes y D. ese modo ha mejorado sus ganancias. Judith  es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo el cual ha sido su motivación para seguir adelante, gracias a su esfuerzo Judith ha apoyado en su educación y mejorar su vivienda. Con  el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para invertir en sus productos comprando talco, colonias, cremas entre otros productos. A futuro Judith le gustaría tener restaurante donD. ofrezca variedades D. platos.
texts.en:
Judith’s a 48-year-old woman that belongs to the “Las Hormiguitas” (Little Ants) communal bank which has 8 members, both men and women, who are responsible and hardworking.

Judith sells beauty products, a business she started thanks to a girlfriend who motivated her to start her own business.  Little by little and with her charisma, Judith has managed to secure more customers thus improving her profits.  

Judith has a spouse and a son who is her motivation to continue forward.  Thanks to Judith’s efforts she is helping with his education and to improve her house.  With the goal of continuing to grow she is asking for a new loan to invest in her products buying talc, cologne and creams, among other products.  In the future, Judith would like to have a restaurant offering a variety of dishes.

loans.use: to buy creams, talc and perfume.

loans.name: Selvin Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor Selvin Mauricio se dedica desde hace 04 años al negocio de transporte (taxi) y en su casa tiene una pulpería en donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, su pulpería es atendida por un familiar mientras el todo los días sale desde muy temprano a la calle a buscar clientes que llevar en su taxi.
Selvin utilizara el credito para compra de computadora de su carro, tiene problemas con la misma y el carro esta fallando, en estos momentos lo tiene parado y no puede estar sin percibir esas ganancias ya que son las que utiliza para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Selvin Mauricio been in the taxi transportation business for four years. He has a grocery store in his house where he sells all sorts of household goods. His family runs the store while he goes out early every day looking for passengers to taxi. 

Selvin plans to use his loan to buy a computer for his car because his has problems and the car is breaking down. At this point the car is not working and Selvin can't be without the income because he needs it to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a car computer.

loans.name: Pancha Laxmi

texts.en:
Pancha Laxmi is 42 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 26, 22, and 21.  In 2005, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her shop.  In the future, Pancha Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene como actividad la venta D. dulces, refrescos, chocolates otros en su kiosco que esta ubicado dentro D. las instalaciones D. una institución publica del departamento D. La Paz, esta actividad la desarrolla D. lunes a viernes, constituyéndose en la principal fuente D. ingreso para ella y su familia que esta compuesta por ella y sus dos hijas, solamente son tres personas  ya que su esposo falleció hace dos años, cuenta la Sra. Martha que la perdida D. su esposo fue un golpe para ella pero supo salir adelante por el bienestar D. sus hijas, el destino del crédito es para la compra D. material D. construcción para la construcción  D. una habitación en la casa donD. vive ya que será para su hija  mayor que próximamente contraerá matrimonio, la Sra. Martha es un dedicada a sus hijas a pesar D. su trabajo siempre vela por su bienestar, ella es muy trabajadora y se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha has a business selling candy, soft drinks, chocolates, and other items from a kiosk located next to the facilities of a public institution in the Department of La Paz. She operates her business from Monday through Friday. It is the main source of income for herself and her family, which consists of Martha and her two daughters. There is only the three of them because her husband died two years ago. The loss of her husband was a huge blow to Martha, but she has been able to move forward for the sake of her daughters’ welfare.

This loan will be used to buy construction materials for building a room in the house where she lives. It will be for her older daughter who is getting married soon. Sra. Martha is very dedicated to her daughters despite having to work constantly to proviD. for their welfare. She is extremely hardworking and shows her appreciation for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room for her daughter.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie, a 40-year-old married mother of six children, two of whom attend school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has been selling RTW clothing in the Philippines for eight years. Now requesting  a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like pants, blouses, shoes etc. to sell, Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like pants, blouses, shoes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jhannina Jhaqueline

texts.es:
La Señora. Jhannina es socia del banco comunal Emprendedores del Futuro, vive  en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  desde diciembre de 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gente es muy amable, gentil y de un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora. Jhannina tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 15 y 14 años de edad que estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo  labora en la área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña Jhannina es consultora en la venta de productos Yanbal, actividad en la que lleva 4 años, trabaja 4 días a la semana sin un horario fijo. También trabaja para su hermana en la entrega de dulces a diferentes lugares, lleva un mes en esta actividad. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal.
 
Su meta es comprarse un terreno y sacarles adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jhannina is a member of the Emprendedores del Futuro Communal Bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has named a World Heritage Trust site in December of 1999.  The city has great architectural and natural beauty, and its friendly, kind, and warmhearted people preserve the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Jhannina is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are 19, 15, and 14 and who go to school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a builder.  They own the home they live in.

Jhannina is a sales consultant for Yanbal products.  She has been doing this for four years, working four days a week without a set schedule.  She also works for her sister delivering candy different places.  She has been doing this for one month.

This is her second loan cycle with the communal bank and she plans to use her loan to buy Yanbal brand cosmetics.

Her goal is to buy land and get her children ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy Yanbal brand cosmetics

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a business-lady who runs a beauty salon.  Her husband runs a taxi business.  She used her previous loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hair dryer.  Since then, she has been able to provide her services more efficiently. She has also added one employee to assist her in her business.

Damaris has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hair blow dryer and chairs.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dryer and chairs

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en: Feryal is a 28-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and one school-aged child. She has been working as a hairdresser and beautician from her home since 2006. She is much endowed at her work and has her loyal customers. As for her husband, he has been working as a salesman in a local company for the past seven years to supplement the family’s income. Today, she is asking to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a variety of cosmetics and hairdressing supplies so that she can comply with the demands of her customers. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty center.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics and hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with five children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the other three have completed school. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation.

Mwanatumu has operated as a small scale farmer keeping farm animals and also crop farming for the past ten years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 90,000 she wants to purchase a motorbike for her new motorbike transportation business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her new motorbike transportation business.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es: La señora Luz Mery a sus 44 años de edad es madre cabeza de familia y tiene de dos hijos de 26 y 15 años de edad. Es propietaria de una pequeña tienda la cual pudo adquirir gracias a un primo quien le presto el dinero para comprar surtido para su negocio. La tienda le permite a la señora Luz Mery obtener los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. La señora Luz Mery requiere de la compra de surtido tal como granos, aceites, detergentes y productos de aseo personal, que le permitan mejorar sus ventas y así la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Luz Mery es brindarle educación a sus hijos y tener su tienda bien surtida y con muchos clientes.
texts.en: Luz Mery is 44 years old and is a single mother with two children, who are 26 and 15 years old. She owns a small store, which she was able to purchase thanks to a cousin who lent her the money to buy various products for her business. The store allows Luz Mery to earn enough income to support her household. Luz Mery needs to buy a variety of products like grains, oil, detergent and personal hygiene products, which will allow her to improve her sales as well as her family's quality of life. Luz Mery's dreams are to provide her children with an education, to offer a wide variety of products in her store, and to have many customers.

loans.use: buy a variety of products like grains, oil, detergent and personal hygiene products

loans.name: Yony

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Yony; continua con su negocio de elaboración de pan para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes, la socia compra diferentes productos para la elaboración y fabricacion de de los panes productos como manteca, harina, azucar, levadura, el pago del horno y ella misma los elabora, la socia desea continuar su negocio y poder enviar los panes a la selva de perú donde tienen gran acogida; la socia en esta ocasión desea el credito para comprar ingredientes para la elaboración de panes.
texts.en: Yony continues with her business of making bread and distributing it to her customers. She buys different products for making and the bread, such as shortening, flour, sugar, yeast, and pays for use of the oven. She makes the breads herself. She wants to continue in her business and send the breads to the jungle in Perú, where they get a very favorable reception. This time she would like the loan so she can buy ingredients for making her breads.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Luis Javier

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Luis Javier; el tiene 23 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios para celulares, el socio tiene un stand  en un  centro comercial del Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar celulares y accesorios para celulares.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Javier belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Ccoyllorty Cachimayo" located in the district of Cachimayo, in the Anta province and the department of Cusco.  
 
Señor Luis Javier is 23 years old and single.  He alternates his daily activities with his business selling cell phones and cell phone accessories.  He has a stand in a shopping mall in Cusco.  He works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm.  He wants to get ahead through this business.  His dream is to expand and improve his business selling cell phones and accessories.  He is requesting a loan to buy cell phones and cell phone accessories.   

He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: purchase cell phones and cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Edilberto está casado con la Sra. Ilda  hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos menores que aun están en la escuela primaria.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que está ubicada en Ciudad del Este. Se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como empleados. Gracias al trabajo que están realizando  educan a sus hijos y le dan el sustento diario. El Sr. Edilberto además de la despensa trabaja como constructor de obra.
El solicita el crédito a kiva y la fundación paraguaya para la compra de arroz, fideo, azúcar y otros insumos de primera necesidad para abastecer su local. Agradece por la oportunidad que les da la fundación y kiva.
texts.en:
Edilberto has been married to Ilda for several years. They have 4 minor children who are still in primary school.

Together they opened a small store located in Ciudad del Este. They started with a little capital that they obtained from other jobs that they did before as employees. Thanks to the work they are doing, they are educating their children and supporting them. Edilberto, in addition to the store, works in construction. 

He is asking for the loan from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya to buy rice, pasta, sugar and more basic necessity items to stock his locale. He is grateful for the opportunity given to them by Foundation and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, sugar and more.

loans.name: Badinya De Solico Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tonia Foo est né depuis la création du banc villageois Soliko le 02 Avril 2007. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Lao,(assise à l’extrême droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53ans, est mariée et mère de 06 enfants, elle a aussi à sa charge 05 de ses petits fils. Elle vendeuse de divers produits alimentaires (kola, thé, sucre) qu’elle achète au marché hebdomadaire. Activité qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter du sucre, du thé et de la kola destinés à la revente.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge alimentaire et scolaire de ses petits fils et enfants.
texts.en:
The group Tonia Foo was created at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois Soliko on April 2, 2007. It consists of 13 women who live in the same village and whose main activity is small trade.  

Mrs. Lao (sitting at the far right) is the head of the group. She is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She also takes care of 5 of her grandsons. She has been selling various food items such as kola, tea and sugar for several years. She buys her merchandise at the weekly market. 

She will use this loan to buy sugar, tea and kola for resale. The profits earned will allow her to assist her husband in providing for the needs of their children and grandsons with respect to food and tuition.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea and kola for resale.

loans.name: Aman

texts.en:
Aman lives in bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 38 year, marriage, and has six children; four of them are still in school. 

Aman heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 37 years old and lives in Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.

Gloria catches and sells fish for a living and has been doing this for 17 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing materials. She has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

In the future, Gloria hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is 64 years old and has seven children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though John is the only one featured in the picture, he is actually representing his group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

John started working alongside One Acre Fund in 2011. He did so because he wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family. This year, he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

John’s group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of six acres of land.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Mrs Út is married with 2 children in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 
Her circumstances is the most difficult in this group. Her husband and two children are Agent Orange victims. She must work hard everyday to foster her family and weak mother-in-law. Her main income is from agriculture work rising baby poultry, in addition, she farms rice and vegetable for more income. Now she want to purchase baby cow to raise and sell in future, but the main hardship that Út faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan from THanh Hóa microfinance institution.
With the business profit, Út hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, husband and mother-in-law, and to improve quality life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baby cow to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
My name is Guadalupe H. and I produce as well as sell tortillas. I have had my business for 5 years and I have many clients, as I am located near to another large business. My tortillas sales generate an income enough to support my family and my goal is to increase production so as to increase sales. With the added earnings I would remodel my home and give a better education to my children.

Mi nombre es Guadalupe H. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que tengo mi lugar de venta cerca de una empresa, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi produccion para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa de habitacion y darles un mejor estudio a mis hijos.

loans.use:
To purchase cornflour, lime, salt, water, firewood and matches

Compra de harina de maiz, agua, sal, cal, leña, fosforos

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. O. owns a business that offers printing and copying services, a field he has worked in for more than 20 years. He is a married father of 4 children. Through Prisma, he plans to use the loan money to buy materials like ink, paper, printer parts, etc. so that his company can fill customer orders. This economic support will help him increase income and afford his family a more comfortable life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. O. es propietario de una imprenta y labora en este campo desde hace más de 20 años. Es casado y padre de 4 hijos, el dinero que le pueda proporcionar Prisma lo utilizaría en la compra de materiales como Tinta, papelería, repuestos para sus impresoras, etc. para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes. Este apoyo económico le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y brindar más comodidad a sus familiares.

loans.use: To buy materials in order to fill customer orders.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is 46 years old. She was born in Parras, Coahuila but when she was young her family moved to Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon on account of her father's job. Their financial circumstances allowed her only a secondary education, but this hasn't held her back.
