She took to sales when she was young and started her own business, at first selling goods out of catalogs, then little by little saving up so she could open a grocery store. Through hard work and dedication she has succeeded. She has four children and she has taught them the value of hard work. At this time, Silvia is asking for a loan of $475 to buy merchandise. She would like to offer her customers more variety. With your help, she can achieve great things. She and her family appreciate your confidence and support.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Silvia tiene 46 años de edad, ella nació en Parras, Coahuila, desde muy pequeña, por cuestiones de trabajo de su padre, tuvo que cambiarse de domicilio a la ciudad de Guadalupe, Nuevo León. La situación económica de sus padres solo le permitió terminar la educación secundaria, lo cual no a sido un limitante para ella, ya que desde joven empezó a desarrollar su gusto por las ventas e inició su propio negocio, primero con la venta de productos por catálogo y poco a poco fue ahorrando para lograr poner su tienda de abarrotes que con base en mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado sacar adelante.

Ella tiene 4 hijos, a los que ha enseñado que el trabajo constante es lo básico para obtener mejores oportunidades. Ahora Silvia necesita de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder incrementar la variedad que ofrece a sus clientes y ofrecer un mejor servicio. Silvia podrá hacer grandes cosas con tu ayuda, ella y su familia agradecen tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
Zamira`s mother used to be the one who was in business, and Zamira only helped. After finishing school and not having found work, however, Zamira began to spend all her time working at their market stall. One year ago their whole inventory consisted only of Tajik galoshes. Gradually Zamira has been able to expand her business so that their inventory now includes ready-made dresses and notions.

As Zamira is only 20 years old and not yet married, she lives with her parents and her business is one of the sources of income for her family.

Zamira is trying to increase the profitability of her business and consequently, one year ago, she took a loan from MicroInvest. She says this has given a boost to her business and provided her the opportunity to make additional profit.

To purchase goods, Zamira goes to wholesale markets in Istaravshan and Karosuu, Kyrgyzstan. To travel to Karosuu it is necessary to take roundabout roads because on the way, there is a border with Uzbekistan. Travel across that border is forbidden for citizens of Tajikistan. But Zamira manages to go to Karosuu anyway, because goods are cheaper there.

Now it's the summer season and Zamira wants to further expand her inventory. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to be repaid over a period of 12 months. (The lady in the photo is Zamira`s mother.)

loans.use: expand her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila is a married woman with three children whose husband is a truck driver. However, in spite of that, his job is very tiring, it keeps him away from home, and he makes very little money. In addition, he is losing a lot of time that he could spend with his children and attend their events at school. Domitila isn't defeated by this obstacle and always tries to raise her children well and continue moving forward. Therefore, she looked for a job that wouldn't take her out of the house all day so she could be with her children so they wouldn't feel so alone and so at the same time, she could make some money. This was how she started to sell shoes from a catalog. Little by little, she has been looking for new customers so that she can contribute to the expenses in the absence of her husband.

Lately, the situation in her house has become very difficult because her husband's trips have been longer, keeping him away from home for longer periods of time. Because of this, she had to use her earnings to feed her children and today she has no money to be able to restock with new products to sell. Therefore, Domitila is asking for a loan of $375 that she will pay back in in 6 months. She will use this money to buy merchandise for the winter season. WIth your help, Domiltila will be able to help her family during this time of need.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Domitila, es una mujer casada y con tres hijos, su esposo trabaja como chofer de trailer, sin embargo a pesar de que el trabajo de su esposo es muy desgastante y se la pasa fuera de la casa, el dinero que gana es muy poco, además de que pierde todos esos momentos que pudiera pasar con sus hijos, y asistir a sus eventos escolares. Domitila no se deja vencer por este obstáculo y siempre trata de sacar adelante a sus hijos, por lo tanto buscó un trabajo que no le quitara todo el día, para poder convivir con sus hijos y no se sientan tan solos, y obtener ganancias al mismo tiempo, así fue como comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, y poco a poco a ido buscando nuevas clientas, para que ella pueda aportar a los gastos que suceden en ausencia del esposo.

Estos últimos días, la situación en su casa se a vuelto muy difícil, porque los viajes de su esposo se hicieron más lejos y los días que se queda fuera del hogar son más. Así que tuvo que utilizar sus ganancias para darle de comer s sus hijos y hoy no tiene dinero para poder surtir nuevos productos que ofrecer, Por lo tanto Domitila está solicitando un crédito de US $ 375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y ese dinero utilizarlo para comprar mercancía para la temporada de invierno. Con tu ayuda Domitila podrá sacar adelante a su familia de esta temporada de escasez.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth belongs to the Communal Bank Las Activas, she lives in Asentamiento Humano Señor D. los Milagros Jr. Pachacutec Mz A1 Lt. 06, Calleria district, Ucayali state. She is 52 years old and mother of 7 children, her husband is a motocycle-taxi driver, but the income doesn't meet the household expenses. So Elizabeth, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for 300 Soles (US$100.00), decided to put a small chicken retail stand in the Bellavista market.

Because of her business she gets up at 1 AM to go and purchase the chickens in order to be able to sell them starting at 5 AM. Sales normally finish at 1 PM, then she goes home to rest and prepare to do it all again the next day.

With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos for 1000 Soles (approximately US$334), which will be repaid in 5 months, she will increase her usual purchase, now she will buy 70 chickens daily, and thereby increase her income.

Elizabeth is very happy to see her business prosper, as that is an important achievement for her, and thanks to this success she has helped her family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elizabeth pertenece al Banco Comunal las Activas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Señor D. los Milagros Jr. Pachacutec Mz A1 Lt. 06, del distrito Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 52 años D. edad y es madre D. 7 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Elizabeth, con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300.00 (US$100.00) deciD. poner una pequeña tienda D. venta D. pollos en el mercado Bellavista.

Debido a su negocio, se levanta a la 1 D. la mañana para ir a comprar las javas D. pollo y así poder iniciar la venta D. los mismos a partir D. las 5 a.m. La venta, normalmente termina a la 1 p.m., luego se dirige a su domicilio para descansar y prepararse para la rutina del día siguiente.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,000 (US$ 334.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, incrementará la compra habitual D. pollos, ahora comprará 70 pollos a diario, D. esta manera incrementará sus ingresos.

Elizabeth está muy contenta D. ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella, gracias a éste ha alcanzado el bienestar D. su familia.

loans.use: Purchase butchered chickens

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny has been back from Brazil for six months, here he worked as a tailor next to his wife; he returned to Bolivia in order to care for their young child. He works on his own making clothes, this is their main source of income. They live in the Villa Santa Rosa zone of El Alto city.

The credit he requests is to purchase a sewing machine which will help him keep up with the demands of his job.

This is his first credit with Impro, the evaluation he received allowed him to get the necessary credit.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Jhonny hace 6 meses que volvió de Brasil donde trabajo como costurero junto a su esposa; por el bienestar de su pequeño hijo retornaron a Bolivia para trabajar por cuenta propia como confeccionistas de prendas de vestir, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su familia; vive en la Zona Villa Santa Rosa de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requiere para comprar una maquina recta de coser misma que le ayudara para satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Jhonny.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine for his workshop

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam (his son is pictured) was born in 1958,  has 2 children and lives in Khachmaz region. 2 years ago Islam and his son started a business selling phone accessories.  Now this family needs a loan of $725 to buy additional phone accessories to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Hiệu, 37 years old, has been a member of the TYM Fund for nine years. She’s been taking out loans from the Fund to invest in her glove making business. Her steady income is convenient for the weekly repayment plan. Her daily income is from 3 to 4USD. Her youngest son, 10 years old, helps his mom after school somewhat. She is applying for a loan of 325USD to buy material. She lives with her husband and two children in Ý Yên, Nam Định.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hoàng Thị Hiệu, 37 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 9 của Quỹ Tình thương. Trong các năm tham gia, chị thường sử dụng đồng vốn vay vào việc mua vải may găng tay. Đây là một công việc mang lại thu nhập thường xuyên rất thuận lợi cho việc trả tiền tuần. Thu nhập từ việc bán găng tay mỗi ngày khoảng 3-4USD. Con út của chị Hiệu năm nay lên 10 tuổi, ngoài giờ đi học cũng giúp đỡ mẹ ít nhiều. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay thêm 325USD về mua vải. Chị Hiệu hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại ý Yên, Nam Định.

loans.use: Buy clothes to make gloves

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Five years ago, Alejandro C. started selling jewelry through catalogue. He had to do this because he could not find a job and he needed an income to cover his expenses. Thanks to his hard work, he has made his business grow and currently has very good sales.

He is now requesting a loan for US $475, which he will pay in 6 months, to buy merchandise to sell and show, because given the nature of his business, many customers make up their mind when they see the jewelry physically and not through the catalogue. With your support Alejandro will be able to keep his business going.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Alejandro C. hace 5 años inicio la venta de joyería por catalogo esto tuve que hacerlo debido que no encontraba trabajo, y necesitaba un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos. Gracias a su empeño ha hecho crecer su negocio y actualmente tiene buenas ventas.

Ahora solita un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía para venta y exhibición ya que dada la naturaleza del negocio, muchos clientes se deciden hasta que ven las joyas físicamente y no por catalogo. Con tu apoyo Alejandro seguirá adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Comprar mercancia)

loans.name: Brigido

texts.es:
Brigido Jimenez is 54 years old and has been married to Maria Margarita Gaona for 47 years. They have eight children, two of whom are still in school. The others are older and work in the neighbouring country of Argentina.

For 35 years Brigido has been selling local traditional handicrafts such as bedspreads decorated with embroidery and povvy (a special Paraguayan sewing technique), and hammocks. He transports them to sell in Ciudad Del Este, a city located about four hours from Carapeguá.

His beautiful products are much sought after, especially by the tourists who visit our country. His wife is an artisan, and she makes the blankets, hammocks, and bedspreads which Brigido sells. Because of this highly valued and demanding work, he has been able to buy a motorcycle which he uses to take his merchandise to market. He has also purchased a car so that his family can travel in comfort, and he can make his sales even on cold and rainy days.

He is asking for a loan to buy cotton thread of various colours so that his wife can continue making her beautiful crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Brigido Jimenez tiene 54 años de edad está casado hace más de 31 años con la Sra. Maria Margarita Gaona de 47 años de edad, tienen 8 hijos dos en etapa escolar y los otros todos ya mayores de edad y que actualmente se encuentran trabajando en el vecino país Argnetina.

El señor Brigido hace 35 años que se dedica a la venta de productos artesanales y que son tradicionales de la zona como sobrecamas elaborados de hilo y poyvy (técnica de costura paraguaya) y hamacas que lleva a vender por la zona de Ciudad Del Este que es una ciudad que queda a cuatro horas de viaje desde Carapeguá.

Sus productos son muy queridos y apreciados, especialmente por turistas que visitan nuestro país. Su esposa es artesana y ella elabora las frazadas, hamacas y colchas para que Brigido las venda. Gracias a este trabajo honrado y sacrificado, pudo comprarse una motocicleta lo cual utiliza para vender sus mercadería, además también compró un auto para la comodidad de su familia y de sus ventas en los días de frío y lluvia.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos de algodón de distintos colores con los que su esposa podrá seguir trabajando elaborando sus hermosas artesanías.

loans.use: To buy coloured cotton thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Funds will be invested to purchase various items to boost a grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz and her family work day and night at the chores required of people who farm and raise livestock, chores that she's been doing for 12 years. She has two children and her hard work is for them. Farming chores are difficult and tiring because they require working the soil in the hot sun and tending to the needs of farm animals. All this work for a woman on her own is exhausting but Luz has to do it because it is how she supports herself and her children. In order to improve her crop production, she needs to buy seeds, fertilizer and other things. Feed for the animals that she's raising, for example. Put your trust in her work and give her your support.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Luz, una madre de familia que trabaja constantemente en las tareas de agricultura y ganadería, labor a la cual se viene dedicando 12 años de su vida. Ella tiene dos hijos y ellos son el motivo de su esfuerzo diario. Las tareas del campo son arduas y muy cansadas ya que tiene que labrar la tierra bajo en sol extenuante y por otro lado sacar a pastear su ganado. Todas estas labores para una mujer sola son agotadoras, pero Luz debe hacerlas porque de ello depende el sustento de su casa. Para mejorar la producción de sus cultivos ella necesita comprar más semillas, abonos y demás. Además de la alimentación para los animales que ella cría. Confía en su trabajo y bríndale tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve quality of farm crop.

loans.name: Abimbola

texts.en: Abimbola T. is 35 years old and married with two children.  She learned this trade for two years before setting up her own business in 1993.  Abimbola sells soft drinks, and she is also a hair stylist.  She needs the loan amount of $600 to buy more materials like hair oil, relaxer, hair extensions, and weaves for hair styling.  Abimbola said this will prevent customers from going elsewhere.  She figures that in the long run this will go a long way to increase her profit margin, as one need not depend on only one line of business.

loans.use: To purchase more hair styling materials

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.ru:
Мирзоев Амриддин молодой, но уже преуспевающий предприниматель. Ему  20 лет и он  холост. Амриддин торгует мужской одеждой на рынке "Панджшер"  г. Душанбе. У него 5 лет опыта в этой деятельности и начал бизнес со своим другом.  В его ассортименте большой выбор одежды для молодого поколения.  Строгие, деловые сорочки и стильные, спортивные одежды для мужчин. Этим делом он помогает своим родителям, внося свой вклад в семейный бюджет.  
Файзулло нужны средства для приобретения межсезонных мужских одежд и он хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Amriddin M. is young, but is already a successful entrepreneur. He is 20 years old and is a bachelor. Amriddin sells men’s clothing at the “Pandzhsher” market in Dushanbe. He has 5 years of experience in this area and started the business with his friend. He has a large selection of products targeted at the young generation. He sells conservative, business shirts and stylish sportswear for men.

Amriddin’s business allows him to help his parents and to contribute to the family budget. He needs a loan in order to purchase mid-season men’s clothing; he would like to take out a loan for 2000 somoni for a 6 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
Blanca es casada y madre de 2 hijos de 04 y 06 años. Ella inició el negocio como apoyo hacia su esposo, ya que el trabaja como empleado en una empresa y en ocasiones es difícil solventar los gastos del hogar con un solo sueldo, es por eso que inicio su negocio de venta de zapatos, al principio vendiendo sobre pedidos pequeños y posteriormente surtió pedidos por quincena de mas cantidad.

Actualmente necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 3 meses tener surtido de zapatos y promover mas los tenis para la temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Blanca is married and mother to two children, ages 4 and 6. She began her business as a support to her husband as he works as an employee in a business and on occasion it is difficult to meet their household expenses with just one income. Therefore she began her business selling shoes, at first selling through small orders and later she fulfilled larger quantity orders every couple weeks. Today she needs a loan for US $325, which will be repaid in 3 months, to stock her shoes and sell more athletic shoes for the upcoming winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.ru:
Каюмова Зулфинисо, ей 48 лет и она замужем. У нее 3 детей. Зулфинисо начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. В бизнесе она вот уже 13 лет. Она торгует на рынке «Мубориз» Гисарского района детскими одеждами. В ее ассортименте имеются спортивные костюмы, джинсовые брюки и костюмы, футболки, свитера и джемпера. С наступлением осени увеличивается спрос на осеннее - зимнюю форму, чего у нее мало. Прошлогодние остатки товаров в меньшем количестве и Зулфинисо хочет обновить свой товар. Покупает товар в оптовом рынке Корвон и у поставщиков из Китая. 
Зулфинисо хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 3000 сомони чтоб закупить осенний товар, спортивные костюмы.
texts.en:
Zulfiniso K. is 48 years old and married. She has three children. Zulfiniso started her own business selling children's clothing and has been in this business for thirteen years. She sells on the Muboriz market of the Gissar region. Her inventory includes sports wear, jean pants and suits, t-shirts, sweaters and pull-overs. With the coming of autumn the demand for the autumn-winter clothes increases and she does not have very many in stock. She only has last year's leftovers in small quantities and Zulfiniso wants to update her inventory. She buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Korvon and from suppliers from China.

Zulfiniso wants to get a loan with the help of Kiva for 3000 somoni (USD$900) to buy autumn merchandise and sports wear.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sports wear

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem M., 42, and her husband are farmers in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, growing rice and raising pigs on a plot of land behind their house. They have three children, all students. They started planting rice in 1999, and their output is just enough to support their family members. This couple grows rice twice a year, first during the rainy season, which requires six to seven months before harvesting, and second during the dry season, which requires three to four months.

Khem M. is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fertilizers and good rice seed to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and good rice seed to grow.

loans.name: Kokou Mawuenyégan

texts.fr:
Agée de 43 ans, Monsieur A. Kokou Mawuenyégan est né à Fiokpo dans la préfecture de Kloto. Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants, il est actuellement domicilié à Kpémé. Il arrive à joindre les deux bouts en s’adonnant au commerce de produits et médicaments génériques. Il est à noter qu’il a une bonne réputation et une bonne maîtrise de la gestion de son activité.
Il sollicite un financement pour l’achat d’autres produits génériques recherchés par sa clientèle. Cela augmentera son chiffre d’affaires, son revenu et lui permettra d’assurer la scolarisation et l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou Mawuenyégan A., 43, was born in Fiokpo in the prefecture of Kloto. Married and the father of 4 children, he presently lives in Kpémé. He manages to make ends meet by selling generic medicines and such. It should be noted that he has a good reputation and a good mastery of the management skills necessary for his business.

He is requesting a loan to buy other generic products his clientele has asked him for. This will increase his turnover and allow him to pay the school fees and assure the future of his children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of generic medicines

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received no formal education. Grace sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen. She brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at the sea side in Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a fisherman. Grace uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Grace will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to save towards a house which she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Lludy

texts.es:
La señora Lludy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el futuro II”, vive en el Jr. Tomas Villacorta Nº 371, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 26 años y es madre de 1 niño, es conviviente su pareja se dedica a la docencia en una institución publica. Lludy con el primer prestamo de S/300 decide invertir en abarrotes para venderlos a los vecinos del lugar.

Actualmente cuenta con una pequeña bodega poco surtida, donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, además productos de belleza, lo que genera ingresos diariamente que le permiten pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/.700.00 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara 1 saco de arroz, aceite en caja, detergente de todos los tamaños y marcas, frutas y verduras para surtir un poco más el negocio.

Lludy manifiesta sentirse mejor por la oportunidad que le da Manuela Ramos para crecer como mujer y empresaria que es lo que desea ser en el futuro.
texts.en:
Ms. Lludy is a member of the “Mujeres para el futuro II” (Women for the Future II) microfinance institute. She lives in the Tarapoto district of the department of San Martin. She is a 26-year-old mother with a one-year-old son. Her live-in partner works as a teacher in a public institution. Lludy decided to invest her first 300.00 PEN loan in purchasing provisions to sell them to the local residents.

She currently has a mini market in which she sells only a few goods, such as basic need items and beauty products, which generates a daily income for her that helps her repay her loan punctually.

With this 700.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, a box of cooking oil, assorted brands and sizes of detergent, fruits and vegetables in order to better stock her business. Lludy states that she feels good about the opportunity to grow as a female entrepreneur—which is what she wants to be in the future—that Manuela Ramos has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, cooking oil, detergent, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Asrop

texts.id:
Asrop sudah terbiasa bangun pagi hari untuk mempersiapkan barang –barang yang menjadi dagangannya. Memasak nasi,sayur dan aneka lauk-pauk untuk berjualan dipasar pagi .kemudian bergegas menuju kepasar Jembrana dengan menbawa sepedaa motonya.Asrop biasa berjualan nasi bungkus di pasar pada pukul 5.00 sedang pulang dari jualan setelah barang dagangan sudah habis terjual,biasanya pada pukul 9.00 wita juga sudah ada dirumah untuk membatu kesibukan istrinya yang mempunyai usaha warung kecil dirumahnya.

Yang menjadi pelanggan warung nasi Asrop di pasar jembrana adalah sesama pedagang yang biasa berjualan bersama dipasar.
Setelah dapat melunasi pada pinjaman terdahulu kemudian Asrop kembali melanjutakan pinjamannya.Yayasan DINARI masih tetap melayani pinjaman sepanjang masih memerlukan dana untuk keperluan usaha warungnya. Dari hasil keuntungan usahanya Asrop dapat membiayai anaknya terakhinya yang sudah sekolah pada tingkat atas.
texts.en:
Asrop is used to getting up early to prepare goods for his trade. Cooking rice, vegetables and a variety of side dishes to be sold in the morning market then hurry to the market Jembrana using a motorcycle. Asrop usually sells wrapped rice in the market from 5 and return after having sold all his goods usually at 9, then back home to help his wife with the small stall at home. The customers of Asrop rice stall in the market Jembrana are his fellow regular traders in the market. After repaying the earlier loan Asrop once again continue her loan. DINARI foundation is still providing loan during the period when funding is required for his stall business. From the profit Asrop is able to pay for his youngest child’s education, now in high school.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: be the capital

loans.name: Fenm Vayanor “Valiant Women” Group

texts.en:
The “Fenm Vayan” or “Valiant Women” Group is a made up of twenty-five male and female entrepreneurs, twenty of which are taking out a second loan.

After successfully repaying their first loan, they are looking forward to continued success and growth in their businesses.  Their businesses range from used clothing and jewelry, food sales, to charcoal production and sales.

Jina J. is one of four representatives of the group. She is married with two children, ages 7 and 1.5 years old.
She sells used footwear and used clothing that she buys in bulk from the Dominican Republic to sell in her local marketplace.  Jina used her first loan to increase her inventory because there is more of a profit margin when she buys in bulk.  She dreams of expanding her business to to sell in multiple cities and hire employees.  On behalf of Jina, Fenm Vayan, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: Buy used clothing, sandals, shoes, and jewlery.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
El negocio de la señora Patricia C. es un pequeño salón de belleza ubicado en la ciudad de Chinandega donde lo atiendo todos los días y brindando los servicios de estilista y cosmetóloga a sus clientes tales como niños, damas y caballeros en general.

Ella se ha destacado en su comunidad por ser muy conocedora en el ramo de la belleza y es por esta razón que los clientes le buscan. Por este motivo es que ella comprometida con dichos clientes busca la manera de cómo suplir sus necesidades y brindar un buen servicio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de trabajo como lo son peines, cremas, gelatinas, guantes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Patricia C.'s business is a small beauty salon located in the city of Chinandega. She attends to it everyday, offering stylist and cosmetology services to her customers, such as children, women and gentlemen in general.

She stands out in the community for being very knowledgeable in the beauty field, which is why customers come to her. For this reason she is committed to serving her customers, looking for ways to better meet their needs and offer the best service possible. She has gone to Ceprodel to request a loan, so that she can buy work materials such as combs, creams, gels and gloves, amongst other things.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase work materials

loans.name: Saiburkhon

texts.en:
S. Saiburkhon is 50 years old and married with three children.

Nine years ago, Saiburkhon decided to start his own business selling carpets. He began his own business with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He is familiar with this business and provides good customer service. He has many clients, and his business keeps growing.

In order to increase the range of his carpets, he now needs a loan of $3000 which he will use to purchase more inventory. He commits to repay this amount within 12 months. Be a part of this business and of Saiburkhon's family by supporting his growing business. They greatly appreciate it!


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes 18 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, it can obtain larger sums and a short term for financing their businesses. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in weekly rural markets and fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Nermina

texts.en:
Nermina D. is 28 years old and comes from Gradačac. She is employed in a boutique and besides that, she resells clothes and shoes at the market and on order. She has been our client for a long time; this will be her third loan through WWI.

Nermina used the first loan to purchase poultry for resale; the second one was invested in clothing inventory. She is a young girl who wants to earn for her later life and provide a good life standard for herself. Nermina requested 500 KM to by clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to resell
